loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 45 años vive en Atlántida Honduras, se dedica junto a su familia a la Agricultura de hortalizas, granos básicos y café. Durante mucho tiempo han tenido que esforzarse para tener el patrimonio con el que hoy cuentan, ya que la agricultura requiere de muchos sacrificios como levantarse muy temprano por las mañanas, tarea que es muy complicada para Juan, ya que a esa hora aun esta oscuro y como en la comunidad donde vive no hay acceso a energía eléctrica por lo que  se le dificulta poder hacerlo de la mejor manera ya que debe salir preparado y esto incluye la elaboración de sus alimentos que a su esposa se le complica al no tener buena iluminación, ya que debe alumbrarse con lámparas a base de querosén y velas. Asimismo Juan y su familia deben recorrer largas distancias para poder cargar sus teléfonos celulares lo cual le genera un costo adicional. Por estas razones Juan que busca darle un buen futuro a su familia solicita este préstamo a Soluz Honduras para adquirir un sistema solar y que este pueda brindarles una mayor calidad de vida al tener buena iluminación y ahorro en la compra de lámparas que han sido perjudiciales para su salud.
texts.en: Juan is 45 years and lives in Atlantida, Honduras. He works with his family in the business of growing vegetables, basic grains and coffee. During a long time they have had to work hard to have the assets they own today, because farming demands many sacrifices such as getting up very early in the morning. This is difficult for Juan because at that time it is still dark, and also because there is no electrical energy in the community where he lives. Because of this, it is difficult to do so. He needs to get ready, which also pertains the food preparation his wife finds difficult because of the lack of light. They need to use kerosene lamps and candles for lighting. Additionally, Juan and his family must travel long distances to charge their cell phones, all which generates additional costs. For these reasons, Juan is looking to offer his family a good future. He is requesting this loan to Soluz Honduras to buy a solar system to offer a better quality of life by having good lighting and saving in purchasing lamps which have been damaging to their health.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for lighting which will contribute to improve his family's life condition.

loans.name: Las Ñustas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS ÑUSTAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yanet Luzmila ella es soltera y tiene 55 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de internet.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Las Ñustas community bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Yanet Luzmilla. She's single and 55 years old. She works in a grocery store, selling staple products like rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She worked from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m.

She's been in this business for five years and it's going well for her. Her dream is to grow her grocery store business. She's seeking the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

The other members earn a living in businesses selling crafts, clothing, grocery store and Internet. The member thanks those who are part of this dream through this medium and promises to comply with loan payments in the established term.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felisa is 56 years old and has one child in school.

Felisa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Felisa requested a PHP 29500 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell.

Felisa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Felisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Lo Tuoi's Group

texts.en:
Tuoi, born in 1975, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has four members including her husband and her two sons, living in Mai Son district in Son La province. Her family’s main occupation is farm cultivation and animal breeding, and their income is just enough to cover basic living expenses for the family and to save a small amount.

Tuoi wants to buy fertilizer for their coffee cultivation but their saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the coming crop of coffee. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that, thanks to the loan amount, her family can tend the coffee field well and this year the coffee crop can bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Iris

texts.es: Iris de 23 años es una joven madre de familia muy emprendedora tiene dos hijos y desde hace 7 años se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ganadería y actualmente tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de consumo que ha logrado con  esfuerzo propio y la ayuda de  su esposo quien trabaja fuera del país y le aporta mensualmente  para el crecimiento del mismo. En la comunidad de Trujillo, Honduras donde vive Iris no hay acceso a energía eléctrica, por lo cual los productos que necesitan  refrigeración ella debe mantenerlos en hieleras para que no se dañen, esto  se le hace muy difícil ya que debe estar comprando hielo y gas para mantenerlos fríos y recorrer largas distancias a la comunidad más cercana con acceso a energía para adquirirlos. Por estas razones Iris solicita a Soluz Honduras un préstamo para poder adquirir un sistema solar para congelación que le permitirá tener un ahorro en compra de hielo y podrá servir mejor a su comunidad ya que tendrá más variedad de productos como carnes, pollo, embutidos y refrescos lo cual además le generara mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Iris is 23 years old. She is a young mother from a very entrepreneurial family. She has 2 children and for the last 7 years she has earned a living in agriculture and ranching. She currently has a small business selling consumer products that has succeeded with her own efforts and the help of her husband, who lives out of the country and provides monthly for its growth.

In the community of Trujillo, Honduras, where Iris lives, there is no access to electric power. Therefore, she must keep the products that need refrigeration in refrigerators so that they do not spoil. This makes it very difficult for her since she has to be buying ice and gas to maintain the cold and go long distances to the closest community with energy access to acquire them.

For these reasons, Iris is asking Soluz Honduras for a loan to be able to acquire a solar power system for freezing. It will allow her to have savings from buying ice and to be able to better serve her community since she will have more variety of products, like meats, chicken, cold cuts, and sodas which further generate better income for her.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for a freezer that will help her to obtain better income in her business and to give better service to her clients.

loans.name: Dairiimaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dairiimaa, 40 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Using her previous loan, she has purchased a light truck, and delivery of fruits to retailers got easier and her business is going well.

Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for a house renovation. By doing so her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutant into air.

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Las Amigas De San Antonio Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 5 mujeres emprendedoras  y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal “LAS AMIGAS DE SAN ANTONIO”. Una de ellas es la Sra. Macedonia  de 42 años de edad separada  y madre de 3 hijos. La Sra. Macedonia   es una mujer muy emprendedora que debido  de sus esfuerzos a sabido superarse ante cualquier obstáculo de la vida. La Sra. Macedonia   tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de limpieza   en  un mercado  el cual es su única fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia.  Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos de limpieza (lejía, detergente, etc.) para su negocio  y así poder generar más ganancias. La Sra. Macedonia  es la es la primera de la mano derecha y se le distingue por su polo de color blanco y pantalón negro. El grupo y ella  se despiden con un enorme agradecimiento a kiva y diciéndoles que cumplirán con todas sus metas  propuestas.
texts.en:
A group of five enterprising women with creative approaches to business: this describes the members of the “LAS AMIGAS DE SAN ANTONIO” communal bank group.

One of them is Macedonia, who is 42 years old, separated, and the mother of three children. Macedonia is a very enterprising woman who has worked hard to overcome every obstacle in her life. Macedonia has a small business selling cleaning products in a market. It is the only source of income for herself and her family. With this loan, she will invest in more cleaning supplies (bleach, detergent, etc.) for her business, which will enable her to generate more profit.

In the photo, Macedonia is the first on the right, and she is wearing a white shirt and black pants. In closing, she and the group express their appreciation to Kiva and say they will achieve all of the goals they have set.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products (bleach, detergent, etc.)

loans.name: Maritza Esmeralda

texts.es: Maritza de 41 años de edad vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace muchos años junto a su hija de 5 años, además ella siempre busca la manera de apoyar a su padre de 77 años en su vejez. Maritza es una persona emprendedora quien quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y para ello con esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado instalar una tienda la cual ha expandido y poco a poco ha ido mejorando. Ella hace todo lo posible por lograr satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia y así vivir de una mejor manera con su hija y su padre. Es por ello que Maritza solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: aceite, azúcar, granos básicos, salsas, especias y todo tipo de mercadería para su negocio y así obtener ganancias, ya que ese es su medio para obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios para darle el estudio a su querida hija y apoyar a su padre.
texts.en:
Maritza is 41 years old. For many years, she's lived in a house on her property with her five-year-old daughter. She's always looking for ways to support her 77-year-old father in his old age.

Maritza is an entrepreneurial person who wants to improve her quality of life. As a result, she's succeeded in creating a store with effort and dedication and has expanded it. It's improved little by little.

She does everything possible to be able to satisfy her family's basic needs and live a better life with her daughter and father. Thus, Maritza seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in oil, sugar, staple goods, sauces, spices and all types of merchandise for her business and thus earn income. This is her way of earning the income she needs to give her dear daughter school and support her father.

loans.use: to invest in oil, sugar, staple goods, sauces, spices and all types of merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is an industrious woman. Her main source of living is from raising and selling hogs. She has been engaged in hog raising for 5 years now.

Arsenia is a fifty-eight year old married woman with 3 children. Her oldest child is 17 and two of her children are still attending school. She hails from the town of Carmen, Bohol.

She needs to improve her livelihood. She needs additional funds to support her existing source of income. Arsenia is asking for a loan to buy pigs and feed. These will enable Arsenia to sell quality hogs in the months to come. Thus, her income will increase and she will be able to start to settle her obligations.

In the long run, she would like to expand her hog raising livelihood for the welfare of the whole family and also to continue to finance her children's studies.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 53 years old and married with eleven children, four of them are still in school. Melinda works very hard to provide for them.

Melinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, bread, coffee, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

Melinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future Melinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 50 years old and has five children. Luzminda is married and two of her children are still in school.

Luzminda is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Luzminda requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Luzminda has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Luzminda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds & supplies to raise pigs

loans.name: Maria Valentina

texts.es: Doña Maria, tiene 56 años de edad, es casada, vive en el Municipio del Negrito, Yoro junto a su hijo y su esposo. Ella y su esposo siempre se han dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de arroz. Esta producción que saca es de primera calidad y la vende en la misma zona. Siempre ha mantenido esta  fuente de ingresos mediante la inversión de varios préstamos con ODEF, los que ha invertido en el cultivo para mejorar la producción. Actualmente solicita otro por 5,000 lempiras para comprar urea, fertilizantes e insumos para combatir las plagas y aprovechar buena cosecha. Tiene como meta seguir con el negocio y que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Maria, 56, is married and lives in the municipality of Negrito, Yoro, together with her son and husband. She and her husband have always made a living from agriculture, cultivating rice. The production she gets is first quality and she sells it in the same zone.

She has always maintained this source of income through the investment of various loans from ODEF which she has invested in the crops in order to improve the production. Nowadays, she is requesting another 5,000 lempiras in order to buy urea, fertilizers and supplies to fight blight and take advantage of a good harvest.

She has as a goal to continue with the business so that her family will lack nothing.

loans.use: to buy urea, fertilizers and supplies to fight blight and take advantage of a good harvest.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 25 years old and single with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 51 years old and married with one child.

Teresa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Teresa has borrowed and paid 38 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from direct selling personal collection products and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Teresa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 51-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members.

Shameem has been running her own beauty saloon for the past five years. She also contributes her income, with her husband, to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e creams, hair brushes and other accessories for her beauty saloon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purposes. Therefore Shameem has applied for a Kiva loan.

This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also helpful for her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Shameem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy materials for her salon business.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim is a Thai ethnic woman currently living with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Mai Son district in Son La province.

Her family lives mainly based on the income from cultivation and breeding. The family has over 7,000 square meters of cultivated land for coffee, and the annual income from harvesting coffee is just enough to cover the living expenses for the family and to save a small amount.

Kim wants to buy additional fertilizer for their coffee cultivation but their saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the coffee field. Then, the coming harvest will bring her family a yield as double over the last year.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong, 44 years old, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. Her family consists of three members including her husband and her son. They are living in Mai Son district in Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, and the income is just enough to cover the living expenses for the family and to save a small amount. Huong's son is studying at the senior high school but she does not have enough money to pay education fees and to buy learning tools for him. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. She hopes that the loan amount will help her son have better condition for learning. For herself, Huong will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: pay school fees & buy school supplies for her son

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario raises and sells hogs for almost 15 years now. In addition to that, he also engages in buying and selling live stock. These are his sources of income.

Mario is a married man with five children. His youngest child is 15 and still attending school. He hails from the town of Carmen, Bohol.

Mario is asking for a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to buy pig feeds and additional capital to buy and sell livestock. With these, he could able to improve his hog raising business and also increase his purchasing power to continue his buy and sell livelihood. These are essential tools that make his sources of income more productive. In this way, he could slowly pay his obligation and continue to finance the schooling of his child.

In the future, Mario would like to manage both his businesses to become financially stable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and livestock

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 36 years old and has three children. Elisa is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Elisa is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Elisa requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elisa has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 52-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two daughters and one son.

She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. Her husband is a tailor and very expert in his profession. He has been sewing for many years. This is the reason her husband has a lot of experience in his profession. His sewing machine is out of order and needs to be replacement with a new one, but he does not have sufficient money to buy a new machine.

Therefore, Rukhsana requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new sewing machine.

Her family has to do hard work to getting an income for the huge family; her husband also contributes to the monthly income.

Rukhsana wants to arrange a dowry for the marriage of her daughter; this is why she is saving most of the earnings.

Rukhsana is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
An old woman from Battambang province, Savy is 61 years old and a mother of nine children. Nowadays, she needs to support two schoolchildren. She grows chilies as her main source of income and she can earn extra income via teaching in the school. She has been involved her business for ages and she can save from her income about 11 USD per day.

This is second cycle for Savy with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loan completely. With the previous loan, her family’s business has improved gradually and earns her more income than before.

She will spend her loan portion to pay the tuition fee of her daughter, who wants to pursue the Korean Language.

She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee of her daughter, who wants to pursue the Korean Language.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 36-year-old lady and a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Nadia has been running her own packing business for past 7 years. She needs to purchase different merchandises, e.g shoppers, plastic coating machine and raw materials, etc. for her business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these merchandises. To fulfill this need, she has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will to able to buy these merchandises for business purpose. That will be good for her to earn more income and this income will support her to fulfill her family's needs.

Nadia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy supplies for her packing business.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es: Iris de 28 años es un ama de casa muy emprendedora, ya que desde hace unos 2 años se ha dedicado a la cría de cerdos y gallinas para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar los cuales cuando ya tienen la edad suficiente son vendidos y esto les genera ganancias a Iris y a su familia. Junto con su esposo tienen como objetivo darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida que la que ellos tuvieron y darles un buen estudio y que sean hombres y mujeres de bien. Los dos hijos menores de Iris están en la escuela y como es de esperarse les dejan muchas labores y tareas las cuales se les dificulta elaborarlas con éxito debido a la falta de iluminación ya que en su comunidad en Atlántida, Honduras no cuentan con este servicio, deben hacerlo a la luz de lámparas de kerosén que dañan su salud debido al humo que están desprenden. Por esto Iris solicita a Soluz Honduras un préstamo para adquirir un sistema solar que le ayudara a sus hijos con las tareas y mejorara su salud, también le ayudara a ella con las labores domésticas y dejaran de pagar y caminar largas distancias para tener acceso a cargar celulares.
texts.en:
Iris, 28, is a very entrepreneurial head of her house. For two years, she's earned a living raising pigs and chickens to help her husband with household expenses. When the animals are old enough, they're sold and this generates income for Iris and her family.

Iris and her husband's goal is to give their children a better quality of life than they had, and give them good schooling so they can be good men and women.

Iris' two youngest children are in school. As you might expect, they're given a lot of tasks and homework which are difficult to finish successfully due to the lack of lighting. Their community in Atlántida, Honduras does not have this service, so they use kerosene lamps for light. This harms their health due to the smoke they emit.

As a result, Iris is seeking a loan from Soluz Honduras to get a solar system that will help her children with their work and improve their health. It will also help her with domestic work and keep her from having to pay and walk long distances to have access to cellphone charging.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for light that will give her household a better standard of living.

loans.name: Mujeres De La Toma Chocola Group

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer casada, muy trabajadora, amable, perseverante y disciplinada, ella tiene 47 años de edad, es casada con una familia de seis hijos de las edades entre  8 y 25 años, ellos viven una comunidad de la aldea Chocola. Juana con el deseo de superarse y ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde la comunidad de su hogar, y su esposo trabaja como mecánico juntos a su familia han sacado adelante. Juana por ser una mujer que posee mucho liderazgo es la representa del grupo denominada Mujeres de la Toma Chocola quienes aunque sus negocios sea la venta de ropa típica han coincido en sus necesidades es por eso que todas buscan un préstamo con el afán de invertirlo en su negocio. Juana invertirá el préstamo en la compra de maíz y leña para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Juana su mayor deseo es contar con un local donde pueda tener mejores condiciones de prestar sus servicios.
texts.en:
Juana is a married woman who's very hardworking, friendly, persevering and disciplined. She's 47 and married with a family of six children between eight and 25 years old. They lives in a community in the village of Chocola.

Juana has a desire to improve herself and offer her family a better quality of life. For three years, she's made tortillas from home, and her husband works as a mechanic. Together they've brought their family ahead.

Because she's a woman with leadership skills, she's the representative of the Mujeres de la Toma Chocola group. Although their businesses are selling traditional clothing, they have come together with their needs and are all seeking a loan to invest in their business.

Juana will invest the loan in the purchase of corn and wood to be able to satisfy her customers' needs. Juana's biggest hope is to have a location where she can have better conditions to offer her services.

loans.use: to buy corn and wood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Eloisa Sanchez

texts.es: Eloisa de 54 años de edad tiene 20 años de residir en vivienda propia, junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos nietos un niño de 9 años y una niña de 2 años de edad.  Eloisa se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante en las calles principales de su municipio, lo que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar, por lo que se siente muy feliz de contar con este ingreso económico.  Eloisa buscando la manera de mejorar su negocio solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: sandalias, camisas, blusas, pantalones, calcetines y faldas para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eloisa is 54 years old and has lived in her own home for 20 years. She lives with her life partner and their two children, a nine-year-old son and two-year-old daughter.

Eloisa earns a living selling clothing, traveling through the main streets in her city. This allows her to support her household, and she feels very happy to count on this income.

Eloisa is seeking a way to improve her business and asked for a loan from FUSAI to invest in sandals, shirts, blouses, pants, socks and skirts to improve her business.

loans.use: to invest in sandals, shirts, blouses, pants, socks, skirts and other clothing for her business.

loans.name: Efrain Luis

texts.es:
El socio Efraín pertenece al banco comunal SAN VALENTIN, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio sigue  dedicándose a la artesanía, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es técnico restaurador, el socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, él socio es una persona responsable, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas, pinceles entre otros.
texts.en:
The member Efraín belongs to the "SAN VALENTIN" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

He continues to work at his craft. He is a restoration technician. He has spent a long time working at his business and things are going well for him thanks to the dedication he puts into his work each day.

He is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of his installments. He is a responsible person and he wants to continue working, in this way he can continue to support his family.

Efraín is requesting the loan to buy paint and brushes amongst others.

loans.use: to buy paint and brushes amongst others.

loans.name: Michelle Mabelle

texts.en:
Michelle Mabelle is 33 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Michelle Mabelle works very hard to provide for them.

Michelle Mabelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

Michelle Mabelle has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as E-load, eggs, coffee, shampoo, soap, junk food, biscuits and other groceries.

In the future, Michelle Mabelle would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in yucca, plantains, cabbage, tomatoes, etc. to make her delicious traditional dishes.

loans.name: Tessa Joy

texts.en:
Tessa Joy is a single woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Tessa Joy is 26 years old and has five children who are still in school.

Tessa Joy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Tessa Joy requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers.

Tessa Joy has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Dary's Group

texts.en: Dary’s group lives in a rural village in Battamang province in Cambodia. Dary makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work selling wood to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Chamnan's Group

texts.en: Chamnan’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chamnan works as farmer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Seema

texts.en: Seema is a 39-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two daughters and two sons. She requested a loan for her husband’s fruit selling business. Her husband owns a fruit shop and participates in household expenses. He likes to sell seasonal fruits. Now he wants to buy bananas, apples, mangoes,etc., in large quantities to sell because the season is going on and the price is very low. Therefore, Seema requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that her husband can buy these fruits in bulk to resell. Seema hopes that this loan will prove productive for her, and she will save a reasonable amount soon. Seema is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory in bulk for resale in her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 57 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Teodora is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teodora has been raising pigs for 11 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 40 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mylene is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, meat, vegetable, spices, etc.

Mylene has been raising pigs for 11 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, meat, vegetable, and spices.

loans.name: Saripili Roja

texts.en:
Saripili Roja is a 37-year-old differently able lady from the small village of Raygada, Odisha, India. She is a woman with immense patience and aspirations. She is the blessed mother of two children, who are currently studying in school. Despite facing so many hurdles and difficulties in her life, Saripili Roja has never broken down. She always remains rock strong and has been determined to make her life better and alleviate poverty by engaging herself in an income generating activity.

Saripili Roja has been running a dairy business for the last five years and owns three cows. She sells milk to customers residing in her locality. Saripili Roja is requesting a loan of 20,000 Indian rupees to purchase one more cow so that she will be capable of generating higher income as she will be able to get more milk. A rise in her income will subsequently result in a better standard of living.

Saripili Roja is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and develop her dairy business.

loans.name: Chorikul

texts.ru: Чорикул очень благодарен Вам за поддержку. Он отремонтировал свою машину. За счет прибыл он начал заниматься сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Чтобы  его семья жила в достатке, Чорикул  уже  три года как  занимается  сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. У него  несколько соток  земли. Там он выращивает  разные сорта овощей. Ему в его деятельности помогает его семья.  В данный момент Чорикул хочет посадить лук и для этого ему надо купить большое количество удобрение и семян лука.  По этой причине он обратился за кредитом. На сумму кредита он намерен купить все необходимое для выращивания лука. Чорикул очень трудолюбивый человек. Он и на этот раз очень надеется на поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en: Chorikul is very thankful to you for the support. He repaired his car and used the income to start an agriculture business. He has been working in agriculture for three years in order to provide for his family. He has a few hundred square metres of land where he grows various vegetables with the help of his family. Right now he wants to plant onions and needs to buy a large quantity of fertilizer and onions seeds to do so. For this reason he is looking for a loan. He intends to use the loan amount to buy everything necessary to grow onions. He is a very hardworking man and hopes very much for your support.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fertilizer and onion seeds

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 48 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Violeta is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Violeta has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 60 years old and married with four children.

Eliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Eliza has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and vegetable vending.

Eliza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 39-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five daughters. Her husband has been doing a scrap recycling business.

Razia's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle but due to some financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy the scrap in bulk. Therefore, Razia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that her husband can easily adopt the recycling procedure and earn a profitable income derived from his business.

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his scrap recycling business

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 46 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Ethel runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns income from raising pigs.

Ethel has borrowed and repaid six loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) before this loan. She has requested a 14,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries. Ethel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is the age of 45 and lives with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a bookbinder and binds books at home. She helps him after the completion of her daily tasks. Her husband uses cardboard, loop wire, gum and thread for binding the books. He takes orders from book publishers and binds books on order. For the time being, he has been fulfilling many contracts but this time he has gotten a much bigger contract than before. The major problem is that he does not have enough cash in hand to buy the raw material for this book binding contract.

Therefore, Naheed requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy raw materials such as cardboard, loop wire, gum, threads, etc. to continue his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as cardboard, loop wire, gum, threads, etc. for her husband's bookbinding business.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor de 35 años se dedica a la agricultura y cría de cerdos, desde hace 8 años,él quiere ser un buen ganadero y poder darle un buen futuro a su familia. En la comunidad de Atlántida, Honduras donde él vive con su esposa y  dos hijos no hay acceso a energía eléctrica lo cual dificulta que puedan levantarse más temprano para atender los asuntos de ganadería ya que al estar muy oscuro y no tener buena iluminación deben encender lámparas a base de kerosén que perjudica su salud y la de sus hijos. Por esta razón Hector quien busca darles lo mejor a su familia solicita a Soluz Honduras un préstamo para adquirir un sistema solar que le beneficiara en la iluminación y le permitirá desarrollar sus trabajos con más eficiencia y también para cuando sus hijos estén en edad escolar puedan elaborar sus tareas con buena iluminación.
texts.en:
Hector, 35, has been making a living from agriculture and raising pigs for eight years. He wants to be a good rancher and give a good future to his family. In the community of Atlántida, Honduras, where he lives with his wife and two children, there is no access to electricity. It makes things difficult to get up early to take care of ranching matters since it is still very dark, and, not having good lighting, they have to light kerosene lamps which endangers his health and that of his children.

For this reason, Hector, who wishes to give the best to his family, is requesting a loan from Soluz Honduras in order to get a solar system which will benefit him with lighting and allow him to carry out his work with more efficiency. Also, when his children are school age, they will be able to do their homework with good lighting.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for lighting which will help improve the quality of life in his home.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 46-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her son has been running a general store for the past five years. Her son is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Najma's son wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints, her son is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Najma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her son to buy all these commodities and also will help him to earn a maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.

Najma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's general store business.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: Don Jose de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de productos lacteos (queso fresco, queso duro, crema) y tambien a la venta de miel, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Don José, 65, lives in his own house with his wife. For 5 years he has been engaged in the processing and marketing of dairy products (soft cheese, hard cheese, cream) and also in the sale of honey. His business is located at his place of residence and with the profits he earns he manages to take care of some of the household expenses. He is applying for a loan to purchase more products wholesale in order to continue with his sales and thus have a better income.

loans.use: purchase dairy products (soft cheese, hard cheese, cream) and honey wholesale.

loans.name: Grupo Xojola Camino Caserio Pasac Group

texts.es:
Manuela es una de las muchas mujeres que con mucho esfuerzo y esmero a su familia ha logrado sacar adelante,  ella para generar sus ingresos se a dedica a la producción de banano, por muchos años esto ha sido su mayor fuente de ingresos,  y con el apoyo que recibió del crédito al que tuvo la oportunidad de acceder, logro darle a su cultivo de banano el mantenimiento que en su momento necesitaba para obtener una buena producción, a Dios gracias le fue posible venderlos en su mercado regional y con sus ganancias puedo comprar una cama para su uso personal, con este avance Manuela está muy contenta más no conforme y nuevamente tiene la necesidad de brindarle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café pero no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para cubrir esta necesidad por tal motivo acude a otro préstamo.
Su más grande  anhelo es aumentar su cultivo de café y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Manuela is one of the many women who with much effort and care has managed to get ahead with her family. In order to generate income, she has been making a living from the production of bananas. For many years, this has been her main source of income, and with the support she has received from the loan she had the opportunity to access, she managed to give to her banana crop the maintenance it needed at the time in order to obtain good production. Thanks to God, she was able to sell them in her regional market and with the earnings buy a bed for her personal use. With this advancement, she is very content.

So it goes and now she needs to offer maintenance to her coffee crop, but she does not have sufficient resources to cover this necessity. For this reason, she comes for another loan.

Her great wish is to increase her coffee crop and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a computer shop business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy accessories for her computer shop and other supplies needed in her business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy accessories for her computer shop and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 47 years old and married with six children. Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lilia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, diapers, sanitary pads, etc.

Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is 29 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all the family members.

Sara has been running her own beauty salon for the past three years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business purpose.

Therefore, Sara has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Sara is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Flordelyn

texts.en:
Flordelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Flordelyn requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Flordelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mazida

texts.en:
Mazida stays in a small village in Falakata, Alipurduar district, West Bengal. She is a 31-year-old woman living with her husband and their three children (two sons and one daughter). The couple is very much concerned to provide an education for their children who are studying in grades two, seven & eight.

Her husband runs a business making plywood material and Mazida runs their grocery store after managing all the household work. She sells items like spices, salt, rice, oil, sugar, biscuits, soap, etc. that are in great demand among the local villagers and neighbors. But the family's earnings hardly cover their basic needs. In order to meet the growing inflation and to keep provisions for the future cost of her children’s education, Mazida wants to grow her grocery business. She realizes that she can earn more profit if she can increase her stock on a large scale. To buy more grocery items in bulk, she needs capital. So she requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She will use the loan amount to purchase more grocery items and daily needed commodities in bulk so that she can satisfy the regular customers and earn more. With the increased income, Mazida will be able to expand her existing business and save better for her family’s secure future.

Mazida thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 32-year-old married woman. She is living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband works as a laborer in a small firm on daily wages. He is the sole earner for their entire family. 

Her husband's income is very low. Therefore, she decided to increase the source of income in the form of an electrician shop. 

Her husband has been trouble shooting the electrical components such as water pumps, fans and other electrical accessories. Now, he has become an expert in his profession and can hold the full affairs of an electrician’s shop. 

Bushra wants to buy initial stock of electrical goods to set up a newly opened electric shop for her husband. This is the reason she contacted Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy initial stock such as socket, bulb, tube lights, switches and electrical goods.

Bushra hopes the lenders of Kiva will take a warm participation to help her. She is very thankful to Kiva, Kiva's lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy initial stock such as socket, bulb, tube lights, switches and electrical goods for her husband's electrical goods shop.

loans.name: Jocieflor

texts.en:
Jocieflor owns and operates a furniture shop. She accepts orders like dining tables, chairs, cabinets and doors made of wood. In addition to that, she also sold souvenir bags.

She is 28 years old with three dependents, ages 8, 5 and 3 years old respectively. She has been engaged in her furniture shop for three years now.

She is asking for a loan to acquire capital to buy materials like lumber, varnish and laborer's fee. These will serve as fuel to continue and improve her furniture shop. She could purchase the necessary materials needed and maintain the flow of her operation as well.

She would like to expand her livelihood to be able to provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to acquire capital to buy materials like lumber, varnish and laborer's fee

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 49 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Rubina has been doing her business of clothes selling for the past five years and contributes her income to manage the household.

Rubina needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purposes but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in a position to buy these clothes. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance, Rubina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her clothing business.

loans.name: Wendy

texts.en:
Wendy is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Wendy is 46 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Wendy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Wendy requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Wendy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Wendy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en:
Argentina is 40 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Argentina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Argentina has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Argentina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Juana Cruz

texts.es: Juana de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tenda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 4 años, vende una variedad de productos y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juana is 46 years old, lives in her own house with her husband. She owns a small shop located in her residence for the last 4 years. She sells a variety of products and she has managed to meet some household expenses with what she obtains from her sales. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more soaps, eggs, basic grains, drinks, candies, pastries, etc. and to improve her income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soaps, eggs, basic grains, drinks, candies, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de tostaditas de platano y papas, refrescos y fruta preparada, su negocio esta ubicado en una zona muy transitada cerca de su casa tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esa actividada y posee muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor pra poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Carlos is 36 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and his daughter. He makes a living selling potato and plantain chips, drinks, and prepared fruit. His business is located in a very busy area near his home. He has 10 years of experience in this trade and he has many customers. With the earnings obtained, he manages to pay some household expenses. He is requesting a loan to purchase more products wholesale in order to continue selling and to improve his economic income.

loans.use: to purchase potato and plantain chips, drinks, and prepared fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: 47 летняя жительница района Рудаки Саида. Она гостеприимная и честная женщина. Саида мать двоих детей. У нее один сын и одна дочка. Детям 27 и 26 лет. Дочка разведена с мужем. У сына скоро свадьба, он женится. Саида дома предоставляет услуги портнихи на заказ. Она 10 лет назад научилась кроить и шить женскую одежду. Саида зарабатывает путем швеи. Она любить сшить разную женскую одежду. Сейчас Саида решила взять кредит для свадьбы сына. За счет кредит она хочет приобрести свадебные принадлежности. Саида обратилась за кредитом по причине ,что она не смогла копить достаточную сумму денег.  Она ждет Вашу доброту. Вы можете помочь ей финансам.
texts.en:
Saida is a 47-year-old resident of the Rudaki district.  She is a friendly and honest woman and the mother of two children who are now 27 and 26 years old.  Her daughter is divorced.  Her son will soon get married.

Saida offers sewing services from home.  She started designing and sewing women's clothes 10 years ago.  Thanks to this activity, she is able to make some money.  She loves sewing a variety a women's outfits.  At the moment, she has decided to take a loan to buy a few wedding supplies for her son's  wedding.  She has requested a loan because she was not able to save enough money for those purchases.  She is awaiting your kindness.  Please help her financially.

loans.use: to buy wedding supplies for her son's wedding.

loans.name: Llapallanchis Llankasunchis Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPALLANCHIS LLANKASUNCHIS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martina ella es conviviente  tiene 28 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando parea de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, carnes entre otros.
La socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los socios en general agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este sueño  y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “LLAPALLANCHIS LLANKASUNCHIS” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Paucartambo, part of the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco.

The member is Martina; she lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has 2 children.

Martina alternates her daily activities, working in the restaurant business. She has been in her business for a good amount of time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. She is a responsible person. She wishes to be able to continue working in order to in this way continue supporting her family.

She requests this loan to buy rice, oil, meat, and other items.

The members whose photos are attached to the group photo asked to be excused for arriving late to the meeting for work-related reasons.

The members as a whole are grateful to those who make up part of this dream and they commit to making their payments within the established timeframe.

The partner whose face is obscured in the photo does not belong to the community bank.

loans.use: buy rice, oil, meat, and other items.

loans.name: Ma. Sylvia

texts.en:
Ma. Sylvia is 39 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Ma. Sylvia works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Sylvia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Ma. Sylvia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, beverages, eggs, coffee, junk foods, shampoo, condiments and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Elma works hard to support her family.

Elma buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making furniture. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her business.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Dedicacion

texts.en:
As a single parent of four children, Dedicacion works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Dedicacion is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional fish net, gasoline for her boat, bamboo and other materials.

Dedicacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, gasoline for her boat, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman with seven children. She is 51 years old and two of her children are in school.

Nelly is a very hardworking entrepreneur, and has a business selling beverages in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy variety of beverages to sell.

Nelly has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Eufrosia

texts.en:
Eufrosia is an artisan from Mexico who specializes in colorful ceramic masks, suns and moons. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of supplies and raw materials, including eclipses, paint, and brushes.

Eufrosia has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"I was born and raised in a small village in the state of Guerrero, and I learned at a very young age how to paint on ceramic. My father taught me, and I can still remember the very first piece I painted – it was a lizard. Due to our family's financial situation I was only able to go to primary school. Painting and decorating ceramic not only represents a way to make a living, but to me it's an art form that allows me to express my feelings and capture the beauty of nature."

"I want to thank you all from the bottom of my heart for all of your support. The first loan I received allowed me to grow my humble little business, and so I'm quite excited to receive this new loan. Before I started selling online, it was practically impossible to support my family selling my art -- so I had to take on all kinds of odd jobs to make ends meet. Now, I can dedicate myself fully to my craft, and I have my mother and my sisters working with me, helping me grow. I cannot always find the right words to convey the depth of my gratitude and happiness for all you have done for me. Thank you, and may God bless you all!"

Use the link below to view Eufrosia's colorful ceramic masks, suns and moons on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/8116

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of supplies and raw materials, including eclipses, paint, and brushes

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana sabe que mujeres como ella son dignas de admirarse, ella tiene la visión de superase con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación ella trabaja de sol a sol para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace dos años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica y con los ingresos que obtiene mantiene a su familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 4 y 18 años. Ellos viven en una comunidad de la aldea Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán. Juana por ser una madre que ama y prioriza el futuro de su familia ha decidido comprar un terreno donde puedan en algún fututo construir o cultivar sus hijos, pero lamentablemente no tiene los recursos necesarios para poder realizar esta compra por esa razón solicita un préstamo.
La esperanza de vida de Juana es poder darles estudios a sus hijos para que sean grandes profesionales y comprar más terrenos.
texts.en:
Juana knows that women such as her are worthy of admiration. She has the vision to succeed through lots of effort and dedication. She works from dawn to dusk for her family in order to obtain their income and to get ahead. Since she was two years old, she has made a living purchasing and selling typical clothing and with the obtained income, she supports her family of four children who are between the ages of 4 and 18 years. They live in the village community of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán. Juana is a mother who loves and prioritizes the future of her family. She has decided to purchase land that her children will be able construct or cultivate on in the future. Lamentably, she does not have the required resources to be able to make this purchase. It is for this reason she requests a loan.

The hope of Juana's life is to be able to pay for her children's education so that they will be great professionals and be able to purchase more land.

loans.use: to purchase land for future construction or cultivation.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 61 years old and widowed with eight children. Nelly works very hard to provide for them.

Nelly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products.

Nelly has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Nelly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Nida is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her weaving business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Hoi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoi, 33 years old, is the Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband, her son and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and animal breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family while she has to pay for the education’s expenses of her children. She wants to buy learning tools for her children and paying for their education expenses but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.


She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have better conditions for learning and then they will have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy learning tools for her children and paying for their education expenses

loans.name: Aizhan

texts.en:
Aizhan is 18-years-old freshman in Journalism and Mass Communications Program at AUCA. Since her childhood, she has been an active, sociable and communicative child. She loved to talk to different people and had wide interests in art, music, literature and science.

3 years ago she heard about AUCA and from that day had a dream to enter it. As she says, one of her future goals is to write a book. She believes that study at AUCA will help her to better her English and give a chance to write her book not only in Kyrgyz or Russian, but also in English. The other reason for her choosing AUCA is that it has modern equipment such as television studio, brand new video and audio editing suites, professional photographic equipment, etc. Finally, being a journalist allows her to do what she loves, share her opinion to the world and develop freedom of speech in Kyrgyzstan.

Unfortunately, there is a problem in realizing Aizhan’s dreams. Aizhan’s father is a taxi-driver and mother is an economist. Her younger brother goes to school and younger sister to kindergarten. So her parents save money by in living in her grandparent’s house, but still not able to pay Aizhan’s whole tuition at AUCA. Being informed about AUCA’s financial aid and Kiva loan, they were happy to find the light at the end of the tunnel. Aizhan thanks Kiva lenders for consideration of her profile and promises to make all her possible efforts to study well at AUCA and graduate it with excellent marks.

loans.use: to pay for her BA in Journalism and Communications at AUCA.

loans.name: Sovannsela

texts.en:
A university student from Battambang province, Sovannsela is 22 years old and single. He is studying for his bachelor degree, with a major of Engineering at a university. He is earning an income to support his study and his living via teaching in at school for 2 years.

For Sovannsela, this is his first Kiva loan with VisionFund. He will use his loan to pay for his school fees. He hopes that he can get a good job with a decent income after graduating, to improve his family so they may live in better conditions in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his BSc. in Engineering, so that he can pursue his studying and get a better job in the future.

loans.name: Thanh Yen 12 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong, 34, is a Thai ethnic lady who has been married and has three children: two girls and one boy of school age. Her firstborn child is a girl 13 years old but recently has to drop out of school because Mrs. Phuong could not afford to pay studying expenses for her.

Currently, Mrs. Phuong is only able to send the second and the third child to school. She and her husband work at a lot of work to earn income to provide for the family. They cultivate rice, trade in fruits and work for construction employers.

This is the fourth time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seed for the new harvest. She hopes that her investment will go well and bring good income for her family, so that she could afford to pay all studying expenses for her children and they all could attend school fully.

Mrs. Phuong dreams that her family will soon escape from poverty and her children will have bright futures. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for the new harvest

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.en:
Gerarda hails in the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol. She is 58 years of age and has one grown child.
She runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells basic commodities like biscuits, tea, coffee, sugar, noodles, vinegar, edible oil, bath soap, shampoo and canned goods.
She has been running a sari-sari store for 10 years now.

Gerarda has requested a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy groceries like seasonings, beverages and toiletries. These will fill her store and prevent her from running out of stocks. Thus, her income will go higher and she could now able to settle her finances. She could now able to set aside some savings and be able to expand her current source of income.

She is hoping that someday, her livelihood will become successful.

loans.use: to buy groceries like  seasonings, beverages and toiletries

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and married with five children. With four children currently in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like rice, detergent soap, milk, cereals, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, detergent soap, milk, cereals, noodles, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like rice, detergent soap, milk, cereals, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is a 45 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and mother of 5 children. Her son has been running a bakery for the past 5 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family.

Munawar's son wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g sweets, cakes, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all the above for reselling purpose.

Therefore Munawar has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her son to buy all these commodities and also be helpful for him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business.

Munawar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's bakery business.

loans.name: Astajona

texts.en: Astajona is a mother of 3 children all attending school in Bundibugyo Uganda. She owns a cocoa plantation plus buying more cocoa from other farmers where she gets income to earn a living and support her family. She is hardworking and determined to transform her business to a level that will meet her customers' demands at cocoa seasons. She sells coffee to get additional income having been in business for 20 years now. She faces a challenge of lack of enough capital to hire labour for harvesting. she has decided to ask for a loan so as to boost her business by buying more cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Ramilaben And Group

texts.en:
Ramilaben hails from the Ahmedabad district of Gujarat. She lives with her husband and her teenage child. Ramilaben did not have access to formal education when she was a child. She is determined to provide her child with a good education. She realises that this would not be an easy task unless she has a good repository of savings. Thus, she has decided to start a sewing material business of her own. This will act as an additional source of income and will help her save for her child’s education.

Ramilaben cannot start her business without funds. Hence she seeks a loan. She is joined by 4 other women in seeking a loan and together they need a loan of Rs. 85,000. They have come together because they are all finding it hard to meet their household expenses with their current household income. They need a loan to either expand their current business or to start a new one to meet their family’s needs. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials for her sewing material business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 48 years old, married and has three children.

Amelita is in the agricultural business, raising chicken in the Philippines. Amelita requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chicken.

Amelita has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chicken

loans.name: Viminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Viminda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Viminda is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy ingredients such as, meat, soy sauce, etc. for her food vending business.

Viminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as, meat, soy sauce, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Erlinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries.

loans.name: Italo

texts.es:
Italo con 38 años de edad, tiene un hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y sus 3 menores hijos,vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú,en una zona rural. Vive en casa propia, de material rústico.Italo mantiene buenas relaciones con los miembros de su comunidad siendo colaborador y responsable en los actos requeridos.Vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada basicamente a la cria y posterior comercializacion de animales menores (cuyes, gallinas, cerdos...etc) y a la agricultura cultivo de café.

Italo se dedica a la cria y comercializacion de animales menores (cuyes, gallinas, cerdos...etc), a la fecha de la visita cuenta con cuyes, gallinas, cerdos y otros animales menores de cria. Cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro hace mas de cinco años, vende animales de cria en Distrito de santo tomas los dias domingos a srs. Que cuentan con restaurant y a personas del distrito. Tambien cultiva 0.5 has. De café variedad catimor en mismo caserio de Playa Grande Distrito santo tomas de Cutervo. El destino del crédito será para capital de trabajo compra de animales nemores para cria en caserio Playa Grande y posterior comercializacion en distrito santo tomas, con ello obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Italo, es socio nuevo en nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa. No bancarizado.
texts.en:
Italo, 38, lives happily in his own home with his wife and three young children. The family lives in the district of Santo Tomas, in the province of Cutervo, Peru. This area comes under the Cajamarca office.
