He lives in the countryside in a rustic house. He has a good relationship with the other members of this community, collaborating with them in a responsible way whenever called upon.

He lives in a small community which principally deals in the raising and selling of small animals (guinea pigs, hens, pigs, and things like that) and also to coffee cultivation.

When we visited him, he had guinea pigs, hens, pigs and other small animals. He has more than five years extensive experience in this profession.

He sells his animals in the Santo Tomas district every Sunday. His customers are restaurant owners or general people who live in the area.

He also looks after 0.5 hectares of Catimor coffee crops on the same farm in Santo Tomas.

He will use the loan to buy more small animals to raise on his farm, which he will later sell in Santo Tomas. This will help him to generate more income so he can improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

He is a new member of the financial institution Edpyme Alternativa and does not have a bank account.

loans.use: to buy small animals to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and seafood wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coconuts in bulk to satisfy customer demand.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro, con 58 años de edad,conviviente, no tiene carga familiar,vive con su cónyuge en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú, en una zona rural. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Teodoro se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y verduras, dede más de 3 años en su propio domicilio,contando con el apoyo de su cónyuge, ya que de manera interdiaria presta servicio como jornalero agrícola por zona de residencia.Con el crédito comprará mercadería para su negocio. El crédito a otorgarle le facilitará obtener mayores ingresos para su unidad familiar.

Teodoro si cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio nuevo en nuestra institución financiera.
texts.en:
Teodoro, 58 years old and attached, does not have family burdens. He lives with his partner in the Lagunas district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, in rural Peru. The inhabitants of this country mostly make a living in agriculture, animal husbandry, and commerce.

Teodoro has made a living selling groceries and vegetables for more than three years from his own home, counting on the support of his partner, by way of interday paid services such as agricultural labor for the residential area. With this loan he will purchase merchandise for his business. The loan granted to him will facilitate obtaining better income for his household.

Teodoro has a credit history, but is a new partner in our financial institution.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Eusilah

texts.en:
Eusilah, a wife and mother of two children, is a mixed small-scale farmer based in the remote village of free town in the Nandi Hills. She has been practicing agribusiness for the past ten years and has never looked back. For a living, Eusilah sells milk and food products from her farm to the local market. She enjoys seeing clients coming back for more of her products and she really feels satisfied. Although Eusilah has been making profits through farming, she has always wanted to do poultry farming. The main challenge she has encountered is a lack of funds to get her business off the ground. She is seeking a loan to buy quality breeds of poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Nandi Hills and it is a business that can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. 

Eusilah does not worry too much about competition because the market for poultry products is good - chicken is a popular meal for many people and this can be seen if you visit any fast food joint. With this loan, Eusilah is confident that her income will increase. Poultry farming will allow a permanent change in her life. She plans to buy different breeds of broilers and layers and will be selling eggs and meat to the local market and other major markets in Kenya. She also plans to start breeding, which will help increase the number of poultry on her farm. Other than profits from selling eggs, poultry feathers, and poultry meat, Eusilah will also benefit from using the poultry manure, which is an excellent source of nutrients for her farm. Through this loan, she will assure her large family a secure future and improved living conditions.

loans.use: to buy quality breeds of poultry for her poultry farming business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed. She supplements this income with earnings from her buy-and-sell charcoal business. Erlinda dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her pig-raising business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 54 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. Pacita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Pacita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anita is 59 years old and has one child in school. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as oil, peanuts, etc.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as oil, peanuts, etc.

loans.name: Amosi

texts.en: Amosi who lives in Bundibugyo-Uganda is a hardworking man dealing in the sale of cosmetics as a retailer. His shop is located on one of the busy streets in town. He is also a farmer growing cocoa on his family land to get additional income. He got involved in these businesses to earn income and meet his increasing demands. He is challenged by bad debtors who affect his business plan of having a big well stocked shop in his area. Amosi has asked for a loan to buy cosmetics such as shampoo, hair food, lotions, and hairspray to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as shampoo, hair food, lotions and hairspray to sell.

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es:
Edgar Antonio con 38 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos,vive en el distrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y comercio.

Edgar Antonio se dedica a la cría y comercio de animales menores tales como chanchos, patos, pavos. Adicionalmente Edgar Antonio realiza labores de maestro de obra.Hace más de 6 años.Solicita préstamo para la construcción de corrales, así mismo para invertir en el comercio de animales menores.

Edgar Antonio, es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa, pero ya cuenta con historial crediticio de manera indirecta puesto que su cónyuge manejó créditos con nuestra Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Edgar Antonio is 38 years old. He lives with his spouse and their three minor children in the district of Colasay, province of Jaén, department of Cajamarca, in Peru. The residents of this community mostly work in agriculture and trade.

Edgar Antonio raises and sells small animals, such as pigs, turkeys, and ducks. In addition, Edgar Antonio has worked as a construction laborer for more than 6 years. He is asking for a loan to build pens, as well as invest in the small animals trade.

Edgar Antonio is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa, but he already has an indirect credit history because his spouse had loans with our Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to build pens as well as invest in the small animals trade.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a married woman who is 58 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nena has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy cloth, thread, zippers and other materials for her shop.

Nena has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, zippers and other materials for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando con 35 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y su menor hija. En el distrito de Pomacahua, distrito de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca.Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los habitantes de la zona.Los habitantes de esta zona se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura.

Orlando se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cafe, ubicado en el caserío Sondor del distrito de Pomahuaca, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitaias, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para deshierbo de sus parcelas del cultivo de café. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Orlando es socio recurrente, este es su segundo credito con Edpyme Alternativa,su anterior crédito fue de 2000 soles a 180 dias. Firma con aval.
texts.en:
Orlando is 35 years old. He lives in his own home, built from rustic materials, with his wife and their minor daughter in the community of Pomacahua, district of Jaén, department of Cajamarca. He has very good personal and work references from the residents of the area, who mostly work in agriculture.

Orlando works in agriculture, specifically in growing coffee in the community of Sondor, of the Pomahuaca district. He has 10 years of experience in this area. The loan he is getting will be used for farm work, to buy plant protection product applications and fertilizer, as well as to pay for labor to clear his coffee cropland. This way, he will help his crop physiologically, morphologically and productively. It will also help him have a timely crop, and thus a better quality product that he will have no problem selling.

Orlando is a recurring member. This is his second loan with Edpyme Alternativa. His previous loan was for 2000 soles for 180 days. Signed with endorsement.

loans.use: to buy plant protection product applications, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a parent of six children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Juanita is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell in her buy-and-sell rice business.

loans.name: Chanrat

texts.en: Chanrat is 19 years old and a resident of the Battambang province. He grows rice to earn income for his family. He also earns income as a labor worker. Chanrat saves his daily income of about USD 11 per day for his family and to support his study.  He is a requesting a loan for the first time with VisionFund to pay school fees to pursue studying in the Korean Language. After graduating he hopes to get a good job with a  decent income to increase his family standards of living in the future.

loans.use: To pay for school fees to get a good job after graduating.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita is 34 years old, married and has four children who are still in school.

Normelita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Normelita has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Florecita

texts.en:
Florecita, 45 years old, is a married woman with three children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Florecita has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Florecita has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Sirley Del Rosario

texts.es: Sirley tiene 49 años y manifiesta que toda su vida se ha dedicado al comercio, pues considera que esta actividad le da la oportunidad de manejar un horario flexible para atender a sus tres hijos y generar ingresos que le permitieron sacar adelante a su familia. Hace 10 años conoció la modalidad de ventas por catálogos y decidió incursionar en la venta de ropa, accesorios y cosméticos en general, artículos que consideraba eran una necesidad básica y fácilmente comercializables. Sirley trabaja de 8:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m. horario en el que propicia sus ventas a través de visitas a su clientela conformada en su mayoría por vecinos y amigos. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en ropa, accesorios y cosméticos en general para mantener un inventario suficiente para atender la demanda que generan las festividades de fin de año. Su meta es seguir aumentando su clientela y generar utilidades suficientes que le permitan obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sirley is 49 years old and states that she has worked in sales her whole life, since she considers this job to give her the opportunity to manage a flexible schedule to care for her three children and generate income that allows her to get her family ahead. Ten years ago, she learned about the method of selling from catalogs and decided to get into selling clothing, accessories, and cosmetics in general, items that she thought were a basic necessity and easily sellable. Sirley works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm, a schedule in which she promotes her sales through visits to her customers made up in the majority by neighbors and friends. Currently she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, resources that she plans to invest in clothing, accessories and cosmetics in general to maintain a sufficient inventory to meet the demand that the end of the year festivities create. Her goal is to continue expanding her customer base and generate sufficient profits to will allow her get a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in clothing, accessories and cosmetics in general.

loans.name: Santa Césarea

texts.es:
Santa es una madre de familia de grandes principios y valores, ella tiene 23 años de edad casada con una linda familia de una hija de un año de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del caserío Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán. Santa para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a venta de recinos de banano con esta actividad  lleva 5 años de realizarlo, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la venta de café. Santa con el deseo de superarse a tomado la iniciativa de comprar un terreno donde ella pueda seguir cultivando, pero una de sus dificultades es no tener el dinero necesario para realizar la compra de su terreno.
Su esperanza de vida es comprar más terrenos para sus hijos y que sus condiciones de vida mejoren.
texts.en:
Santa is a wife and mother with great principles and values. She is 23 years old, married and has a beautiful family with a one year old daughter. This humble family lives in the community of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán. In order to obtain her income and get her family ahead, Santa sells bananas. She has been doing this activity for 5 years, but to improve her income she also sells coffee. Wanting to get ahead, Santa has taken the initiative of buying some land where she can continue growing, but one of her difficulties is not having the money she needs to make the land purchase.

What she hopes for in life is to buy more land for her children and for her living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy cropland.

loans.name: Danna Group

texts.fr: Paul est malien c'est lui qui est assis avec la chèvre sur la photo. Il a pour activité l’élevage et aussi l’agriculture. Jovial et accueillant, Paul est sérieux dans le travail qu’il fait. Agé de 58ans, Paul est marié et père de 11 enfants dont 5 sont à sa charge. Ses enfants sont âgés de  11 à 28 ans et un parmi les 5 enfants est scolarisé. Sa femme fait le stockage de noix de karités et de Néré qu’elle revend plus tard ce qui lui permet d’aider son mari à faire face à certaines dépenses de la famille. Paul a fait recourt au RMCR pour avoir des prêts afin d’acheter plus de moutons. Paul utilise le prêt pour faire l’élevage de bétails (moutons, chèvres, bœufs). Il s’approvisionne sur les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité et les revend sur ces mêmes marchés. Analphabète Paul exerce cette activité depuis plus de 30 ans. Il a un bénéfice prévisionnel mensuel de 30 000F CFA. Avec ce bénéfice il parvient à assurer le bien-être de sa famille et la scolarité de celui qui va à l’école.
texts.en: Paul is a Malian man and he is sitting with the goat in the photo. He has an animal raising activity and is also a farmer. He is a jovial and welcoming person but also serious in his work. He is 58 years old and father to 11 children, five of whom are dependants. His children range from 11 to 28 years of age and one of his five dependant children is at school. Paul's wife stocks shea nuts and "néré" (the fruit of an oil-producing tree) which she then sells, and this allows her to help her husband with some of the family's expenses. Paul has turned to RMCR so he can obtain more loans to buy more sheep. He is going to use this loan to carry out his activity of raising livestock (sheep, goats, bulls). He gets his supplies in the weekly markets held in his town and resells them at the same markets. Paul is illiterate and has been carrying out this activity for more than 30 years. He estimates his monthly profit at 30,000FCFA, and with this profit he manages to provide for his family's wellbeing as well as the education of his child who attends school.

loans.use: to buy animals for resale.

loans.name: Olivia Abigail

texts.es:
Olivia es una mujer de 20 años, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es el servicio de cambio de lubricantes. 
Ella es inteligente, emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ área comercial donde se encuentran librerías, carnicerías, venta de ropa, oficinas públicas y demás actividades lada a lado.
Olivia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo y físico delgado. Su lengua materna s el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus familiares que trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es el servicio de cambio de aceite, engrase a presión, limpieza de filtros, cambio de líquido de frenos, y otros, “mi padre me enseñó el oficio, con este préstamo me independizaré y consolidaré mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con gran número de clientes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de herramientas de trabajo. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar y continuar con su negocio, ella desea comprar maquinaria como, máquina lavadora, aspiradora y fumigadora. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Olivia solicita un préstamo para la compra de máquinas para su negocio de cambio de aceite.
texts.en:
Olivia is a 20-year-old woman, single, with no children, and her business is an oil change service.

She is intelligent, enterprising, and very hard-working. Her business is located in the 16 de julio zone, a commercial area where there are book stores, butchers, clothing sales, public offices, and other businesses side by side.

Olivia has dark skin, long black hair and a thin physique. Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She has her life in the house of relatives who work. They live in their own house built of brick which has all the basic services. Her business is a service of oil change, pressure lubricant, brake fluid change, and more. "My father taught me the trade, with this loan I will become independent and strengthen my business..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she has a large number of customers, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase the tools for her work. Her dream is to finish her education and continue with her business. She wants to purchase machinery such as a washing machine, vacuum and fumigator. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years that she had done this work.

For these reasons, Olivia asks for a loan to purchase merchandise for her oil change business.

loans.use: to purchase machines for her oil change business.

loans.name: Famille Kanyantibiri Group

texts.fr: Quoique la baisse du prix a frappé sa production, Sauti a vu sa récolte augmenté au cours de cette saison grâce à l'entretien régulier (paillage) qu'il a réalisé à partir du crédit dont il a été bénéficiaire. Les revenus générés ont pris en charge la scolarité de ses enfants ainsi que leur alimentation mais n'ont pas été suffisants pour rembourser tout le crédit. Pour ne pas abuser la confiance des prêteurs, Sauti a vendu une de ses génisses afin d'apurer le solde restant de son crédit. Il sollicite un deuxième pour pouvoir faciliter ces travaux d'entretien et espère que le prix du café ne sera pas si bas qu'à la saison précédente.
texts.en: Despite the fall in prices which has hit his production, Sauti has seen his harvest increase this season thanks to regular maintenance (mulching) which he has carried out since he was granted his loan. The income generated has been used to pay for his children's education as well as their food, but was not sufficient to repay all his loan. As he does not wish to damage his lenders' confidence in him, Sauti has sold one of his heifers so he can repay the balance of his loan. He is requesting a second loan to make his maintenance work easier and hopes that the price of coffee will not be as low as in the previous season.

loans.use: to maintain a coffee field.

loans.name: Brayan Manuel

texts.es: Brayan tiene 24 años y su historia de emprendimiento inició hace 2 años, cuando con la ayuda de su padre logró adquirir dos computadores y una fotocopiadora para aprovechar la demanda generada por los estudiantes del sector quienes solicitaban el servicio de internet y fotocopias. Él atiende a vecinos y transeúntes en su mayoría estudiantes en el horario de 8:00 a.m. a 9:00 p.m. ofreciéndole el servicio de fotocopiado e internet. Brayan es un joven de proyectos, siempre quiere hacer cosas y  ve  la necesidad de hacer negocios más completos por lo que actualmente está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el fin de ampliar su negocio con la compra de dos computadores más y una nueva fotocopiadora. Él se visualiza en el futuro con un negocio ubicado en un local grande, con muchos equipos y con unos ingresos que le permitan adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en: Brayan is 24 years old and his entrepreneurial story began 2 years ago when, with the help of his father, he managed to get two computers and a copier to take advantage of the demand generated by the students in the area who ask for internet service and copies. He serves his neighbors and passers-by, in the majority students, during a schedule of 8:00 am to 9:00 pm, offering them copy and internet services. Brayan is a young man with plans, he always wants to do things and sees the need to make businesses more complete, so he currently is applying for his first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with the end of expanding his business with the purchase of two additional computers and a new copier. He sees himself in the future with a business located in a large space with a lot of equipment and with income that allows him to get his own house.

loans.use: to purchase two additional computers and a new copier.

loans.name: Famille Talisa Group

texts.fr: Lors de la récolte, Marc a constaté que la production était bonne grâce aux travaux d'entretien qu'il a pu réaliser dans son champ. Les revenus générés l'on permis d'assurer l'alimentation de sa famille. Il s'est constitué une petite épargne, s'est acheté un nouveau champ et a renforcé son activité secondaire de vente de produits vivriers. Il espère que ce nouveau crédit lui permettra de faire mieux.
texts.en: Marc realised that on harvesting his coffee, his production was good due to the maintenance work he had carried out in his field. The income generated allowed him to provide for his family's food. He has built up a small amount of savings and bought a new field; he has also boosted his secondary activity selling fresh food products. He hopes that this new loan will enable him to do even better.

loans.use: to maintain a coffee field.

loans.name: Ma. Zenaida

texts.en:
Ma. Zenaida is 29 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Ma. Zenaida works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Zenaida runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items.  

Ma. Zenaida requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Ma. Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Sherlita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Sherlita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar and other materials for her food production business.

Sherlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 57 years old and married with 11 children, one of whom is in school. Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, coffee, diapers, snack foods, and other groceries. 

Maria requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Maria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is 36 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Ma. Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, tuba, biscuits, snack foods, candies, vinegar and other groceries. 

Ma. Cristina requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, home care products, bread, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, home care products, bread, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ritchell

texts.en:
As a single parent of two children, Ritchell works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Ritchell is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Ritchell has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Leony

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Leony works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling business in the Philippines, dealing in Personal Collection and Splash products. She also earns additional income from food and vegetable vending. 

Leony is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more products from Personal Collection and Splash to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Leony has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Personal Collection to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es: Rosa es una emprendedora de 49 años que desde hace tres años administra su negocio de restaurante ubicado el municipio de Soledad, un espacio en donde vio la oportunidad de establecer un negocio familiar aplicando los conocimientos de cocina obtenidos de su padre, ella ofrece a los vecinos y transeúntes desayunos, almuerzos, pasabocas y fritos típicos de la costa caribe colombiana. Adicionalmente aprovecha el flujo de sus clientes para ofrecer los productos de variedades que exhibe en una vitrina: regalos, accesorios, ropa, utensilios de cocina, papelería entre otros.  Para consolidar y mejorar su negocio está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en ropa, calzado, accesorios y demás artículos para incrementar el inventario de su vitrina y atender la demanda de fin de año, además de fortalecer el capital de trabajo del restaurante con el fin de realizar compras de víveres al por mayor para obtener buenos descuentos. La idea de Rosa  es seguir creciendo consolidar su restaurante en el sector y obtener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 49-year old enterpriser who has managed her restaurant business for 3 years, located in the town of Soledad. A place where she saw the opportunity to establish a family business, applying her cooking knowledge that she gained from her father. She offers the neighbors and passersby breakfast, lunch, snacks and traditional fried foods from the Colombian caribbean coast. She also takes advantage of the flow of customers to offer them the products that she has in her showcase: presents, accessories, clothing, kitchen utensils, stationary, and others.

To consolidate and improve her business, she is processing her first Credikiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She plans to use it to invest in clothing, shoes, accessories and other articles to increase the inventory of her showcase and meet the end-of-the-year demand. She also wants to strengthen the income from the restaurant by purchasing supplies wholesale to get good discounts. Rosa's idea is to keep growing to consolidate her restaurant in the area and get better utilities.

loans.use: to invest in clothing, shoes, accessories and other articles to increase the inventory of her showcase.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 36, a married factory worker with three children living in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Two of her children work as factory workers and another one attends school. Lida has been a worker since 2014. Her husband is 46 and a motorcycle taxi driver.

To find a way to help her husband earn more income, Lida would like to request a loan to buy a trailer to fix to her husband’s motorcycle to run as a Tuk Tuk taxi. With this loan, she will be able to help her husband to earn more income.

In the future, she wants to expand her husband’s Tuk Tuk taxi business, renovate her house and support her youngest child to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to buy a trailer to fix her husband’s motorcycle, so it will run as a Tuk Tuk taxi.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 49 years old and has one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Judith has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Judith is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rema works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes.  

Rema is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, fish, soy sauce and utensils for her food production business.

Rema has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, fish and soy sauce for her food production business.

loans.name: Daris Isabel

texts.es: Daris es una emprendedora de 35 años y madre de dos niños de 4 y 7 años respectivamente, dedicada a la venta de víveres y comestibles en general, actividad conocida como tienda de barrio; ella inició su negocio hace dos años cuando llegó a la ciudad sin recursos ni posibilidades de trabajo, un amigo los  direccionó para que conjuntamente con su cónyuge iniciaran el negocio. Trabaja diariamente desde las 7:00 a.m. a las 10:00 p.m. y su clientela se encuentra conformado por los vecinos del barrio y transeúntes. Daris planea fortalecer su negocio incrementando sus inventarios con carnes, lácteos, legumbres, frutas, proyecto que financiará con los recursos del primer credikiva que está tramitando a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Daris tiene sus metas claras que consiste  en proyectarse  como empresaria con su idea de negocio, obtener  su casa propia, donde organizar su local comercial y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daris is a 35-year old enterpriser and mother of two children, ages 4 and 7 respectively. She works selling supplies and groceries in general, also known as a neighborhood store. She began her business two years ago when she came to the city without resources or possibilities of work. A friend directed her and her partner to starting the business. She works every day from 7 AM to 10 PM and her clientele is made up of the neighbors and passersby.

Daris plans to strengthen her business by increasing her inventory with meats, dairy products, vegetables, and fruits. This will be financed with the resources from the first Credikiva that she is processing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. Daris has clear goals that consist of projecting her self as a businesswoman with her business idea, getting her own home where she can organize her business, and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to strengthen her business by increasing her inventory with meat, dairy products, vegetables, and fruits.

loans.name: Rene Rose

texts.en:
Rene Rose, 41, is a married woman with five children, four of whom are still in school. 

Rene Rose has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Rene Rose requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Hue's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hue is a Kinh ethnic woman, has been participating in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January 2010. Her family has four members, including her husband, her two children, one daughter and one son. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from the married couple’s civil servant salary, so the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. She wants to raise chickens but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes the loan amount will help her family have money to invest effectively in chicken breeding, and when selling the first chicken herd it will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to raise chickens to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is very thankful to KIVA for the loan granted to her in the amount of PhP 50,000 in which she used to buy 3 sack of sugar, 5 sacks rice, soft drinks, and oil. Elizabeth income has increased and she was able to pay her loan on time. The revenue of her income helps with their daily expenses and the education of her grandchildren.

Today Elizabeth is requesting a re-loan amounting to PhP 50,000 to buy more sacks rice, soft drinks, canned goods and noodles and other items to restock her store as holidays are coming. She wanted to get lower prices for the items since items in manufacturing store gets high on holiday season. With this strategy she can sell her items in lower prices and still increase her income. It also an opportunity to gain more customers as her store can supply their increasing demands.

Elizabeth wanted to continuously manage and improve her store to help support her families daily needs and help support her grandchildren education.

loans.use: To buy more sacks rice, soft drinks, canned goods and noodles and other items to restock her store.

loans.name: Fazeelat's Group

texts.en:
Fazeelat is 43-years old lady; she is very poor and needy woman. Her husband's provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her entire family. He has been doing this business for many years and been using wooden planks, bamboos which has been depreciated time to time.

Now her husband is unable to continue his business without new wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Fazeelat requested a loan for her husband so that her husband can buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboos to continue his business again. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband would earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.

Fazeelat is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering material.
This is the second loan for Fazeelat; she assured us that she will pay all installments on time as usual. She is very thankful to Kiva for this honorable support

loans.use: to buy new sheltering material such as wooden planks, bamboo etc. for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Heo's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Heo, 56 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of six members, including her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law and two children of her son. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and pig breeding. The annual income after deducting costs is just about VND 40 to 50 million, and it is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. She wants to raise pigs for sales but she does not have enough money to do it. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest in pig breeding effectively with high productivity and then next year when selling the pig herd it will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to raise pigs

loans.name: Percelita

texts.en:
Percelita, 51, is a married woman with five children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Percelita has a dried-fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Percelita requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted dried fish to sell to her customers.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like sticky rice, sugar, coconut, etc. for her food production business.

Andrea has been in this business for 4 years. Andrea earns more income from general store.

Andrea has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sticky rice, sugar, coconut, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna is 39 years old and has four children. Verna is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Verna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Verna requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Verna has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Verna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 59 years old and has eight children. Teodora is married and has one child who is still in school.

Teodora is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Teodora requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teodora has been in pig fattening for 30 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Teodora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Annabel successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.NWTF is relisting Annabel's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nubia Maribel

texts.es:
Nubia es una joven emprendedora y madre Soltera de veintiocho años de edad, ella empezó hace diez años a vender productos de belleza por catálogo, ella manifiesta que al principio era muy difícil vender ya que nadie la conocía, hoy en día ésta situación ha mejorado aunque a veces pierde clientes por falta de stock en los productos. Nubia considera a éste negocio como su única fuente de ingresos y medio de subsistencia, mientras ella visita a sus clientes Natasha su pequeña hija de dos años de edad, permanece todas las mañanas en un centro de cuidado infantil gratuito.

Nubia necesita el dinero del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de mercadería para incrementar el stock de sus productos, ganar más dinero, cubrir la alimentación de su hija.
texts.en:
Nubia is a young 28-year old entrepreneur and single mother. She started 10 years ago selling beauty products from a catalog. She states that at the beginning it was very difficult to sell because no one knew her. Today that situation has improved, although she still loses customers sometimes due to lack of stock in the products.

Nubia considers this business her only source of income and livelihood. While she visits her customers, Natasha, her little 2-year old daughter, goes to a free childcare center. Nubia needs the loan money to invest in getting merchandise to increase the stock of her products, get more money, and cover her daughter's food.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nexi Idalia

texts.es:
Nexi, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es sastre y está acompañada, su pareja es empleado. 

Nexi, es sastre desde hace muchos años y trabaja en su casa todas las prendas que elabora.

Nexi, necesita el préstamo para comprar telas y para pagar la reparación de su máquina, para continuar trabajando.

Nexi, sueña con que sus hijos tengan una educación adecuada y que se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Nexi is 29-years old. She went to school until high school. She is a tailor and is married. Her partner is employed. She has been a tailor for many years and works in her own home making all of the clothes.

Nexi needs the loan to buy fabric and to pay to repair her machine in order to keep working. Nexi dreams of her children having an adequate education and that they are academically prepared.

loans.use: to buy fabric and pay to repair her machine.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 25 years old and married with two children, one child still in school. Grace works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Grace has been in this business for 5 years. In the future Grace would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 39 years old, married with two children. Amelia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Amelia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

Amelia has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Amelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Amanda Mireya

texts.es:
Amanda es una mujer muy carismática y madre soltera, ella compra pescado para freírlo y prepararlo con papas, arroz, ensalada, con una excelente atención y la alegría que brinda a sus clientes. Cada tarde a partir de las 15:00pm inicia su labor en un pequeño local que arrienda para la venta de éste delicioso alimento. Amanda menciona que antes trabajaba en una floristería todo el tiempo, esto hacia que descuide a su hija Anahí de cinco años de edad, ya que no podía estar con ella y tampoco llevarla a su lugar de trabajo como hoy lo puede hacer, ellas permanecen juntas en su negocio.
Amanda necesita el dinero para comprar más pescado, aumentar sus ventas y ganancias, de ésta manera seguir enviando a su niña a estudiar y darle un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Amanda is a very charismatic woman and single mother. She buys fish to fry and prepare with potatoes, rice, and salad, with excellent attention and happiness that she gives to her customers. Every afternoon at 3:00 PM she begins work in a small place that she rents to sell the delicious food.

Amanda mentions that she used to work in a florist all of the time, but this led to her not taking care of her daughter, Anahí, who is 5 years old. She was not able to be with her and could not take her to her workplace like she can do now. They are together in her business.

Amanda needs the money to buy more fish, increase her sales and earnings, thus continuing to send her daughter to school and to give her a better future.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like tires, iron, rope, etc for her vulcanizing shop business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 4 years. Marilyn earns more income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like tires, iron, rope, etc

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janet is 33 years old and has one child still in school.

Janet has a fishing business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her fishing business.

Janet has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 36 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for her family. Divina runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years.

Divina requested her second loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use loan to purchase items to sell such as snack foods, canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as snack foods, canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Mirian Vanesa

texts.es:
Mirian, de 35 años de edad, está acompañada, tiene 3 hijos, estudio tercer grado, su compañero de vida se dedica al trabajo agrícola. 

Mirian, trabaja vendiendo tortillas y es de esa manera como le ayuda a su pareja a cubrir algunos gastos de la casa.

Mirian, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz para elaborar las tortillas. 

Ella sueña con apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien y tengan lo necesario.
texts.en:
Mirian is 35 years old, and has a life partner and three children. She has a third grade education. Her life partner works in agriculture.

Mirian sells tortillas and this is how she helps her partner cover some of the household expenses. Mirian needs the loan so she can buy corn to make tortillas. Her dream is to support her children so they can study and have whatever is necessary.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, de 60 años de edad, es agricultor y estudió hasta segundo grado, está casado y tiene 6 hijos y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Roberto, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado desde hace 5 años, antes se dedicaba a la agricultura, específicamente a sembrar maíz y frijoles, ya que su padre le enseñó a trabajar en el campo. 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar ganado, porque él se encarga de engordarlo y luego venderlos para seguir con el negocio y obtener buenas ganancias en poco tiempo. 

Su deseo es seguir trabajando en la ganadería y la agricultura, ya que él siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar sus tierras y cosechar el sustento para su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto, a farmer, is 60 years old and studied up to the second grade. He is married and has six children. His wife does the household chores.

Roberto has been buying and selling livestock for the past five years. Before that he was a farmer, growing corn and beans since his father taught him to work in the fields.

The loan will be used to buy livestock because he is in charge of fattening them and then selling them, keeping the business running and getting good profits in a short amount of time.

His wish is to continue working in livestock and farming since he has always been dedicated to working the land and reaping a living for his family.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 31 years old, a married woman and mother of two children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For this reason, Mumtaz applied for a loan for her husband from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. He wants to buy new tires and a little bit of engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers.

Mumtaz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. She says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair an auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Dolina

texts.en:
Dolina is 49 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Dolina is in an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Dolina has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dolina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 42 years old and married with three children who are currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and personal care products.

Jennifer has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and personal care products.

loans.name: Eleticia

texts.es:
Eleticia, de 58 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ella a los oficios domésticos. 

Eleticia, actualmente se dedica a los trabajos del hogar, pero antes se dedicaba a engordar pollos y cerdos. 

El préstamo que está solicitando será utilizado para comprar 6 quintales de fertilizantes para abonar los cultivos de maíz que su esposo posee. 

Ella en un futuro desea estar con sus nietos y también quiere hacer mejoramientos en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Eleticia is 58 years old, married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer and she does household chores. Eleticia currently stays at home but previously she raised chickens and pigs.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy six quintals (about 100 lbs. each) of fertilizer for her husband's corn crops.

In the future she hopes to spend time with her grandchildren and she also wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy six quintals (about 100 lb. each) of fertilizer for her husband's corn fields.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Forty-nine year old Evelyn engages in the raising and selling of hogs. She is married with two children. Her youngest child is 18. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for 10 years now. Her husband is a driver.

Evelyn would like to improve her livelihood by adding more pigs and abundant maintenance in order to have quality pigs to be sold. She decided to take a loan to purchase pigs and feeds. These are vital in her day to day activity and also to become successful.

Then she could be able to support the schooling of her child and seek ways to become sustainable in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feeds.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a very hardworking married woman with five children, living in Masindi-Uganda. At thirty six years, she is very engaged in agriculture but also sells food stuffs from a stall.

She would love to have a better life, and this forces her to work harder for a better future for her family. Rose has a hope of educating her children and requests a loan to help her in plowing and buying pesticides.

loans.use: to help her with plowing and in buying pesticides.

loans.name: Suchitra

texts.en:
Suchitra is a very courageous, 41-year-old woman. She is a housewife from Jogendrapur village in Falakata town and the mother of three children (one son and two daughters). Her children are students in different grades in local schools. Her husband is a farmer who keeps himself busy in farming. She and her husband both are illiterate, but know how to sign their names.

Suchitra's husband has farmland where he cultivates different seasonal vegetables and sells them to the market. Suchitra also assists her husband in the agricultural work. Now they want to cultivate cabbage on this land, as per the demand of their local market. It is the best season to cultivate cabbages, so she is requesting this loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to buy quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivation of cabbages and avoiding contamination of insects and diseases.

She hopes the cultivation of cabbage will give her extensive financial support in the near future and will produce a peaceful environment, which is lacking in her family. The additional income will help her to fulfill her dream of purchasing more cultivable lands.

Now Suchitra is very happy and gives her heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farming resources for cabbage cultivation.

loans.name: Rabisun

texts.en:
Rabisun, a 27-year-old, is an active married lady of the village Hotelpara in the Murshidabad district of West Bengal. Her family comprises her husband, two sons and one daughter. Two of her children attend village primary school, and the other one is a toddler. Rabisun studied till grade 5, and her husband is illiterate.

The main source of income of Rabisun's family is from a Toto rickshaw transportation service (Toto is an auto rickshaw operated by battery). Her husband has been doing this work for two years. Her husband is running the Toto in the nearest town of Kandi. Now the Toto needs some repairs and also needs a change of battery, but her husband does not have sufficient money to bear the repairing cost.

Therefore Rabisun wants to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to bear the repairing cost and buy a battery for the Toto rickshaw. After repairing the Toto rickshaw, they expect a good income. This will help her to generate extra income, and she will be able to complete the construction of her semi-concrete house and give her children better education.

Rabisun will be ever grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to bear the repair cost and buy a battery for the Toto rickshaw.

loans.name: José Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, es agricultor y está casado, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos trabajan y los otros dependen de él y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

Pedro, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y otros cultivos agrícolas, antes estuvo trabajando en E.E.U.U. pero decidió regresar a El Salvador para estar al lado de su familia. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes y herbicidas para los cultivos de maíz y frijol.

Pedro, desea seguir trabajando y estar al lado de su esposa e hijos porque es lo más importante que posee.
texts.en:
Pedro, 54, attended school until the fifth grade. He is a farmer, married with four children, two of whom work and the other two are still dependent on Pedro and his wife, who is a domestic worker.
Pedro grows corn and other crops. Before, he was working in the United States, but he decided to return to El Salvador to be with his family. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his corn and bean crops. Pedro would like to continue working and be with his wife and children, because that is the most important thing he has.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides for growing corn and beans.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María es una emprendedora de 51 años y madre de  dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante gracias a su ímpetu luchador y su espíritu emprendedor. Ella está separada de su cónyuge y no contaba con más ingresos que los que alcanza a producir, así que hace 4 años decidió incursionar en las ventas puerta a puerta, para lo cual escogió los productos alimenticios por ser de consumo masivo y fácil venta.  Maria  trabaja 8 horas diarias, propiciando sus ventas a través de visitas a amigos, vecinos y familiares a los que les ofrece en venta Yogurt, dulces, pan y pudines. Actualmente centra toda su energía en fortalecer su negocio para lo cual está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo recursos que invertirá un mayor volumen de Yogurt, dulces, pan y pudines, con el de incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus utilidades que le permitan obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising 51-year-old mother of two children who she was able to raise thanks to her entrepreneurial and fighting spirit.

She is separated from her partner and does not have any income other than what she manages to earn. So four years ago she decided to try selling food products door-to-door because it is for mass consumption and is easy to sell. Maria works 8 hours every day by visiting friends, neighbors and family members to sell them yogurt, sweets, bread and puddings.

Currently she is focusing her efforts on strengthening her business and for that purpose she is working on her first Kiva loan through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the proceeds of the loan to invest in larger quantities of yogurt, sweets, bread, and puddings so she can increase her sales and improve her profits, leading to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in larger quantities of yogurt, sweets, bread, and puddings.

loans.name: Suniti

texts.en:
Suniti is an enterprising woman of 46 years from the small village of Chuyakhola of Falakata in the district of Alipurduar. She is married and a mother of one son who is engaged in a small business. They are from a humble family of scarce of economic resources. Her husband is engaged in a wooden bran business. Due to low income, Suniti is unable to manage her family expenses properly.

Besides being a housewife, Suniti is involved with husbandry of cows. She buys cows and takes care of them and rears them, then sells the milk at the local market. Sometimes for earning more money, she also sells the cow dung. Now she wants to upgrade her business. But money is the main problem for her. Thus, she is seeking a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to buy another cow. She hopes that this loan will give a boost in her business as well as enable her to upgrade her financial status with the profit of her business.

She dreams to purchase two more cows in the future to enlarge her business with the profit of her business. She gives her heartiest thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase one cow for enhancing her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia y tambien se dedica a la venta de antojitos desde hace 3 años, tiene mucha clientela y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con sus grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas mercaderia como: sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young woman whose face has been pixelated because she lives in a high risk area is 28 years old. She has run a small store out of her home and has also sold snacks for three years. She has many customers and with what she earns, she manages to pay for some of the household expenses. She lives in the family home.

Now she is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise such as soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet bread. Then she will be able to earn more money and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy more merchandise such as soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet bread

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is passionate about caring for children. She worked in childcare for 11 years in Mexico before marrying her husband and moving to the United States in 2003. Once she moved, she worked for seven years providing care for autistic children.

Last year, she decided to attend Southwestern College to receive her certification as a small business day care, so that she could open up her own day care in her home. She graduated from this six-month course in December and has since decided to continue her schooling, so that she can receive a degree in child development in December 2016.

Margarita will use her Kiva loan to rent an apartment in which to operate her day care. The funds will be used to cover the first month’s rent, along with the security deposit. The remaining funds will be used to purchase cribs, beds, toys and additional supplies such as blankets, plates, and baby wipes.

With your help, Margarita will be able to provide quality care to the children of San Diego.

loans.use: to rent an apartment in which to operate her day care.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is from Dakshin Parangerpar village, a rural area of Falakata, West Bengal. She is a 26-year-old, young, energetic and enterprising woman. She has two very young sons; one has started going to school, and the other is a toddler. In her childhood, her poor parents could not afford her education after grade 9.

Since two years ago, her husband has been involved in agriculture, which is the primary means of earning for their livelihood. Their customers are their neighbors and local villagers who come to the local market area looking for good quality products. Their products are much in demand as they supply fresh vegetables like eggplant, cabbage, potatoes, etc., at cheaper rates compared to other cultivators in the region. Their customer demand is increasing day by day.

Now they want to cultivate bitter gourds besides other vegetables, but they lack the capital to purchase the necessary farm supplies. The challenges they face are climatic changes and the decreasing market price of their products. In order to avoid these obstacles, Swapna is requesting a loan from BJS, a partner of Kiva, to buy fertilizers, pesticides and high quality bitter gourd seeds.

She is hopeful to obtain the best profit by increasing the harvest in order to generate better income and give her children a better quality of life. She has a long-cherished dream to construct a concrete house for them, which she hopes will come into reality with the help of the generated profit.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for the cultivation of bitter gourds.

loans.name: Jenefie

texts.en:
For almost four years now, Jenefie runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like cooking oil, powdered soap, biscuits, eggs, bread, chips, sugar, coffee, condiments and assorted drinks.
She has a six-year old daughter and lives in the town of Alicia, Bohol.
She needs funds to fill the stocks of her store.

Jenefie has requested a loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP to buy assorted groceries like biscuits, soft drinks and toiletries. These are very essential so as to avoid shortage of stocks and also attract more consumers to purchase. Thus, it will improve her income and pay her obligation.

She hopes that through these income, she could able to finance the schooling of her child especially college education for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries like biscuits, soft drinks and toiletries

loans.name: El Gharam Group

texts.en:
Hanan is the featured borrower for El Gharam Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Hanan is a 29-year-old married mother of one child. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she started almost a year ago preparing and selling "Mouneh" from her house to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She is well-known in her locale for her delicious and tasty "Mouneh". She is working hard to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's to renovate her house to make it a healthier place for her family, for the upcoming winter season.

She also wants to buy necessary ingredients (groats, yogurt, etc..) to increase her Mouneh production. Hanan is the first lady on the right of the photo.
With respect to the other group members, Gharam is the lady standing in the middle, and Salwa is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to renovate her house for the upcoming winter season and buy ingredients (groats, yogurt, etc..) to increase her Mouneh production.

loans.name: Niña Rosa

texts.en:
Niña Rosa is 22 years old and married with one child.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Niña Rosa is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Niña Rosa has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
Renelyn is 23 years old, single.

Renelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Renelyn requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Renelyn has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Renelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 61 years old and married with three children. Rosario works very hard to provide for them.

Rosario runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products.

Rosario has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Rosario would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Anjilina

texts.en:
Anjilina is 50 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and mother of 8 children. Anjilina has been running her own beauty salon for past 5 years, she also contribute her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brushes and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Anjilina has applied for Kiva loan.

This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes, so that she can provide better services to her customers, it will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.
On this financial assistance Anjilina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase stocks for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare her home for use as a nursery

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen tiene 64 años, y considera que su actividad como emprendedora la ayuda a mantenerse activa y útil para su familia. Hace tres años tuvo la iniciativa de comprar una vitrina y comenzó vendiendo a sus vecinos y familiares, dulces y variedades como papelería, accesorios para el cabello, adornos, regalos entre otros; posteriormente incorporó el servicio de llamadas telefónicas y recargas a celular. Ella trabaja en el horario de 7:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. y sueña con fortalecer su negocio aumentando la oferta de productos para lo cual está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo recursos que proyecta invertir en ropa y calzado. Su meta es ampliar su negocio, adquirir más vitrinas, ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos que le generen mayores ventas y mejores utilidades para apoyar a su nieto.
texts.en:
Carmen is 64 years old and believes that her job as a businesswoman keeps her active and useful to her family. Three years ago she took the initiative to buy a display cabinet and started to sell candy and other items such as stationery, hair accessories, ornaments, giftware etc. to her neighbours and relatives. She used to include phone services and cell phone charge cards.

Carmen works from 7 am to 7 pm. Her dream is to strengthen her business by increasing the type of products she offers. For this reason she is seeking her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to invest in clothing and footwear. Her goal is to expand her business, acquire more display cabinets, and offer a wider variety of goods. Then she will make more sales and earn more money to support her grandson.

loans.use: buy clothing and footwear.

loans.name: José Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo, de 33 años de edad, es agricultor y estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado y tiene dos hijos de 14 y 8 años de edad y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

Reinaldo, trabajo durante 4 años en una granja de pollos que vendía en temporadas, también trabaja en la agricultura y con ganado de repasto.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar ganado para repasto y luego venderlos a un mejor precio, también destinará una parte para comprar fertilizantes y abonar sus cultivos de maíz. 

Él planea seguir trabajando en las actividades agropecuarias y darles una buena educación a sus dos hijos y que en el futuro sean personas de bien y con un grado académico superior.
texts.en:
Reinaldo, age 33, is a farmer. He went to school through the ninth grade. He is married and has two children, ages 14 and 8. His wife devotes herself to the household chores.

Reinaldo worked on a chicken farm that sold seasonally for four years. He also works in agriculture with grazing livestock.

The loan will be used to buy grazing livestock to later sell for a better price. He will also use part of the loan to buy fertilizers and compost for his corn crops.

He plans to continue working in agriculture and giving his two children a good education. He will do this so that in the future they become good people with a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to buy livestock and fertilizer and compost for his corn crops.

loans.name: Joseph Anthony

texts.fr: Anthony est âgé de 46 ans. Il est marié et père de quatre enfants. Il a une petite boutique chez lui où il vend des produits alimentaires. Parallèlement, il fait aussi le commerce de bétails : il achète et revend des chèvres selon la saison. Il a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock de produits alimentaires dans la boutique.
texts.en: Anthony is 46 years old. He is married and the father of four children. He has a small store at his home where he sells food products. In parallel, he also trades in livestock: he buys and resells goats according to the season. He needs a loan to increase his stock of food products in the store.

loans.use: to buy cases of spaghetti.

loans.name: Chaina

texts.en:
Chaina, 26 years old, is married and a mother of two kids (one son and one daughter). She is from Falakata. She lives there with her husband and children. She studied up to grade 6 because she did not get the opportunity to achieve further education due to the poor financial resources of her parents.

Chaina’s husband is involved with cultivation, and she also helps her husband in his work. They do weeding, caring for the crop and other tasks before harvesting the crops. With several years of experience in farm work, they have been able to get ahead despite the difficulties that have arisen along the way.

Now that the family expenses are increasing day by day, they feel they need further improvement in their agricultural activities. So they have decided to cultivate paddy (rice), which is an all-season crop. After harvesting it, they will sell the produce to the market. Being the staple food of the regional people, it has very high demand throughout the year, so they hope this harvest will generate more income.

Thus Chaina is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to buy agricultural supplies, such as paddy seeds, fertilizers, etc., to expand the cultivation. Chaina conveys her thanks to her lenders for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sarah is 51 years old and has three children who are in school.

Sarah has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Sarah has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 46 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Lerma works very hard to provide for them.

Lerma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, firewood, home care products, and other groceries.

Lerma has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lerma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, firewood, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 46 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.
