Melba runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Melba has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, coffee, soft drinks, beer, snack foods, etc.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old; she is married, with four children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, eggs, snacks foods, noodles, spices, soap and other personal care products.

Teresita has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Teresita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, eggs, snacks foods, noodles, spices, soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Nacira Del Carmen

texts.es: Nacira es una emprendedora de 41 años que combina su actividad de negocio con sus  obligaciones de madre y ama de casa. Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la comercialización de calzado , ropa y  bolsos a vecinos, amigos y familiares por encargo; ella trabaja diariamente de 8:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. mediante visitas que realiza a sus clientes para propiciar sus ventas las cuales promociona a través de catálogos. Actualmente está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en ropa, calzado y bolsos a fin de aprovecha el incremento en la demanda que generan las festividades de fin de año. Su meta es generar utilidades que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida, organizar su negocio en un local comercial y apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nacira, age 41,is an entrepreneur who combines her business activity with her obligations as a mother and housewife. She has been selling shoes, clothes, and bags on order to her neighbors, friends, and relatives for nine years. She works daily from 8:00 a.m until 7:00 p.m. She does this through sales visits that she makes to her customers, which she promotes through catalogs.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to invest in clothes, shoes, and bags in order to take advantage of the increase in demand that is generated by the end of the year festivities. Her goal is to generate profits that will allow her to improve her quality of life, to organize her business in a commercial place, and to support her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and bags.

loans.name: Tomijan

texts.en:
Tomijan is a 40-year-old, married woman and is raising three children (two grown-up sons and one daughter) together with her husband. Her eldest son is now engaged in a centering business. Her other son is jobless, and her only daughter is in school.

Tomijan is illiterate but can sign her name. Her husband, Jabed, is also uneducated and cannot sign his name. They live in the small village of Bara Shoulmari village in Falakata.

Tomijan is engaged in a milk-supply business. She rears cows and supplies milk from door to door in their locality. Her husband is a rented van puller. Unfortunately, their income is not satisfactory as per their expectation. The total income for the family is hardly enough to bear the food expenses of a family of five.

To cope with the situation, Tamijan has decided to expand her business by purchasing another dairy cow. She has come to know about Kiva’s partner BJS and has applied for a loan from them to buy a cow.

The extra milk will help her to cater to more customers and earn more revenue. Moreover, she can sell the cow dung, which is used as good manure in the rural areas in their locality, to earn better.

Her dreams are to use her earnings for providing better education to her children, to meet the family's financial needs and buy a Toto (a battery-operated auto rickshaw) for further means of income.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en: Liezl, 42, is married with six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For five years, Liezl has operated a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. Liezl would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna, 33, is married with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For two years she has operated a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. Edna requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell. In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 54 years old, married, and has three children. One is in school.

Ana is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ana has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Alicia has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Editha is 57 years old now.

Editha has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell.

Editha has been in this business for 32 years. In the future, Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar is 45 years old lady and a responsible mother of 4 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own decorative plastic show piece business for 5 years. Kausar's husband needs to purchase different types of decoration items in plastic show pieces - e.g pots, vases, etc for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these items.

To fulfill the need of her husband Kausar has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy these items. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs
Kausar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's decorative plastic show piece business.

loans.name: Rupa

texts.en:
Rupa is a very active woman of 27 years of age. She lives with her family in the village named Biswaspara in Kandi, West Bengal. She is a housewife and blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). Both of her children are small kids; one has just started going to school, and the other is below school-going age.

Rupa’s husband has been running a laundry shop for the last 15 years. He washes and presses clothing of the local people. He started the business with a small investment of his own, but now he needs to expand his business and renovate the shop so that he can store more garments and serve more customers. Thus, he can increase his income also, but the main obstacle he is facing is lack of capital to invest in his business.

So, as a responsible wife, Rupa is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS. With this loan amount she can help her husband to expand his business.

Rupa and her husband are grateful toward the lenders.

loans.use: to bear the cost for renovating the laundry shop.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir is 46 years old. He is married and has two children. He is an IDP (internally displaced persons) from the  Fuzuli city and now lives together with his wife and children in the Horadiz village of the Fuzuli region. Zakir has been in the cattle business for five years. Zakir has applied to Komak company. He needs his first loan in the amount of 1700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy a cow for getting more milk and increasing his income. He says he is greatly thankful to Kiva organization and lenders for the help.

loans.use: to buy a cow for getting more milk and increasing his income

loans.name: Mohpari

texts.en: Mohpari is 45 years old and lives in the Farkhor district with her family. She is asking for her first loan from Humo. She has one calf at home, and with the loan amount she would like to purchase more cattle and start a business. Her husband helps her, and Mohpari hopes that her new business will improve their living conditions. Currently she does not have any money, but she believes that with the help of Kiva lenders she can fulfill her dream. Mohpari awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and start her business.

loans.name: Anabelia

texts.en: Anabelia, 27, is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. For six years she has raised pigs in the Philippines. Anabelia requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs. Anabelia has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future Anabelia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elsa is 48 years old and has one child in school.

Elsa has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. Marilou is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional baskets of fish to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 30 years old and has one children. Felisa is single and has one child in school.

Felisa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Felisa requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Felisa has been in this business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Felisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 30 years old and married with one child. Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Melanie has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Melanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 50 years old and married with five children, one of whom in school, Edna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Edna has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 67 years old and has four children. Gloria is married woman.

Gloria is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gloria has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 60 years old now.

Jocelyn has a buy and sell jewelry business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more jewelry to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Soksan's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Battambang province, Soksan is 39-year-old. She is a mother of three children and one of them still in school. She earns income to support her living condition via rice cropping for 7 years and working as a labor worker to supplement her income.

The lack of capital to buy fertilizer to support her farm is the main challenge for her. In the group of four, she is the group leader. She is requesting a loan with VisionFund to buy rice seed and fertilizer to improve her farm to get more yields. This is her six cycle with VisionFund and those previous loans help her to have better living conditions by having enough household consumption. She hopes that this new loan can help her rice produce good yield and earns her more income, so that she can upgrade her living and send her children to school on time.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer to grow her crop well and increase output as well as her income to save for her child's school fees.

loans.name: Shumaila's Group

texts.en:
Shumaila is 35-years old, married, and the mother of three children.
Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his van which always remains in bad condition. He has been driving a van for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For this reason, Shumaila has contacted with Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can repair his van. He wants to maintain the engine’s piston, one wheel and needs to pay labor costs. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

Shumaila is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to use this loan to repair the van for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Paz De Jesus

texts.es: Paz de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de sopas, golosinas, dulces, refrescos, granos básicos, aceite, etc. todo por mayor ya que le va bien en sus ventas y asi puda tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Paz is 31 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has a small store that has been located in her house for the past 5 years. She has a lot of customers, especially her neighbors. With what she generates from the sales, she is able to cover some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan again to buy soups, snacks, candies, beverages, basic grains, oil, etc., in bulk, since sales are going well and to generate a better income.

loans.use: to purchase soups, snacks, candies, beverages, basic grains, oil, etc., in bulk.

loans.name: Kimsea

texts.en:
Kimsea is 23 years old and resides in the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. She has been working as an employee since 2012, earning around $5 per day.

Kimsea is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Law at the university in the province. Due to the fact that she is short of the finances to pay her tuition fees for the fourth year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully.

After graduation, she wants to find another better job with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees in Law for the fourth year.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina who is in her late 40s, is a widow with six kids, who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for three years now. She works from 04pm to 10pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Christina’s 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the food stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She also used the profit to buy bricks for building a good toilet, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on food stock. She dreams of building her own house.

Christina will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to increase on the food stock for her food stall

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Annie is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Annie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Annie requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fruits, vegetable, etc..

Annie has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Annie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fruits, vegetable, etc.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda is forty-four years of age. She is married with three children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. In 1992 she committed herself to growing cocoa which has assisted her to make some good income to sustain her family's basic needs. She wishes to expand her plantations to get more profits and develop her family although unfavorable weather conditions affect her growth. She used the first loan to buy cocoa to sell and she is happy with the returns, especially during profitable season of the year. Sauda managed to use the profits to repay the loan,pay medical bills and save some little money. She is again requesting for a loan to top on her savings to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 33 years old and has two children. Lilibeth is married and has two children who are in school.

Lilibeth is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence applied for a loan of ugx1,500,000 and is aged 41. This is her fifth loan cycle from UGAFODE. She is married and four kids are in school. The kids are aged 19, 17, 15 and 13 years old respectively.

She deals in banana plantation farming and she has a bar to supplement the income. She works for 8 hours a day. She also gets incomes from selling drinks like boiled water and beer among others. She started this business in 2008 in Buhuma Ishaka municipality, so as to raise money to educate her children.

She says she will use this loan funds to buy organic fertilizers in order to increase her yields and output. She will also hire labour to increase the size of the plantation, as well as its quality. Her dream ideal is to educate her children and her main challenge is stiff competition. She is hard working and he says UGAFODE staff has good customer care.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and hire labour.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 26-year-old, single Syrian man who started five years ago working in the construction field to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying hard to start his own business. Due to his limited salary, Hasan is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his weddings expenses. This loan is very important to Hasan as it will help him make his dream come true.

loans.use: to pay his wedding expenses

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evalyn is 48 years old and has six children who are currently in school.

Evalyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her local market.

Evalyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lucita is 42 years old now.

Lucita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lucita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas works hard to support his family. He is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Nicolas requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for his fishing business.

He has been in this business for 10 years now.

Nicolas would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for his fishing business

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 42 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Maribeth works very hard to provide for them.

Maribeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Maribeth has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 40-year-old married woman, the mother of a single child. She is living happily with her family in the area of Multan, Pakistan.

She owns a embroidery business at home. Due to the high cost of embroidery raw materials, she is facing a shortage of material and is unable to purchase expensive raw material to use.

Therefore, Kalsoom requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can address the shortage of embroidery materials.

Through this amount she will buy stocks of thread, fancy clothes, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors.

Kalsoom is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials.

loans.name: Maribern

texts.en:
Maribern is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Maribern has been in this business for 15 years. Maribern earns more income from making furniture.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Muselia

texts.en:
Muselia works hard to support her family. Muselia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Muselia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food production business.

In the future, Muselia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analyn is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Analyn has a coconut shell vending business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of coconut shell to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Analyn has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of coconut shells to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like buy-and-sell rice.

Divina dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rita is 34 years old and has four children who are presently in school.

Rita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her local market.

Rita has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 54 years old and has four children. She is a married woman.

Marieta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marieta has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 43-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and six children in the area of Multan, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sells it to the recycling factories. Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have the amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell to get money.

Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.

She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a 50-year old married woman. She lives with her two daughters and one son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running a mobile shop for the past five years.

Bushra's husband wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories such as cases, anti-lost and selfies wireless companions, mass storage, chargers, external batteries, photo accessories, etc.

Therefore, Bushra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband would be able to purchase relevant items for his business purposes so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Bushra is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy accessories such as cases, anti-lost and selfies wireless companions, mass storage, chargers, external batteries, photo accessories, etc. for her husband's mobile shop.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 37-year-old retailer and at the same time grows and trades in cocoa that adds more income.

He is faced with challenges of low sales levels and profits that hinder the progress of his business. However, he has hopes of expanding his cocoa business and be able to make enough money to aid him in educating all six of his children.

He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda and is requesting for a loan to buy merchandise like sugar, soap, tea and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sugar, soap, tea and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new modern DJ for her musical instruments shop.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is an amazing mother who lives in Yata village near Hebron. She has five children and she is working hard to ensure a good life for them and ensure that they do not need anything.
Lina's husband works as employee, but he cannot cover all the needs for his big family. She wants to help him in anyway she can and because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, she decided to open her own business.

Lina started her business five years ago. She sews clothes to sell. After she felt that she had a good experience in this business, she decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy a new sewing machine and yarns and fabrics to increase her income.
She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine and yarns and fabrics to increase her income.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is a 18-years-old single man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Ibraheem works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. He would like to improve the family living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Ibraheem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine and solar system for the family house. By taking this loan, Ibraheem will be able to provide clean water especially for his ailing mother.
Ibraheem appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
“Ukay-ukay” is a coined term from Filipino word “hukay” or “dig” in English. It refers to the hot business in the Philippines nowadays – the selling of used clothes. Yes, used clothes are being sold in the Philippines, but these are of course in good condition and are usually branded.  They are quite in demand due to their low, low prices. At the onset of this business, used clothes were literally piled on top of a table or floor and customers would dig deep to get their choice clothes. It has leveled up these days and clothes are already arranged in cabinets and hangers just like in the picture above. 

Allan, 46, chose to venture in this kind of business. He operates a store of used clothes in one of the commercial establishments in Toril, Davao City. He offers jeans, slack pants, shorts, t-shirts, blouses, bags, and household items like bed sheets and blankets. Now he would like to add more selections of hot items to entice the buyers. He needs PhP 25,000 additional capital to procure boxes of used clothes, including sweaters and jackets, which are in demand this rainy season. He also plans to include stuffed toys and accessories. He hopes you are willing to help him so he can increase his profit, sustain his family’s daily needs, and boost his savings. 

Allan is married and has a son who is studying in college. He wants to see his son with a stable job someday. He is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to procure boxes of used clothes including sweaters and jackets

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients and more fish for her business.

Rose has been in this business for 10 years. Rose earns additional income from fishing.

Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and more fish for her business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 50 years old and married with six children, two of whom are still in school. Daisy works very hard to provide for them.

Daisy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, snack foods, and personal care products .

Daisy has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Nelfida Rosa

texts.es: Nelfida es una joven emprendedora de 21 años que por la necesidad de generar ingresos para ayudarse con sus gastos personales y de estudios, hace un año optó por aceptar las recomendaciones de una amiga que la direccionó por el negocio de ventas por catálogo ofreciendo productos cosméticos y artículos para el hogar; ella afirma que los resultados han sido satisfactorios y se ajusta a su condición de estudiante porque cuenta con beneficios como flexibilidad en los horarios laborales y libertad para trabajar prácticamente desde cualquier lugar, además del poco capital requerido. Actualmente Nelfida tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para obtener un capital e invertir en productos del catálogo que le permita aprovechar la temporada de las fiestas de fin de año, con el que planea obtener muy buenos ingresos. Ella tiene como meta terminar su carrera profesional  y fortalecer su negocio de tal manera que a futuro pueda tener una distribuidora de productos.
texts.en:
Nelfida is an enterprising youth who needs to generate income to help with her personal expenses and her education.  One year ago, she chose to accept the recommendation of a friend who pointed her toward a business selling through a catalog.  She offers cosmetics and household items for sale.

She states that her results have been satisfactory, and that the business is compatible with her status as a student because she has flexibility in her work schedule and the freedom to work just about anywhere.  Also, the business does not require much capital.  

At this time, Nelfida is taking her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use the loan to invest in products from a catalog so that she can stock up to take advantage of the season of festivities at the end of the year.  With this investment, she expects to get very good earnings.  Nelfida's goal is to complete her professional degree and strengthen her business so that in the future she can become a product distributor.

loans.use: to buy products from a catalog to sell

loans.name: Edwin Arley

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre soltero con 23 años de edad, trabajador y muy humilde, luego de quedarse sin empleo durante varios meses inicio a trabajar en la cría y venta de ganado, de allí obtiene los ingresos mínimos para cubrir sus necesidades básicas.
Labora toda la semana durante 3 horas.
Edwin se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprará una hembra porcina y un suplemento nutricional para el sostenimiento de los cerdos.
La adversidad que lo ha perseguido no ha sido obstáculo para querer salir adelante y cumplir el sueño de remodelar su casa, ya que el estado actual de esta no es el mejor.
Para esto cuenta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los prestamistas del portal Kiva.
texts.en:
Edwin is a single 23 year old man who is very hard-working and humble. After being without employment for a number of months he started to raise and sell livestock and from this he obtains minimal income to cover his basic needs. He works 3 hours per day all week.

Edwin finds himself requesting a loan with which he will buy a sow and nutritional supplement for sustenance for the pigs.

The adversity that has dogged him has not been an obstacle for him to want to get ahead and fulfill his dream of remodeling his house, as in it's present state it is not the best. For this he can count on the support of Interactuar and the lenders at Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a sow and nutritional supplement for sustenance for the pigs.

loans.name: Alexander David

texts.es:
Alexander es un hombre con 27 años de edad, trabajador, responsable y muy humilde, luego de quedarse sin empleo durante tres meses, y pasar situaciones económicas bastante duras, anhela montar su propio negocio, quiere dedicarse a vender comidas, una actividad que aprendió gracias a su madre, quien se dedica a lo mismo.
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos, vitrinas y estanterías.
Espera crecer con su negocio y llegar a generar empleo a las personas que más lo necesiten.

Su actitud positiva y los deseos de salir adelante permiten ver en esta persona, unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Alexander is a 27 year-old man who is hardworking, responsible, and very humble.  After being without work for 3 months, and passing through quite a difficult financial situation, he wants to start up his own business.  Alexander wants to start a business selling food, an activity that he learned thanks to his mother, who has a similar business.

Alexander is requesting a loan to invest in food, glass display cases, and shelves.  He hopes to grow his business and eventually employ others who need work.

Alexander's positive attitude and his desire to get ahead are evident.  He has an enormous desire to succeed, and so he received a favorable response to his request.

loans.use: to buy food, glass display cases, and shelves

loans.name: Hoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurn is 58 years old and has six children, one of whom attends school. She lives in Banteay Meanchey Province. She grows cassava and rice to earn income for her family, which she has been doing for 20 years. She earns extra income growing vegetables such as cucumbers, potatoes, and beans. She earns about $10 a day.

Hoeurn's rice and cassava do not grow well because of flooding. She requested her seventh loan from VisionFund, which she will use to purchase more fertilizer to input her rice farm in order to produce more yields. This loan will help her save for her child's school fees.

Hoeurn is in a group of three members and she is the group leader. She hopes that she can get more income from her farm to support her living condition and support her child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 35-year-old woman. She lives in Multan, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. For many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw.

Therefore Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Sajida is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is 44 years old and married and she has two children, both of whom are in school.

Marisol is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years now, and she has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marisol requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Marisol would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support four children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 2100 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Susan is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Amafaith

texts.en:
Amafaith is 25 years old and has five children. Amafaith is single and has two children are still in school.

Amafaith is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Amafaith requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Amafaith has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a married woman, 49 years old with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marjorie has a buy and sell car tire business in the Philippines. Marjorie requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more tire to sell.

Marjorie has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more tires to sell.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is 32 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three children, and her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Noreen has also been doing her business of clothes selling for the past eight years and contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household.

Noreen needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is not in a position to buy these clothes for her business purposes; therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance, Noreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her clothing business.

loans.name: Lizeth Johana

texts.es: Lizeth, una joven emprendedora de 23 años se dedica desde hace 4 años al negocio de la belleza, brindando a los vecinos de un barrio popular de la ciudad de Barranquilla los servicios de peluquería y cosmetología; ella afirma que todas las personas buscan mejorar su apariencia y están dispuestas a pagar buenas cantidades de dinero con tal de conseguirlo, así que ella vio una oportunidad de negocio rentable. Estudió cosmetología y se mantiene actualizada con las últimas tendencias asistiendo permanentemente a cursos de belleza y cosmetología. En sus inició contó con la ayuda de su mamá quien le compró una vitrina la cual surtió con productos de belleza los cuales comercializa conjuntamente con los servicios que presta en su residencia y a domicilio en el horario de 8:00 a.m. a 5 p.m. Lizeth siempre está atenta a las necesidades que plantea su clientela, es por eso que proyecto adicionar a su actividad el comercio de ropa, calzado, accesorios entre otros, con el fin de generar mejores ingresos, proyecto que financiará con los recursos de su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Su visión es tener un negocio próspero para ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Lizeth is a young 23 year old entrepreneur and for the past 4 years she has worked in the beauty business. She offers her neighbors of a popular community in the city of Barranquilla, beauty salon services. She states that everyone wants to improve their appearance and are willing to pay a good amount of money to achieve that, and that is how she saw a good opportunity for a profitable business.

She studied cosmetology and keeps up with the latest trends by continuously attending to beauty and cosmetician courses. At the beginning, her mother helped her by purchasing a display cabinet which she stocked with beauty products. She sales these along with the beauty services that she offers in her house and in her clients' homes from 8:00 a.m. to 5 p.m.

Lizeth is always paying attention to the needs and requests of her customers, that is why she planned to add to her business the sale of clothes, shoes and accessories among others with the goal of generating better income. She will finance this project with the first "credikiva" loan that she is currently requesting from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Her vision is to have a thriving business to help her mother with the household expenses.

loans.use: buy clothes, shoes and accessories among others.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
has applied for a loan of 3,000,000UGX. He is 36 years old. This is his second loan cycle from UGAFODE. He is married to one wife and four children ages 18, 14, 10 and 3 years old.

He works for 8 hours a day in his retail shop. He also gets income from selling drinks like boiled water, porridge, packed milk and sodas. He started this business on 2003 in kasubi, katunguru, kasese District.  He started these businesses to earn money for his children's education. He says he will use this loan to buy more stock. His dream is to complete his house. The main business challenge he faces is stiff competition. He is hard working and says that UGAFODE staff have good customer service.

loans.use: To boost his business by buying cartons of water, packaged juice, milk, crates of soda and other items

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Fifty-four years old Carmelita is a farmer and is married to a farmer, with four children. Farming serves as her main source of income. Her oldest child is 17 and still attending school. She lives in the town of Alicia, Bohol. They have been engaged in rice farming for almost 9 years now.

She would like to improve the yield of her farm by acquiring additional funds to purchase the necessary materials needed. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers. These will enable her to produce a good quality rice and slowly augment her earnings.

She is determined to work hard and look for ways on how to improve her rice farming livelihood to be able to finish the study of her child and also be more sustainable in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella works hard to support her family. Estrella is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to purchase of gasoline, wood, rope, fishing net, etc.

Estrella has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase of gasoline, wood, rope, fishing net, etc. to fish

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a married woman, 34 years old.

Annabelle has a service spa business in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials like oil, cream and other materials to use in her business.

Annabelle has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like oil, cream and other materials to use in her spa business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 42 years old and has three children. Arlene is married and has three children are currently in school.

Arlene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Arlene has been in this business for 2 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 42 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, snack foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for 23 years and sells a variety of items. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, snack foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena is 48 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Efrena operates a weaving business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Efrena requested a loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more raw materials for her weaving business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Koemsry

texts.en:
Koemsry is 38 years old and has three children, two of whom attend school. She lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She earns an income from rice farming and raising mangoes. The insects have destroyed her rice and mango crops, so she did not get good yield from her farm. 

Koemsry requested her fourth loan from VisionFund, which she will use to purchase organic pesticide to protect her mango farm from being destroyed by insects. She hopes that her farm can earn her more income to upgrade her living conditions and support her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to purchase organic pesticide

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chien is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family includes her husband and her two sons. Her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding of goats. Each harvest crop, after deducting all costs, the remainder of the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and saved a small amount. She intends to raise goats but she does not have enough money to do, therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding with high productivity and in the coming time, when selling the first goat herd, she can get a considerable profit so she can pay the loan back for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise goats to increase the family income

loans.name: Saria

texts.en:
Saria is 28, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is a mother of 2 children. Sarwat has been running her own beauty salon for past 6 years, so she also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brushes and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Saria has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.
For this financial assistance Saria is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty salon business by buying needed supplies

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José es un hombre con 20 años de edad, junto a sus padres se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado, con esto han tenido un gran progreso, con lo ingresos que obtienen, ellos pagan los servicios y compran semanalmente los alimentos a consumir.
Trabajan toda la semana durante 6 horas diarias.
José actualmente se encuentra solicitando un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos, peces y cuido para los mismos.

A pesar de los obstáculos que se le han presentado, este hombre no se rinde, lucha dia a dia por sacar a su familia adelante y  cumplir el sueño de remodelar su vivienda, ya que su estado actual no ese l mejor.

Usted puede ser parte de este sueño, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
José is a 20 year old man. Together with his parents he works raising and selling livestock. They have made great progress doing this and with the income they get they pay the services and buy their food to eat every week. They work 6 hours daily all week.

José currently is requesting a loan which he will invest in the purchase of pigs and fish and feed for them.

Despite the obstacles that have occurred, this man is not giving up. He strives day to day to get his family ahead and fulfill the dream of remodeling his house as it is not in the best of conditions.

You can be part of this dream. Come on, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs, fish and feed for both.

loans.name: Good Work Group

texts.en:
Asia who is in her mid 20s is single with two children, one of them is still small and other is in school. She has been selling clothes and perfumes for five years now. She works from 08am to 06pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Sharifa’s 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the clothes stock including fabrics, sarong and started selling perfumes. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments, paid rent for the clothing shop, started building her house and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up to date style clothes to meet her customers' requirement. She dreams of owning a shop for selling clothes.

Asia will share this loan with her loan group Good Work which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up to date style clothes to meet her customers' requirement.

loans.name: Neelam

texts.en:
Neelam is a 26-year-old married mother of two children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband supports the family and Neelam provides sewing services to earn income to help manage the household.

She needs needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil and other items for her sewing business but lacks the financial means to buy them. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these items, enabling her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Neelam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Nageena

texts.en:
Nageena is a 31-year-old married mother of three children and lives in Multan, Pakistan. Her husband runs a general store selling rice, maize, sugar, cooking oil, etc. He supports his family from this business.

He has won the trust of others and due to his behavior and tone; he has built a very good relationship with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town so his business is running well.

Although his sales have increased, he still lacks sufficient stock to cope with demand. Therefore, Nageena requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more maize, wheat, rice, flour, pulses, and other things for his business.

Nageena thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy maize and other things for her husband's business.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 48 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Bernardita works very hard to provide for them.

Bernardita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, personal product care, home product care, and other groceries.

Bernardita has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, cotton, diaper and other groceries.

In the future, Bernardita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, personal product care, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Herminia is 50 years old and has four children who are in school.

Herminia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Herminia requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell in the market.

Herminia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Herminia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 45 years old and married with one child.  

Arlene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 10500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Arlene has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Arlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 57 years old and married with three children. Felisa works very hard to provide for them.

Felisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Felisa has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Felisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 42 years old and has eight children. Emma is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Emma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 10500 loan through NWTF to purchase vacciens, vitamins and feeds for her pigs.

Emma has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vacciens, vitamins and feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is 52 years old and married. Arlinda works very hard to provide for her family.

Arlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, snack food and personal care products .

Arlinda has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, snack food and personal care products.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is 46 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 5 children. Shameem is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She is needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Shameem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir was born in 1989. He is single and lives with his parents. His father is a teacher and mother is a housewife. They live in the Fuzuli region and they have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli city.

Samir has been in the agriculture goods reselling business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan in amount of 1800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this amount he is planning to buy more wheat, barley, alfalfa for reselling etc. Samir is thankful for help from Kiva and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy  more wheat, barley, alfalfa etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricel is 34 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Maricel has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maricel has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Luzsviminda

texts.en:
Luzsviminda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luzsviminda is 43 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Luzsviminda has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Luzsviminda requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Luzsviminda has been in this business for 6 years. Luzsviminda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a buy and sell cultured pearls in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of cultured pearl to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jamila dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of cultured pearl to sell

loans.name: Leonora Elvira

texts.en:
Leonora Elvira is 46 years old and has two children. Leonora Elvira is married and has two children who are in school.

Leonora Elvira is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonora Elvira requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Leonora Elvira has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonora Elvira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Armelita

texts.en:
Armelita is 46 years old and married with four children, two of them are still in school, Armelita works very hard to provide for them.

Armelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, snacks food and other personal care products .

Armelita has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, snacks food and other personal care products

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna is 41 years old and has two children who are in school. Lorna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy varieties of fish to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and has now requested another loan to further build her business. Lorna has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy varieties of fish to sell

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional used clothes to sell for her buy and sell used clothing business.

Renalyn has been in this business for 10 years. Renalyn earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothes to sell

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 28 years old and has one child. Melodina is a married woman.

Melodina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Melodina requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Melodina has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melodina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 36-year-old woman with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. With her vision of educating her children, Sarah started a retail shop to support her family and works very hard to maintain it. She has bigger hopes of educating her children and having a better future. Sarah is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise items like sugar and sodas for reselling. Sarah is so grateful for the Kiva support that helps her buy general merchandise such as cooking oil and salt to sell, and has managed to reap tangible profits.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar and sodas for reselling

loans.name: Laline

texts.en:
Laline is from Phnomsrok,a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 39 years old. She lives in a wooden house.Her family owns 4 hectars of rice fields and 1 hectar of casava field.

In 2011, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Laline makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe.

She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses and to buy fertilizer for the field. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 62-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. With five children, her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Shamim is also providing sewing services and earns an income to contribute to her husband to manage the household. She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the aforementioned accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is 63 years old, widowed and has six children.

Basilia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Basilia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Basilia has been in this business for 23 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 33 years old. She lives in a wooden one floor house with her sister, her brother and her parents. Her family owns 5 hectares of rice field and 1 hectare of cassava field.

In 2006, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sreymao makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for fertilizer and diesel for the field. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Medeline

texts.en:
Medeline works hard to support her family. Medeline is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Medeline requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Medeline has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Medeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 60 years old. He is married and blessed with five children. 

For the past 20 years, Patrick has been a farmer and he currently earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

Patrick is requesting for a loan of 18,000 KES loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase additional dairy cows. This will be his ninth loan after successfully repaying his previous loans. 

Patrick will use the anticipated profits from his loan to purchase food for his family, pay school fees for his children and also provide medical care for his family. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to enjoy an improved life with his wife and kids.

loans.use: to purchase additional dairy cows

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 59 years old. She is married and has nine children. 

Her business is farming and livestock keeping. She has been in the business for 36 years. 

She earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting, and to pay laborers.

Monicah will use the profits from her expanded business to buy a dairy cow and goats for rearing. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a 51-year-old, hardworking lady who used the previous loan to buy fresh foods like tomatoes, cabbages and onions to sell.

She has a business of selling fresh foods, especially vegetables, and at the same time, has a restaurant that has added more income since 2014.

She buys fresh foods like tomatoes, cabbages and onions to sell, and this makes her realize little profits. However, Angelica is working hard to construct a good house for her family and serve her customers with the highest care in order to retain them and overcome competition.

She has asked for another loan to buy fresh foods like green pepper, cabbages and tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods like green pepper, cabbages and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, an outgoing, 29-year-old young man, was born and raised in Nairobi's Mukuru Kwa Njenga. He is passionate about sanitation issues in his home area and thus actively involved in initiatives leading to its improvement. One such initiative is the ongoing National Youth Service cleanup initiative in Mukuru Kwa Njenga.

He is also a businessman and runs several small-scale enterprises, including water vending and five rental units. Currently, the units do not have toilet facilities. He pays a monthly fee of KES 600 for his tenants to access the neighboring toilets.

While this has been a costly affair, children in particular have often been unable to access these facilities, especially in the night. Peter is now looking to install Fresh Life toilets as a long-term solution to this predicament.

As he says, a present Fresh Life toilet at the premises will guarantee that his tenants have access to toilet facilities at all times, and ultimately, have a fresh experience due to the clean and hygienic nature of the facilities.

Help Peter in acquiring one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en:
Procesa is a resident in the town of Alicia, Bohol. She owns and operates a sari-sari store. She sells assorted merchandise ranging from eggs, powdered milk, tea, sugar, edible oil, assorted canned goods, soft drinks and toiletries.
She is 46 years of age, married with three children. Her youngest child is 18 and still attending school.
Her husband's occupation is a farmer. He grows and sells rice.

She needs additional funds to have adequate stocks and able to maintain the inventory of merchandise daily. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy supplies for the store like sardines, noodles,edible oil, soy sauce and salt. With these, it would attract more buyers to come and able to shop on her store premises.
Thus her earnings will improve and she will be able to maintain and roll-out her capital as well.

Procesa is determined that her sari-sari store will become productive and sustainable in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the store like sardines, noodles,edible oil ,  soy sauce and salt

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is from the village of Molatuhan Bajo, Lopez Jaena. She is 42 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Belinda owns and operates a general store or "sari-sari store," selling daily use products such as canned good, sugar and coffer in their local community. Belinda has been engaged in her business for years and has been earning for these activities. Belinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more useful products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more useful products to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 59 years old and single. Cynthia works hard to provide for herself. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cynthia has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from gasoline retailing.

Cynthia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.
