loans.name: Meluna

texts.en:
Melona is 25 years old and has three children.

Melona is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Melona requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Melona has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Melona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: tobuy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jenelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from bakery. Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned good, snack food and school supplies to sell.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue  to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned good, snack food and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Stephany

texts.en:
Stephany is 30 years old and single with one child. Stephany works very hard to provide for them.

Stephany runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, snacks food and other personal care products.

Stephany has been in this business for 2 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, snacks food and other personal care products

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona, who is 26 young woman, lives in Rustavi city. She has husband, small daughter and mother-in-law. Nona's husband is employed and gets 400 GEL fixed salary. Nona works as a sales lady at the local store and sells various kind of small things and home products. She gets a small fixed income and now has the chance to become the owner of the store.

She needs financial support to purchase stock of products and start leading the business on her own. The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 2000 GEL. Nona will continue working as a sales lady and get the full profit from the sold products. The store already has it's own loyal costumers and the loan will be great support to Nona, as her income will significantly increase and she will make better living condition for her family.
Nona is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to make her own profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of various small things and conduct trading business.

loans.name: Minh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh, born in 1963, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is mainly from her retired salary so it is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. She wants to repair her house but she does not have enough money to buy materials. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family have better living condition with a spacious house.

loans.use: to repair and expand her house.

loans.name: Maribal

texts.en:
Maribal is 32 years old and married with four children. With all four of her children currently in school, Maribal works very hard to provide for them and her family.

To earn a living, Maribal runs a general store in the Philippines. Maribal explains that she has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items, such as candies, snack foods, soft-drinks, and sanitary pads.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, Maribal would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 29 years old and single.

Janice works hard to provide for her daily needs and to help her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Janice has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Janice aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita is a 43-year-old married woman with two children. Both of her children are still in school.

She explains that she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Specifically, Lelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lelita has been in this business for 16 years.

Lelita is now requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
La socia Bacilia se dedica al negocio de venta de pasto, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pasto. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pasto.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bacilia earns a living through selling grass [fodder]. She is wants to get ahead through her business and her dream is to grow her grass [fodder] business. She is requesting a loan to buy grass.

She is happy for the loan and she agrees to complete the payment installments.

loans.use: La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pasto.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina earns a living by weaving amakan (made of bamboo commonly use for walls in most native houses in the Philippines). She weaves and sold amakan for 12 years now.
She has four children. Her eldest child is 22 while the youngest is 5.
She is in need of capital to finance her livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like bamboo. She could able to acquire materials and produce high volume of finished products. Thus, slowly her income will improve. Thus, she could afford to buy nutritious meals for the whole family.

Fermina is determined that she will be expanding her livelihood to continue financing the schooling of her children for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo

loans.name: Rosegelina

texts.en:
Rosegelina is a hardworking entrepreneur. Specifically, she buys and sells dried fish business in the Philippines. Rosegelina explains that she has been in this business for 15 years, but that she earns additional income from making furniture.

She is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Fel

texts.en:
Ma. Fel is a 50-year-old widow with three children. One of her children is still in school.

She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Specifically, Ma. Fel has a food vending business in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 15 years.

Ma. Fel is now requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients, such as flour, sugar, bread, rice and other materials, for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients (such as flour, sugar, bread, rice and other materials) for her food production business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 54-year-old married woman. She and her husband have one child, who is in school.

She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Specifically, Teresa has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for twelve years.

Teresa is now requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more firewood to sell. In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 52 years old and married, with three children, one of whom is in school.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nilda has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Nilda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Waylin

texts.en:
Waylin is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Waylin is 50 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Waylin has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

Waylin has been in this business for 16 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 41 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Elvira is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elvira has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is married with children. He deals in the produce business and also owns a banana plantation. His family never lacks anything due to his hard work and commitment. The last loan that Bernard took helped him to renovate his store, and he is very grateful for the funds that helped him increase his profits. Bernard‘s greatest desire is to expand his produce business. The challenge is he still lacks some money to meet his dream.

He wants to stock more rice, and maize, being in season, so he expects more profits. He requests for money to buy stock of maize and rice for selling.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize and rice for selling.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 63 years old and married with one child. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Estrella has been raising pigs for 12 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 26 years old and single with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from rice retailing.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries and personal care products to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, and snack foods.

Maricel has borrowed and repaid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and personal care products to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, and snack foods.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marites is 40 years old and has two children who are presently in school.

Marites has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fish nets and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her fishing business.

Marites has been in this business for ten years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Charito works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, She also earns additional income from buy and sell fish. Charito is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Charito has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie is 42 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, coffee, and eggs.

Arcelie has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Arcelie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Lesa

texts.en:
Lesa is a 32-year-old married mother of two children, both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lesa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lesa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business .

Lesa has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 43 years old and widowed, with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Alma has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell charcoal.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn is from Phnomsrok, a village in northwest Cambodia. She is 37 years old and lives in a wooden pile house with her husband. Her family owns 1.5 hectares of rice fields.

In 2012, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights rural exodus and empowers women by training them and offering them sustainable work

in the village, Sophorn makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to cover her family's expenses and to buy fertilizer for the field.

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand-woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for dyeing and loom preparation.

loans.name: Nzasa Group

texts.en:
Adelina who is in her late 30's is a married with three children who are still at school. She has been running two projects business of making a soap and making mandazi for three years now. She works from 08am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Kidawa's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase soap stock  and to buy baking flour, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking mandazi. She dreams of expanding her business.

Adelina will  share this loan with her loan  Nzasa which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase soap stock  and to buy baking flour, cooking oil and charcoal  for cooking

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 41 years old and had two children who are studying. He is widower and carries all the responsibility in sustaining needs for his family. He is a fish vendor and offers his merchandise to nearby villages for better income.

He wants to improve his sales so he needs additional capital use in his business. He is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy more fish to sell. He hopes to keep selling a variety of fish to attain good sales and profits for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Abundia runs a small eatery near the school. She sells home meals like stewed vegetables, fried chicken, and pansit (very thin rice noodles fried with soy sauce some citrus, possibly with some variation of sliced meat and chopped vegetables)
She hails from the town of Batuan, Bohol. She is a 53 years old married woman, with three grown children.

She is asking for a loan buy supplies like meat, cooking oil, vegetables, seasonings and cellophane (for storage). She could able to provide more variety of meals and attract consumers to purchase. Slowly, she could start to pay her obligation and be able to expand as well.

She is hoping that by proper handling of these resources, she will be come successful.

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat, cooking oil, vegetables, seasonings and  cellophane (for storage)

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 47 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, junk foods, beverages, and other groceries.

Liza has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, junk foods, beverages, and other groceries

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor works hard to support six children. She is married and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Flor requested a PHP 6750 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Flor is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 47 years old and has three children. Gina is married and has two children are still in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 41 years old and has two children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felicidad is 54 years old now.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell in her business.

Felicidad has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell in her business

loans.name: Maria Nohelia

texts.es:
Noelia es una señora con 65 años de edad, soltera y tiene tres hijos con 35, 40 y 43 años de edad. Trabajadora y muy humilde, desempleada hace varios años, hasta hace poco eran sus hijos quienes le ayudaban económicamente, ahora ellos formaron su hogar y se distanciaron de ella. Noelia busca una solución adecuada para surgir en medio de tanto obstáculo y es por esto que busca apoyo, con el fin de iniciar con su propio negocio, desea montar un restaurante en el Municipio de La Ceja.

El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una estufa, nevera, fritadora, cubiertos, silletería, y principalmente en el montaje de la cocina.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, tener una mejor estabilidad económica y gozar de una buena salud.
 
No cabe duda que el interés demostrado por esta señora es obtener lo deseado, merece considerar su petición.
texts.en:
Noelia, 65, is a single woman with three kids, ages 35, 40 and 43. She is hard-working and humble but has been unemployed for many years and, until recently, her children were helping her out financially. Now, they have their own homes and have distanced themselves from her.

Noelia is looking for a suitable solution to arise in the midst of such an obstacle, which is why she is looking for support. Her goal is to start her own business; she would like to open a restaurant in the town of La Ceja.

This loan is for investing in a stove, refrigerator, deep fryer, cutlery, seating and mainly setting up the kitchen.

Her greatest dream is to improve her living conditions, have better economic stability and have good health.

There isn't the slightest doubt that Noelia is interested in getting these things that she desires, and it is worth considering her request.

loans.use: buy a stove, refrigerator, deep fryer, cutlery, seating and mainly set up a kitchen.

loans.name: Azmat

texts.en:
Azmat is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her 2 children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, where her husband has been running a mobile shop for past 4 years.

Azmat's husband wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Azmat has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she’ll enable her husband to purchase the relevant items for his business purpose so that her husband can earn a more profitable income to manage his business and household.
Azmat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's mobile phone business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, de 72 años de edad, no fue a la escuela porque sus padres solo la pusieron a trabajar junto a sus hermanos, es viuda, tiene seis hijos y todos están casados, en su casa solo vive su nieta.

Francisca, tiene cuarenta años de tener el negocio en el mercado municipal de su domicilio, ella vende frutas y verduras, con las ganancias que le generaba este negocio les dio todo lo necesario a sus hijos, ahora su nieta le ayuda cuando llega de la escuela.

Francisca, necesita el préstamo para surtir su negocio y comprar más verduras y frutas, porque así podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos y tendrá una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Francisca, es ayudarle a su nieta para que estudie.
texts.en:
Francisca, who is 72 years old, did not go to school because her parents just put her to work with her siblings. She is a widow and has six children who are all married. Only her granddaughter lives at home with her.

Francisca has had her business in her local municipal market for forty years. She sells fruits and vegetables. With the earnings that this business generated for her, she gave her children everything they needed. Now, her granddaughter helps her when she gets home from school.

Francisca needs the loan to stock her business and to buy more vegetables and fruits, because that way she will be able to improve her economic income and have a better quality of life.

Francisca's dream is to help her granddaughter to get an education.

loans.use: to stock her business and buy more vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Zohara

texts.en:
Zohra is 34 years old, married and a mother of two children. She lives with her family in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Her husband has owned a recycling shop for 12 years, dealing in scrap iron, aluminium, plastic bottles and waste papers. He has been purchasing scrap goods from a hawker and sells to the recycling factories.

Zohra’s husband wants to invest in his scrap shop to increase his income but due to insufficient financial means is unable to purchase scrap material. Therefore Zohra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Zohra’s husband can purchase more scrap material to earn more income. Zohra and her family are thankful to Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them fund this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to invest in scrap for her husband's recycling business.

loans.name: Jhony

texts.fr: Jhony a 38 ans. Il est marié mais n’a pas encore d’enfants. C’est un jeune peintre très talentueux et déterminé à utiliser son talent pour améliorer sa condition de vie. Il cherche un prêt pour acheter de la peinture.
texts.en: Jhony is 38 years old.  He is married but does not have any children yet.  He is a young and very talented painter who is determined to use his talent to improve his living conditions.  He is looking for a loan so he can buy paint.

loans.use: to buy paint

loans.name: Bernaditha

texts.en:
This entrepreneur hails from the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol. Her name is Bernaditha. She has four children ages 3 to 16 years old respectively.

She earns a living by means of raising and selling pigs. It has been three years now that she has been doing hog raising as her livelihood. She would like to avail herself of the loan in order to purchase feeds and pigs.

These will serve as her fuel to be more productive and also to be able to balance her finances in the long run. She would like to exert more effort in handling her main source of income in a way that will eventually improve the family's living condition and enable her to finance her children's respective studies as well.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita engages in steel fabrication. She accepts orders like window drilling and gates made of steel. She also manages a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities, ranging from beverages, condiments, canned goods, and toiletries. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs.

Teresita is a 62-year-old, married woman with one grown child. She lives in the town of Carmen, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to purchase steel bars, supplies for the store, and pigs and feed. These serve as tools in order to augment her livelihood. The stocks of her store will be filled and she could raise and sell quality hogs, as well. Thus, she would be able to roll-out her capital and start to settle her obligations.

She is hoping that she will be successful in productively managing her sources of income.

loans.use: to purchase steel bars, supplies for the store, and pigs and feed.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 24 years old and has two children. Lorena is married and has one child in school.

Lorena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorena has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estrelita is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Estrelita has a buy and sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. Estrelita requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Estrelita has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Estrelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 55 years old and married with two children, who are both still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries and personal care products to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, snack foods, etc.

Lourdes has been in this business for 10 years. In the future she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and personal care products to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Sokkhorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally of the Battambang province, Sokkhorn, 30 years old is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school and other one is too young. She grows cassava as her main source of income for 5 years and works as a labor worker to supplement her income. The main challenge for her cassava farm is lack of working capital.

She leads a group of three to seek a new loan with VisionFund and this is her first micro loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy organic pesticide for her farm and pay for plowing fees to improve her farm to get more yields. She hopes that her cassava farm can produce her more yields and more income, so she can upgrade her living condition better than before and she can pay for her children’s education on time.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide to protect her crop from being destroyed by insects so that it will grow well and enable her to sell it at a higher price.

loans.name: 2 De Abril Group

texts.es:
Martha continúa con su negocio de venta de comida tradicional. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de muebles de comedor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual, actualmente toda la banca continúa trabajando, en esta ocacisión la presidenta es:
Dora es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de teléfonos celulares.
Ella es alegre, feliz y muy optimista. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ situado a las afueras de la ciudad.
Dora es morena de baja estatura y físico mediano (la primera de la izquierda, viste vestido color lila), su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en un cuarto alquilado, construido de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de teléfonos celulares, actividad que realiza ambulando y visitando a diferentes clientes en oficinas y lugares comerciales, “vendo a crédito y al contado, renuevo la mercadería constantemente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son a crédito y vende continuamente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de nuevos teléfonos. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta en el mercado para dejar de ambular, ella desea comprar teléfonos celulares por mayor para abaratar costos y estabilizar su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Dora solicita un préstamo para la compra de diferentes tipos de teléfonos celulares para ofertar a mejor precio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha continues with her business selling traditional foods. She invested the loan that she obtained in the purchase of dining room furnishings. Her loan payments were punctual, and currently the whole communal bank is working. At this time, the president is Dora.

Dora is a 20-year-old young woman. She lives with her partner and has no children. Her business is the sale of cellular telephones. She is cheerful, happy, and very optimistic. She operates her business in the "Plan 3000" neighborhood, located in the outskirts of the city.

Dora is a brunette of short stature and medium build (the first on the left, wearing a lilac dress). Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner, who works in the same business. They live in a rented room built of brick that has all the basic services.

She carries out her cellular telephone sales business as a street vendor and by visiting different customers in offices and commercial buildings. "I sell on cash and credit. I constantly add new merchandise," she says. The advantage of her business is that her sales are on credit and she sells continuously; the disadvantage is the lack of capital for the purchase of new telephones.

Her dream is to have a stall in the market so she can stop street vending. She would like to buy cellular telephones at wholesale in order to lower her costs and stabilize her business. This is her first lending cycle with the institution in the three years that she has been working in this activity.

This is the reason that Dora is requesting a loan: to buy different types of cellular telephones in order to sell at a better price and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase different types of cellular telephones to offer at better prices and improve her quality of life

loans.name: Moisesa

texts.en:
Moisesa is a 46-year-old married woman with nine children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Moisesa has a vegetable "buy and sell" business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Moisesa has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en: Kosal, 22, was an outstanding student when he was in high school. Currently, he is studying at university to pursue a bachelor degree, majoring in medicine. Kosal's family are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue, which makes it hard to pay for his tuition fees. To pay for his tuition fees, he is applying for a loan of USD 2,400. When he finishes his bachelor degree, he wants to run his own pharmacy. He also wants to build a new house for his family and if he gets children he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor or master degrees if he can support it.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana helps her husband by working on their own farm to make a living. She has been doing this for ten years and she earns well in selling fruits that came from her farm. She also has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used for farm inputs.

Currently, she is taking a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer for the next crop. She wants to expand her farming business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for her next crop

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 45 years old and has nine children. Marivic is married and has two children are still in school.

Marivic is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marivic has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Emiliana dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Peggy Elvira

texts.es: Peggy es una microempresaria de 44 años dedicada a la comercialización de ropa, calzado, accesorios, artículos para el hogar y demás productos que solicita su clientela conformada por vecinos y conocidos. Ella estuvo por fuera del país por más de 10 años, tiempo en el cual se dedicó al comercio, experiencia que le sirvió para organizar su negocio en Barranquilla y está convencida de  que trabajar en este tipo de actividades permite tener un flujo económico que no está sujeto a horarios ni a la supervisión de un jefe sino a la gestión y esfuerzo individual. Además, según su experiencia, los niveles de estrés suelen ser  más bajos que en empleos tradicionales y, por tanto, hay posibilidad de dedicar más tiempo para sí mismo y la familia. Actualmente Peggy se está preparando para la temporada de fin de año, donde la demanda de productos es mayor, por lo que está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual invertirá en ropa, calzado, accesorios y regalos de amor y amistad que es la celebración mas cercana. Su sueño de prosperidad es poder abrir su propio almacén y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Peggy is 44 years old and works selling clothing, footwear, accessories, household items, and other products sought after by the neighbours and acquaintances that make up her customers.

Peggy lived abroad for ten years, during which time she worked in business. This experience has helped her to manage her business in Barranquilla and this type of work provides an income without being tied to a set timetable, or under the supervision of a manager. Instead, Peggy is her own boss and works hard. Peggy also finds in this work that stress levels are much lower than in regular jobs so she can spend more time doing what she wants and with her family.

Peggy is currently preparing for end-of-year festivities, when demand for goods is higher. Peggy is therefore applying for her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy clothes, footwear, accessories, and gifts for the "love and friendship" celebrations that are closest in the calendar.

Peggy's dream is to prosper and to open a larger store. She also wants to provide her family and children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, accessories, and gifts for upcoming "love and friendship" celebrations.

loans.name: Jenet

texts.en:
Jenet is 28 years old, married with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jenet has an egg retailing business in the Philippines. Jenet requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of eggs to offer for sale.

Jenet has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jenet would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of eggs to offer for sale.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es un hombre con soltero con 31 años de edad, trabaja desde su casa en un negocio que inicio hace poco, con unos computadores que tenía monto una sala de internet y también vende snack y bebidas. Cuenta con un empleado y laboran todo los días durante 9 horas.

Esto le ha resultado un poco duro, las ventas no son suficientes y de tal manera sus ganancias tampoco, él se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de los computadores y también comprara bebidas y snack.

Sus ganas de salir adelante son admirables, a pesar de las circunstancias por las que le ha tocado vivir, Alejandro no se rinde, su meta es continuar trabajando para cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Para esto cuenta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal kiva.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a single, 31-year-old man. He works from his house in a business that he recently started, with some computers that he put together in an internet cafe and he also sells snacks and drinks. He is supported by an employee and they work every day for 9 hours.

This has been a bit tough, the sales aren't enough and neither are his earnings, he finds himself asking for a loan which he will invest in the maintenance of the computers and also to buy drinks and snacks.

His desire to get ahead is admirable. Despite the circumstances in which he lives, Alejandro is not defeated. His goal is to continue working to achieve his dream of improving the conditions of his home.

For this he counts on the help of Interactuar and the Kiva collaborators.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining the computers and to buy drinks and snacks.

loans.name: M. Atif

texts.en:
M. Atif is the age of 29, living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a very hard-working and gentle person. He is responsible for his old parents and a sibling, as well.

M. Atif is a milkman by profession and he sells milk in his community. He has been selling milk since his childhood. Now, he is very expert and experienced in his profession.

He is very expert at producing milk from a buffalo. He produces milk from his all buffaloes in no time. He has many buffaloes; this is the reason he has to do very hard work to feed them. Every day he takes his herd to the pasture for grazing, gives them a bath in the stream, and he has to stay with them the whole day, due to a fear of theft.

M. Atif does not have much time for his family members. He wants to get an assistant to look after his cattle, but he does not earn enough profit to afford the salary.

M. Atif is receiving his second loan and he has been investing his previous loan in the same business. With the help of the last loan, he has purchased a buffalo and has benefited from that buffalo. He still wants to establish his business and wants to buy a buffalo, so that he can increase his monthly income, get an assistant, and spend some time with his family.

Therefore, M. Atif has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. He hopes that he would be able to buy a buffalo and he will be successful in increasing his monthly income, as well.

M. Atif thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for his dairy farm, so he can increase his monthly income.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 51 years old. She lives in a wooden house with with her husband (who is also a weaver) and her son, who is still studying. Her 3 other children are already working and/or married. Her family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava fields.

In 2001 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Kong makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the field and to extend her lending business. Thanks to the loan,she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en:
Zaitun is a thirty nine year old woman, married with four children, living in Masindi-Uganda. She operates a restaurant but also has a produce store that sells dry foodstuffs.

Zaitun is very hard working and has hopes of educating her children. With the high demand for foodstuffs, Zaitun requests for a loan to buy items like rice and bananas to cook for selling in her restaurant, so that she can serve her customers well.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like rice and bananas to cook, for selling in her restaurant.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo es un señor con 46 años de edad, tiene un hijo con 9 años de edad, es muy trabajador, humilde y lleno de vida. Su situación económica actual es un poco complicada, debido a que se separó de su esposa, quien le ayudaba económicamente en los gastos del hogar.
Su deseo es tener su propio negocio, es por esto que solicita un préstamo, para la compra de un carro que un familiar le ofrece a mitad de precio, con este prestaría el servicio de transporte de personas en Municipio de La ceja.
Su  mayor anhelo es poder pagar la educación de su hijo, pues su bienestar le preocupa.

Su actitud positiva y los deseos de salir adelante permiten ver en este hombre unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a 46-year-old man who has one 9-year-old son. He is very hardworking, humble, and full of life. His current financial situation is a little complicated, because he separated from his wife who was helping him financially with the household expenses.

His desire is to have his own business. That is why he is requesting a loan for the purchase of a car that a relative is offering him at half price. With it, he will provide transportation services to people in the municipality of La Ceja.

His greatest wish is to be able to pay for his son's education, as he is concerned about his wellbeing.

His positive attitude and his desire to get ahead reveal this man's huge will to better himself, and, of course, to receive a favorable response to his request.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 26 years old and married with three children.

Jessica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, bread, home care products and other groceries.

Jessica has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jessica aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, bread, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: M. Ashfaq

texts.en:
M. Ashfaq is a 40-year-old man, living with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Mostly people like to chew betel leaf, so a few years ago he decided to open a paan shop to offer different kinds of betel leaf to the people. He offers kinds of betel leaf such as sweet paan, which consists of a mixture of chopped or coarsely ground areca nuts, betel nuts, mint, coconut, fruit preserves, gulkand (rose petal preserves), and various spices, and tobacco paan, which consists of powdered tobacco.

He is an expert in preparing paan because he has been running this shop for many years, and lots of customers like to take betel leaf that is prepared by him. To cope with the increasing demand, he wants keep more stock of ingredients so that he can maximize his income.

Therefore, M. Ashfaq has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy a mixture of chopped or coarsely ground areca nuts, betel nuts, mint, coconut, fruit preserves, gulkand (rose petal preserves), and various spices, and tobacco paan.

M. Ashfaq thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a mixture of chopped ground areca nuts, betel nuts, mint, coconut, fruit preserves, various spices, tobacco paan, and cold drinks for his paan shop.

loans.name: Anayat's Group

texts.en:
Anayat, aged 36, is a responsible mother of three children and lives happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals in scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been making transactions with the common people for scrap goods that he then sells to recycling factories.

Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have working capital to buy scrap goods and thus does not have scrap to sell, to earn their living. Therefore, Anayat requested a loan for her husband, so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.

Anayat is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after repaying this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods such as iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. for her husband's scrap business.

loans.name: María Angélica

texts.es: Maria tiene 19 años pero inicio en el ámbito de los negocios hace 4 años cuando convirtió su amor por el arte en su profesión y fuente de ingresos. Tiene su taller organizado en su hogar donde elabora cuadros al óleo realizados a mano para darles singularidad, que además se constituye en un valor agregado y que posteriormente enmarca en madera y comercializa a través de almacenes que constituyen su canal de distribución. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que planea invertir en la compra de materiales como madera, óleos, telas, lacas, vinilo entre otros. con el fin de aumentar su producción y sus ventas. Maria sueña con expandir su negocio con la apertura de nuevos puntos de ventas para lo cual siempre está innovando y ofreciendo nuevas variedades en su producción.
texts.en:
Maria is 19 years old but she started in business 4 years ago when she converted her love for art into her profession and source of income. She has her studio organized in her home where she makes oil paintings by hand to make them unique. That also makes for an added value that she later frames it in wood and sells it through warehouses that are her distribution channel.

Currently she is processing her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, resources which she plans to invest in the purchase of materials such as wood, oils, cloths, lacquers, and vinyl among other. With the goal of increasing her production and her sales.

Maria dreams of expanding her business with the opening of new sale location for which she is always innovating and offering new varieties in her production.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, oils, cloth, lacquers, and vinyl.

loans.name: Máximo Daniel

texts.es: Máximo tiene 23 años y forma parte de Fútbol con Corazón, una empresa social que forma deportistas y líderes  y  que busca que los jóvenes ocupen su tiempo libre en cosas positivas y se mantengan apartados de malas conductas como el alcohol, las drogas, reclutamiento de pandillas, prostitución, entre otros. Máximo al igual que otros líderes tiene a su cargo un grupo de  niños, por los cuales recibe una asignación mensual como remuneración por su entrenamiento. Su rol como entrenador exige que para el entrenamiento deportivo debe suministrar los implementos deportivos como balones, guayos, uniformes entre otros, inversión que proyecta financiar con los recursos de su primer credikiva que tramita a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Su visión para el futuro es terminar su carrera universitaria y abrir otras canchas de entrenamiento donde pueda atender varios grupos de niños que le generen un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Máximo is 23 years old and is part of "Fútbol con Corazón" [Soccer/Football with Heart], a social enterprise that develops athletes and leaders and strives for young people to occupy their free time with positive things and to stay away from bad influences like alcohol, drugs, gang recruitment, prostitution, and others.

Máximo, like other leaders, is responsible for a group of children for whom he receives a monthly stipend as remuneration for their training. His role as trainer demands that he provide the sports equipment for the athletic training like balls, cleats, uniforms, and more; he intends to finance that investment with the resources from his first Kiva loan, which he is applying for through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

His vision for the future is to finish his university degree and to open other training fields where he can work with various groups of kids, which will generate a better income for him.

loans.use: to buy sports equipment like balls, cleats, uniforms, and more

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 41 years old.

In 2000, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sophea makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the daily expenses. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Ruhshonai

texts.ru: Рухшонаи молодая  жительница района Восеъ. Ей 19 лет. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. Рухшонаи живет с отцом, матерью, братьям и сестренкой.  Отец работает учителем. Мама рукодельница. Старший брат занимается торговлей деятельности. Младший брат учится в университете. Сестренка помогает маме на работе. Сама Рухшонаи четыре года назад решила начать новый бизнес, чтобы помочь родителям обеспечить семью. Она начала изучать профессию швеи, чтобы зарабатывать таким путем для улучшения условий жизни семьи. Рухшонаи быстро освоила  эту деятельность. Ей сейчас в работе помогает мама. Рухшонаи берет кредит, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку. Рухшонаи верит в Вас и ожидает поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en: Ruhshonai is a young woman from the Vose District. She is 19 years old. She is not married and does not have any children. Ruhshonai lives with her father, mother, brothers and little sister. Her father works as a teacher. Her mother is a seamstress. Her older brother is in the retail business; her younger brother studies at university. Her younger sister helps their mother with her work. Four years ago, Ruhshonai started a new business in order to help her parents provide for her family. She began learning how to be a seamstress in order to earn money to improve her family's living conditions. Ruhshonai quickly mastered this craft. She now helps her mother with her work. Ruhshonai is taking out a loan to buy a new sewing machine. Ruhshonai believes in you and awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Glecy

texts.en:
Glecy is 48 years old and married with seven children. Five of her children are presently in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Glecy has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Jonan

texts.en:
Jonan is a single parent with one child. He gets a salary at the end of the month from the local government, and that is his only source of income. He has a future plan of starting up a book shop, a business that will cater for his child's school fees in future.

He has land, and he wants so much to develop it, but he is limited by inadequate capital. He now requests money to pay for labor to cultivate his land ahead of the planting season. He will be grateful for your help and willingly will pay back the loan without any disturbance.

loans.use: to pay for labor to cultivate his land ahead of the planting season.

loans.name: Orladis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Orladis es una señora con 56 años de edad, su situación económica empezó a desmejorar luego de que su pareja se quedara sin empleo, pues es él el sostén del hogar.
Juntos buscaron una solución adecuada para surgir en medio de tanto obstáculo, empezaron a trabajar en la cría y venta de ganado porcino, esto le s ha generado buenos ingresos, el cual es invertido en la compra de alimentos y el pago de los servicios.

Con el fin de aumentar su ganado, mejorar ventas e incrementar sus ganancias, Orladis se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar cerdos, hará más establos y principalmente comprara alimento y medicamentos para sus animales.

Quiere seguir luchando hasta cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, tener una mejor estabilidad económica y gozar de una buena salud.

Con su aporte esta mujer podrá cumplir sus sueños, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Orladis is a 56-year-old woman. Her financial situation started to worsen after her partner lost his job, as he supported the household.

Together, they looked for the right solution to rise above this great obstacle. They started to work raising and selling pigs, and this has generated good income for them, which is invested in the purchase of feed and payment of utilities.

With the objective of increasing their herd, improving sales, and increasing earnings, Orladis is currently requesting a loan to be able to buy pigs, make more pens, and mainly to buy feed and medicines for their animals.

She wants to continue striving toward reaching her dream of improving their living conditions, having better financial stability, and enjoying good health.

With your contribution, this woman will be able to achieve her dreams. Come on, make a loan!

loans.use: to buy pigs, to make more pens, and mainly to buy feed and medicine for her animals.

loans.name: Jesus Leonor

texts.es:
Jesús, de 41 años de edad, no fue a la escuela porque desde pequeño su padre lo puso a trabajar la tierra y con el ganado; está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad y viven en casa propia.

Jesús, tiene catorce años de dedicarse a la elaboración de hamacas y matatas y también trabaja la tierra sembrando maíz, sus hijos le apoyan porque ya salieron de estudiar.

Jesús, necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar las hamacas y las matatas y para comprar abono, porque ya es la época para sembrar, de esa manera lograra mejorar su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Jesús, es seguir trabajando y darles lo necesario a su familia para que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Jesús, 41, did not go to school because as a child his father put him to work on the land and with the livestock. He is married and his spouse is a homemaker; they live in their own home and have two adult children.

Jesús has spent fourteen years making hammocks and matatas [bags made from agave fiber] and he also works the land planting corn. His children help him because they have already finished school.

Jesús needs the loan to buy materials to make hammocks and matatas [bags made from agave fiber] and to buy fertilizer, because it is already time to sow. In that way he will succeed in improving his quality of life. Jesús’ dream is to keep working and give what is necessary to his famly so that they lack for nothing.

loans.use: buy materials to make hammocks and matatas [bags made from agave fiber] and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: José Melecio

texts.es:
José, de 57 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen cinco hijos, pero todos son mayores de edad y tienen sus propias familias.

José, desde pequeño quedo sin padre, se creció solo con su madre que es quien le ha apoyado y como es de los primeros hijos, a el le asignaron la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a sus demás hermanos y trabajaba, ahora se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas y también a cultivar maíz y tiene un hijo que le apoya.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar materiales para la jarcia y para comprar insumos agrícolas de esa manera logrará mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 57 years old, didn't go to school, is in a relationship and his partner makes a living in domestic work. He has five sons but they are all older and have their own families. Jose has been without a father since he was small, and he grew up only with his mother who he has supported and since he is one of the older sons, he has been assigned the responsibility of supporting his other brothers and working.

Now he makes a living making hammocks and also growing corn and he has a son who helps him. The loan will be used to buy materials for the hammock rigging and to buy agricultural supplies in that way to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for hammock rigging and to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Tulsi

texts.en:
Tulsi, a 33-year-old woman, hails from Falakata in West Bengal. Her family comprises her husband and four children (two daughters and two sons). All of them are students. Tulsi, having an education up to grade 9, always tries to give her children all sorts of educational support, but due to the low income of her husband, she is unable to do so.

Tulsi's husband is managing a small grocery shop. He sells different grocery items like biscuits, spices, soap, shampoo, flour, etc. to the local villagers. Her husband is diligent and honest, and for his polite behavior, his customers like him. But, his main obstacle is capital, because of which he can't expand his business and meet his customers' demand. At present, his monthly income is not sufficient enough to maintain their family.

He believes if he expands his grocery stock he will earn more. Now he aims to improve the grocery shop due to the increasing demand of his customers. To achieve this, he needs capital. So, Tulsi applied for a loan to help her husband from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy more grocery items to meet the demand of the customers, and at the same time, improve her financial stability for providing a decent life to her family.

Tulsi thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her husband's grocery shop.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is a 44-year-old woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is married and has eight children. She has four adult children and four school-aged children ages 19, 17, 12 and five years old.

To earn a living, Rhodora and her husband run a fishing business. Aside from fishing, she has been running a sari-sari store business. She has been doing this for two years to help her husband provide for the needs of their family.

She is asking for a loan to pay for boat maintenance and to buy grocery items such as toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, spices, cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, chips, biscuits, candies and bread.

In the future, she wishes to improve their livelihood for her children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for boat maintenance and to buy toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, spices, cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, chips, biscuits, candies and bread

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 67 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Marina has been in this business for forty years. In the future, Marina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 46 years old and married with nine children. With six children in school, Emelie works very hard to provide for them.

Emelie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Emelie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Emelie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a flat machine

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is 42 years old. She is a hard working lady charged with the responsibility of taking care of five children, all of whom attend school in Hoima, Uganda. She operates a restaurant and also sells produce and electronics (primarily phones, cables, flash disks, etc.). In order to supplement her income she also operates a mobile money business, whereby money is transferred using the phone.

She dreams of educating her children. She is requesting another loan to pay school fees for her children. She used her previous loan for this purpose and paid it back in a timely manner.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.name: Alcides Manuel

texts.es:
Alcides es un señor con 60 años de edad, trabajador y muy humilde, se desempeña vendiendo queso en el Municipio de Sincelejo, esta actividad la inicio desde hace poco por necesidad económica, con esto ha logrado salir adelante con su familia conformada por dos hijos con 18 y 20 años de edad y su actual pareja.
Trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas.
Su dificultad es que no cuenta con la mayoría de herramientas para transportar el queso, como lo son las canecas, tablas y otros, es por esto que solicita un préstamo, para la compra de estos.
Su mayor anhelo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, formalizar su negocio y en un futuro dejárselo a sus hijos.
Su actitud positiva y los deseos de progresar permiten ver en este hombre unas ganas inmensas de progresar y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Alcides is a hardworking and humble 60-year-old man. He works selling cheese in the municipality of Sincelejo. He started this activity recently out of financial necessity, and it has allowed him to provide for his family, which consists of two children who are 18 and 20 years old, and his current wife. He works every day for ten hours.

His challenge is that he does not have the majority of the equipment for transporting the cheese, like tubs, trays, and more. That is why he is requesting a loan to purchase them.

His greatest desire is to improve the conditions of his household, to establish his business, and in the future, to leave it to his children.

His positive attitude and his desire for progress reveal this man's tremendous will to get ahead and of course his desire for a positive response to his request.

loans.use: to buy equipment for transporting cheese, like tubs, trays, and more.

loans.name: Samrong

texts.en:
Samrong is a 35-year-old married factory worker with four young children in her care. She has worked in the factory since 2014. Three of her children attend school. Her husband is a 32-year-old construction worker. All of them live in Takeo Province of Cambodia.

Both Samrong and her husband can earn around USD 12 each day. She lacks the finances to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work on time. Therefore, she is requesting a loan. With this loan, she will be able to get more income from extra work, which will improve her family’s standard of living. For her future plans, Samrong is going to build a new house and support her children to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work and family use

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 30-year-old single man from Deir Al-Balah, which is both a city and a Refugee Camp in the besieged Gaza Strip, where unemployment is very high. He has been transporting goods using his Rickshaw for the past one year. Iyad buys the products wholesale and resells them for a small profit margin. Iyad has taken out a USD loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy new rickshaw.

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 40-year-old married mother of three children. Almost two years ago, she started selling shoes to help her husband in satisfying their children's needs. She is well-known among her region and has her own customers. She is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business; thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of shoes to satisfy her customers' needs.

Taghreed hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of shoes.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 44 years old and has five children to provide for. Her husband had already passed away, so in order to live and support the needs of her children, she decided to prepare and sell grilled foods in their local community.

She was determined to do well in her business. For many years in selling food, she maintained the tastes and sustained her business, for she had no other way of earning income for her family.

To improve the business, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy raw ingredients to prepare her grilled food to sell. She hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her grilled food to sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is aged 50 and from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Renato, her business partner and they have three children. One of her children is in college and the other two are already working. The couple have each other, make a living, and are happy that two of their children are now working. Chona continues to persevere so that her youngest child could finish her college education.

Chona has been operating her store, as shown in her photo, for seven years already. Aside from her store she also runs a tours and travel business. She puts her best efforts into efficiently managing her businesses for this is their source of income to get by everyday and to send her child to school.

To help her expand her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan which she will use to pay for large quantities of beverages such as energy drinks, fruit juice, soft drinks, mineral water and canned goods as well. She will use part of the loan to finance her tours and travel business. She hopes you could consider her request. Her earnings will greatly help cover the college tuition fees of her child.

Chona dreams of having a bigger grocery store and opening additional branches of her tours and travel business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for  beverages and canned goods to sell and to finance her tours and travel business.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 44 years old and has six children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Virgilia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Virgilia has been in this business for nine years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Virgilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Norma Liliana

texts.es:
Norma es una señora con 33 años de edad, tiene dos hijos con 8 y 15 años de edad, es por ellos que lucha día a da, para brindarles una buena estabilidad económica y ofrecerles un mejor futuro. Trabaja en un pequeño negocio que monto hace poco, un Café Bar, esto le genera los ingresos suficiente para solventar las necesidades de su hogar.
Trabaja toda la semana durante 6 horas diarias.

Con el fin de mejorar sus ventas, aumentar clientela y de tal manera incrementar sus ganancias, Norma solicita un préstamo para poder surtir su negocio de bebidas y snack y otros.

Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda pero principalmente pagar la educación de sus hijos, pues su bienestar le preocupa.
Sabe que de la mano de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva todos sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Norma is a 33 years old.  She has two children 8 and 15 years old, for whom she strives to provide, day after day, economic stability and offer them a better future. 

She works in a small business that she put up recently, a coffee bar.  This business generates enough income to meet the needs of her home.
She works all week for 6 hours a day.

In order to improve sales, increase the number of customers and to increase her profits, Norma is requesting a loan to stock her business up with drinks,  snacks and others.

She dreams of improving their housing conditions, but mainly pay for the education of her children, since their well-being worries her.

She knows that with the support of Interactuar and Kiva collaborators Kiva, her dreams may come true.

loans.use: to stock her business with drinks and snacks and others.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalia gracias a su esmero y dedicación a su familia ha sacado adelante, ella desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a la crianza y venta de pollos, por estos grandes esfuerzos la familia ha prosperado y con la construcción de su dormitorio ahora ya cuentan con más espacio donde poder convivir y compartir con su familia, por lo que ella está muy agradecida con los inversionistas de kiva pues cuenta que con su apoyo la vida de mucha gente ha cambiado, con este cambio Rosalia está contenta más no conforme porque nuevamente tiene la necesidad de adquirir un préstamo para la compra de una cuerda de terreno para cultivo de maíz y frijol, con esta inversión Rosalia espera poder ampliar su cultivo. Rosalia tiene las esperanzas de comprar más terrenos y también ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosalia, thanks to her care and dedication, has brought up her family. For several years she has worked raising and selling chickens. Through these great efforts the family has prospered and with the construction of her bedroom she now has more space in which to live and share with her family.

For this Rosalia is very grateful to Kiva investors, for having their support. The lives of many people have changed. With this change Rosalia is happy but not satisfied, because she again has the need to get a loan, to purchase a cuerda [28 square meters or 301 square feet] of land for growing corn and beans. With this investment Rosalia hopes to expand her cultivation. Rosalia has hopes to buy more land and expand her business.

loans.use: purchase land for growing corn and beans.

loans.name: Tang Or's Group

texts.en:
Tang Or is a local resident of Kampong Cham province, who grows cassava and rubber plants as the main source of income to support her family's living and her children. She is 35 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She can save a daily income of about 9 USD per day which she has been with these businesses for 20 years. Her cassava did not produce a good yield because it was destroyed by insects, and this is her main challenge.

She leads a group of two to seek a new loan and this is her second Kiva loan with VisionFund. Now, her family’s living has improved with decent household supplies via her past loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to input on her rice farm to get more yield and she will use a part of her loan to purchase organic pesticide for her rubber farming to do well. She hopes that she can get more income to support her living conditions and support her children’s studying as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to input on her rice farm to increase her crop yield so as to earn more income to save for future needs.

loans.name: Nitali

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Nitali is an enterprising woman. With an aim to contribute to her family income, she started an animal husbandry a few years ago. She lives in Falakata, West Bengal with her husband and two sons.

The strong determination of Nitali led her to overcome the social barriers, and she managed to convince her family to run an animal husbandry to provide proper education to her son. Her younger son is studying in grade 12, and her elder son studied up to grade 10 and is now involved with carpentry work. Nitai’s husband is engaged with a furniture business.

Nitali has been running a milk-selling business for the last five years. She rears cows and sells milk to her neighbors. Sometimes she also sells the cow dung for additional income. Now she is very much confident in running her business and wants to develop her business.
