Thus, she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase a cow for more milk to sell for her business. She hopes this loan will give a boost to her business as well as her income.

She conveys her thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Aabida

texts.en:
Aabida is 42 and the mother of one child, living with her spouse and child in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband owns a video game shop. He has been running a video game shop for 10 years to meet the family’s expenses.

Nowadays Aabida’s husband wants to buy more video games for a proper income but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase video games to earn an income. Therefore Aabida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Aabida’s husband can purchase more video games to earn an income.

Aabida and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy video games for her husband's shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Jhonel

texts.en: Jhonel is a young man of 20 years.  He lives in Bien Unido, Bohol with his family and baby girl who is one year old. He is engaged in transporting passengers using his motorcycle. He is asking for a loan to buy motor oil, and rice to feed his family. In the future, he hopes to have another business so he can better support his daughter when she starts going to school.

loans.use: to  buy motor oil, and rice to feed his family.

loans.name: Carmnencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an electronic repair shop business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her electronic repair shop.

Carmencita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Carmencita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her electronic repair shop.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a widowed woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lolita is 53 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Lolita has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional vegetables like squash, beans, carrots, tomatoes, spices, cabbage, eggs, etc. to sell at her local market.

Lolita has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables like squash, beans, carrots, tomatoes, spices, cabbage, eggs, etc. to sell at her local market.

loans.name: Shefali

texts.en:
Shefali is a 41-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and three children (two daughters and one son) in Falakata. All her children are students of different grades. Shefali could not complete her education after grade 8 because of her family's financial issue. Her husband also studied, until grade 9.

By profession, her husband is a farmer who grows different vegetables like cabbage, potatoes, eggplant, bottle gourd, etc. Being a housewife, she manages all household chores and also assists her husband in the agricultural work. They have their own land, and experience in the agricultural field is the reason for choosing this business.

Now the couple wishes to cultivate broad beans on their own land to generate more income. So, Shefali applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow broad beans.

Shefali is confident that she will be able to improve the family economy as well as grow her business. In the future, she wants to acquire more agricultural land with the profit she will earn from her business. She is a lady with great enthusiasm, and she started dreaming of giving good education to her children.

Shefali is very much grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farm inputs for broad beans cultivation.

loans.name: Delida Yosabeth

texts.es:
Delida, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja como profesor y tienen un hijo de tres años de edad.

Delida, es empleada en un hospital nacional, tiene varios años de trabajar ahí y su propósito es aportar ingresos en el hogar y su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar medicinas para su hijo y para pagar los tramites de visa para ella, su hijo y esposo, de esa forma lograra su objetivo y tendrá una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Delida, es que su hijo mejore y que crezca sano y con una buena salud.
texts.en: Delida is 30 years old. She studied up to high school. She has a domestic partner who works as a teacher, and they have a three year old son. Delida is employed at a public hospital. She has many years working there and her goal is to help bring income to the household. Her work schedule is from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. She will use the loan to buy medicines for her son, and to pay for visa application expenses for her, her son and husband. This way, she will reach her goal and will have a better quality of life. Delida's dream is for her son to get better and grow with good health.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her son, and to pay for visa application expenses for her, her son and husband.

loans.name: Sudebi

texts.en:
Sudebi, a 45-year-old rural woman, is married and a mother of two sons. She is from the village of Singijani in Falakata, West Bengal. She is a housewife and manages her household work and takes care of her family members. One of the sons is a worker in a small company, and one is unemployed.

Sudebi’s husband is involved with cultivation, and sometimes she also helps her husband in his work. They mainly cultivate paddies on their farmland. With ten years of experience in farm work, her husband has been running his business successfully.

Now the family expenses are increasing day by day, so they need to expand their business. Moreover, being the staple food of the regional people, paddy is in much demand throughout the year. So, Sudebi is requesting a loan of INR 15,000 from Kiva via BJS to invest in the business. They will use the loan amount to buy good-quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, and other necessary farm supplies for paddy cultivation. This loan will help a hardworking farmer to fulfill his dreams to boost up his business.

Sudebi and her husband convey their thanks to lenders for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm resources for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Erlange

texts.fr: Erlange a 31 ans. Elle vit en union libre et est mère de trois enfants.  Elle tient une petite épicerie chez elle depuis 5 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du centre-ville de Port-au-Prince. Son mari l’aide dans les achats. Pour éviter des ruptures de stock, elle a recours au microcrédit.
texts.en: Erlange is 31 years old.  She is in a free union and is the mother of three children.  She has had a small grocery shop at her house for five years and she buys the stock from the market in the centre of town in Port-au-Prince.  Her husband helps her with the purchases.  In order to avoid a stock shortage, she has requested a loan.

loans.use: to buy boxes of milk powder

loans.name: Sohagi

texts.en:
Sohagi is a 32-year-old woman who has one son and two daughters. She lives in the village of Bara Shoulmari in Falakata. Her children are students in local schools. Sohagi desires to see her children get a proper education, which motivates her to strive hard.

Her husband is engaged in farming. Due to poor economic conditions, Sohagi and her husband are not able to cover their family's expenses. So she set up her own business of animal husbandry to serve her family better and for the future betterment of her children. Sohagi rears cows and supplies milk to her neighbors and the local market too. There has been increased demand for milk in the market, which pushes Sohagi to expand her milk-selling business. So she decided to take out a loan from Kiva lenders via BJS to purchase a dairy cow to expand her business.

An extra cow will provide her with a lot of profit. She will be able to produce more milk and increase her sales volume. The increased income makes Sohagi more confident about the future of her family and her children.

Sohagi gives heartiest thanks to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Balentina Albina

texts.es: Balentina es una mujer trabajadora de 56 años de edad, vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Lari, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Ella se dedica a la cría de ganado ovino orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en su alimentación, que está constituida sobre todo por alfalfa orgánica que ella misma cultiva, Balentina además se dedica al cultivo de papa orgánica, así pues, solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar semilla orgánica de papa y abonos orgánicos para poder preparar el terreno donde planea cultivar papa orgánica. En el futuro Balentina desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Balentina is a hard working 56 year old woman. She lives with her partner in the rural town of Lari which is located in Arequipa. She makes a living in the raising of organic sheep putting a lot of attention into their care and diet which is made up mostly of organic alfalfa that she cultivates herself. Balentina also makes a living in the cultivation of organic potatoes. Therefore, she is requesting the micro loan to be able to buy organic potato seeds and organic manure in order to be able to prepare the land where she plans to cultivate organic potatoes.

Balentina wishes to improve her family's life conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic potato seeds and organic manure.

loans.name: Kumkum

texts.en:
Kumkum is a 40-year-old hardworking woman who lives with her husband and their one son in a small village of Kandi, West Bengal. Kumkum is a mother of a son; her son reads in grade 5. Her husband works in a paper shop. Kumkum runs a laundry from her home.

Kumkum washes and presses garments. Her neighbors are the main customers, and she is well known in her community for her good services. Now she wants to rent a shop in the market to serve more customers, but she does not have sufficient money for that.

Thus, Kumkum is seeking a microfinance loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to pay the rent and buy detergents, a new iron machine, etc. for her laundry business. She hopes there will be a larger increase in profit through the utilization of this loan.

Kumkum is very thankful to the lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: to pay the rent and buy materials for her laundry shop.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 23-year-old single lady who established her own mobile phone-selling shop in order to cover her beloved family's increasing needs.

Hala is a hardworking lady who puts so much effort into developing her business so that she can respond to her family's increasing living needs. Today, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with newly released mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards.

She is working hard to open another branch in the future so that she can further develop her family's living.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with newly released mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards.

loans.name: Sayfiddin

texts.ru: Сайфиддин из города Душанбе. Он родился и вырос в городе. Ему сейчас 22 года. Он женат и имеет детей. Сайфиддин единственный сын в семье. Он ответственный, самостоятельный и заботливый сын. У  Сайфиддин среднее образование, по причине он не смог поступит в университет, у отца Сайфиддина не было условия для обучения сына.  Сайфиддин всегда старается зарабатывать и помочь родителям обеспечить семью. Сайфиддин любить водить автомашин. Он решил купить автомашин и заниматься таксистом.  С детства он мечтал стать хорошим и профессиональным водителем. Сайфиддину нужно определенная сумма денег для купли желаемую автомашину. Он будет благодарен на Вашу поддержку. Сайфиддин верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Sayfiddin is from the city of Dushanbe. He was born and raised in the city. Now he is 22 years old. He is married and has children. Sayfiddin is the only son in the family. He is a responsible, independent and caring son. Sayfiddin has a secondary education because he was unable to go to university; Sayfiddin's father was not in a position to educate his son more. Sayfiddin always strives to earn and to help his parents to provide for the family. Sayfiddin loves to drive cars. He has decided to buy a car and work as a taxi driver. He has dreamed of becoming a good and professional driver since his childhood. Sayfiddin needs the indicated sum of money to buy the car he wants. He will be grateful for your support. Sayfiddin believes in you and in your support.

loans.use: to buy a car to provide a taxi service.

loans.name: Zoila Patricia

texts.es: Zoila es una emprendedora de 38 años madre de tres niños de 6, 8 y 9 años respectivamente con 15 años de experiencia en el sector de la confección; desde la comodidad de su hogar administra su taller de confección de uniformes para todos aquellos sectores en los que es necesario su uso como colegios y empresas; complementa esta actividad con la venta de ropa, cosméticos y artículos para el hogar que promociona a través de catálogos. Ella asegura  que el género femenino tiene cada día más participación en la economía del hogar y la comercialización independiente es una oportunidad para contribuir económicamente, pero al mismo tiempo desempeñar los papeles de esposa, madre o ama de casa. Zoila está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos con los que proyecta adquirir una máquina ojaladora herramienta que requiere para el taller de confección y adicionalmente comprar un buen volumen de productos de tocador, ropa, bolsos, artículos para el hogar para aprovechar las buenas ventas que genera la temporada de fin de año. Su expectativa es fortalecer su negocio para generar mayores utilidades que le sirvan para brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Zoila is a 38 year old entrepreneur. She has three children who are 6, 8 and 9 years old. She has 15 years of expereince in clothes making. From the comfort of her own home he manages her workshop where they make uniforms for all sectors where uniforms are worn, for example, in schools and companies. She complements this work with selling clothes, cosmetics and household products which she promotes through catalogues. She says that women are playing more and more of a role in the family economy and selling as an independent person is an opportunity to contribute financially but at the same time she carries our the role of a housewife and mother. Zoila  is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this she plans to get a sewing machines which is a tool that she requires for her sewing workshop and also to buy toiletries, clothes, bags and household items to make the most of the good sales that the end-of-year period brings. Her wish is to strengthen her business in order to create resources in order to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, toiletries, bags and household products.

loans.name: Xyris

texts.en:
Xyris, a 34-year-old mother of five children, helps operate her own cafeteria. In many years of serving food, she has been able to provide for the family. She was able to send her children to school. She had to be determined in her work to provide a better living for her family.

In order to increase sales, she is borrowing a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to purchase raw ingredients to prepare food to sell.

She hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers, and she will sustain her business and work for more profit.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Twesige Mukama Kabarwana Group

texts.en:
Sylivia, whose hand is raised in the group photograph, is a twenty-three-year-old hardworking woman living in Masindi, Uganda.

She operates a salon and works hard to see that it does not collapse. She also engages herself in agriculture. She now wants to have a modern salon so as to get more customers and profits.

Sylivia requests a loan to buy a hair dryer to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer to use in her salon.

loans.name: Malina

texts.en:
Malina hails from Raychenga village in Falakata. She is 33 years old and living with her husband and two daughters. Both of her daughters are students in grades nine and two.

The prime income of Malina's family comes from her husband's car-renting business. Currently he gets a very low income with which it is very difficult to maintain his family. So Malina started a milk- selling business with the help of her husband two years ago by purchasing a cow with their savings. Now she has two cows in her animal husbandry business. Malina supplies this milk to her neighbors who are her main clients. She also sells cow dung, which is widely used as farm manure.

As there is growing demand for milk in the locality, Malina has planned to purchase another dairy cow to sell more milk. So she is requesting a business loan from Kiva's partner BJS.

She hopes for better income to ensure the family’s financial stability and her future plan is to save some money for construction of a concrete house with the increased profit.

Malina is very much thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena owns a habal-habal (motorcycle with extended back seat) transportation service. She earns from the rent from that vehicle. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs.

She is married with two kids. She needs additional capital to support her existing livelihood. With the availability of resources, she could improve her hog raising source of income and try to invest in any possible business opportunities.

Rowena is asking for a loan to purchase fuel and tires, pay for maintenance like changing oil, and to buy feed.

She is determined to handle her sources of income properly to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and tires and pay for maintenance like changing oil, and to buy feed.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 55 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, snacks food and other personal care products.

Violeta has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, snacks food and other personal care products

loans.name: Clara Elena

texts.es: Clara es una microempresaria de 38 años con sus ideas muy claras respecto a su actividad emprendedora; en ningún momento consideró ser una empleada sino trabajar por cuenta propia para no estar sujeta a horarios  y así poder  dedicar más tiempo para sí misma y su hogar. Ella afirma que no tiene horario, pues siempre está dispuesta a atender a su clientela conformada por vecinos, familiares y amigos a quienes les ofrece ropa, calzado, cosméticos,  accesorios entre otros. Clara tramita actualmente su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el fin de tener un capital de trabajo suficiente para atender la demanda que se genera en los últimos meses de año en productos como ropa, calzado y cosméticos. Sus sueño es consolidar su hogar con la compañía de su cónyuge y su bebé por nacer, en el plano de los negocios desea generar ingresos suficientes para adquirir vitrinas y organizar su local comercial.
texts.en: Clara is a small businesswoman. She is 38 years old and has very clear ideas in terms of her entrepreneurial activity. She has never considered being an employee, she has always just wanted to work for herself so that she does not have to work to set hours. This way she has more time for herself and her family. She says that not having set hours means she is always available for her customers who are her neighbours, relatives and friends. She offers them clothes, shoes, cosmetics, accessories and other things. Clara is applying for her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to get enough working capital to meet the demand that the last few months of the year bring for products such as clothes, shoes and cosmetics. Her dreams are to strengthen her household in the company of her husband and her unborn baby. In her business plan she hopes to generate the sufficient income to buy display cabinets and to organise her business premises.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a 52-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is engaged in farming sweet potatoes, and she also buys and sells sweet potatoes from other farmers. She is providing for the needs of her children, ages 16 and 19. Delia is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy meat, seasoning, fish, noodles, cooking oil and vegetables so she can start a restaurant business. This is a chance for her to expand her business and earn a better income for her children. Her profit will be for school fees, healthy diet and business expansion.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasoning, fish, noodles, cooking oil and vegetables

loans.name: Mardon

texts.ru: 52 летный мужчина из района Шахринав, Мардон. У Мардона среднее образование. Он только учился. После окончания школы он начал заниматься сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Мардон с того времени был честным, ответственным и трудолюбивым. Сейчас он женат и отец троих детей. Дети взрослые и самостоятельные. Его жена в районе занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Он во дворе выращивает домашнее животные, и обеспечить семью с молоками и молочными питаниями. Мардон 10 лет назад начал заниматься таксистом. Он перевозом людей зарабатывает на жизнь. Сейчас ему нужно восстановить двигатель автомашины, чтобы не потерять источник дохода и продвигать работу. Мардон обратился за кредитом по причине, что у него нет денежных средств. За счет кредита он купить новый двигатель и необходимые запчасти. Мардон надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
This is Mardon, a 52-year-old man from the Shahrinav region. Mardon has a secondary education. After finishing school he began farming. Ever since, Mardon has been honest, responsible and hard working. Now he is married and the father of three children. His children are grown up and independent. His wife farms in the area. She rears domestic animals in the yard, and provides the family with milk and dairy products.

Mardon began working as a taxi driver 10 years ago. He makes a living by transporting people. Now he needs to repair his car engine so he does not lose his source of income and so he can continue his work. Mardon has applied for a loan because he does not have any money. He will buy a new engine and some essential parts with the loan. Mardon hopes for your help.

loans.use: to repair his taxi car's engine.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 52 years old. He is supporting three children ages of 16, 13, and 2. Daniel has been in the business of raising hogs for many years now. He plans to use his loan to buy feed and more piglets to raise. In the future, Daniel plans to make his business bigger and more sustainable by increasing the number of piglets that he raises. His income will be for family consumption and school fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Carmen Olimpia

texts.es: Doña Carmen, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera,  vive con su hija de 18 años de edad en el municipio de Sonaguera, Colon. Ella cuenta con su propia fuente de ingresos desde hace un año estableció su negocio en su casa de venta de útiles escolares, servicio secretarial e impresiones. De los productos que vende son cuadernos, lápices, papel china, cartulina, pinturas, colores, tepe, pegamento, papel en general y realiza trabajos secretariales e impresos. Sus clientes son los estudiantes de los colegios y escuelas de la zona. Está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de 30,000 lempiras para la compra de papelería, cuadernos, pegamento, colores,  marcadores, tintas, etc. para surtir y vender y realizar trabajos secretariales. Una parte del prestamo lo utilizara para hacerle mejoras al local donde tiene el negocio ya que necesita más estantes y considera que su negocio va mejorar. Ella es muy emprendedora y con esta inversión va poder ayudar con los estudios de su hija hasta que se gradúe.
texts.en:
Doña Carmen is 52 years old. She is a single mother who lives with her 18 year old daughter in the municipality of Sonaguera, Colon. She has had her own source of income for a year, after establishing her business in her home selling school supplies, secretarial services and printing.

Among the products she sells are notebooks, pencils, colored tissue, cardboard, paints, colors, tape, glue, and general paper products. She also offers secretarial services and printing. Her customers are the local school and college students in the area.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 lempiras to buy paper products, notebooks, glue, colors, markers, inks etc. to stock her business and sell, and to offer secretarial services.
She will use one part of the loan to make improvements to the place where she has her business, since she needs more shelves and she believes that her business will improve.

She is very enterprising and with this investment she will be able to help her daughter with her studies until she graduates.

loans.use: to buy paper products, notebooks, glue, colors, markers, inks etc. to sell,  to offer secretarial work, and also to improve the shop.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres De Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mujeres de Buena Vista 
La señora Cruz Elena de 45 años de edad vive en  una colonia muy hermosa del pueblo, tiene dos hijos, es casada y su esposo la apoya en todo momento.  Ella es tejedora y su especialidad son los güipiles típicos, tiene siembra y venta de flores y sus jardines están a un costado de su casa.  Su sueño es seguir luchando por sus hijos y que sigan estudiando para verlos graduados.  Tiene varios pedidos de güipiles pero los hilos que tiene no le alcanzan, por eso ella pide un préstamo para comprar los hilos por caja que se los dan a mejor precio y así tener bonitas ganancias.
texts.en:
Dúo Mujeres de Buena Vista Group

Cruz Elena, aged 45, lives in a very beautiful neighbourhood in her town. She has two children, is married, and enjoys the full support of her husband.

She is a weaver, and specializes in making güipiles (traditional Guatemalan embroidered clothing). She also sells flowers, and has a garden located next to her house. Her dream is to continue fighting for her children, ensure they continue their studies, and to see them graduate.

She has several orders for güipiles, but doesn't have enough thread to finish them all. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy larger quantities of thread at a better price and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies for making traditional fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Almar

texts.en:
Fishing is the most common livelihood in some areas of Iloilo, Philippines. Almar is a 34-year-old man and a resident of Carles, Iloilo. He has been engaged in this kind of business to earn a living for almost 20 years. He is proficient in this business, having been taught how to catch fish at a very young age.

At his age, he dreams to improve his fishing business to uplift his family's livelihood. Thus, he is asking for a loan to buy fishing boat materials such as "tarik" (outriggers of the boat) and "katig" (the tagalog  word for the floats attached to the outriggers (tarik) on both sides of a boat, usually made of bamboos). He also wants to buy gasoline for their boat.

loans.use: to buy "tarik" (outriggers of the boat), "katig" (bamboos) and gasoline

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 56 years old and widowed with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Azucena has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years.

Azucena requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, spices, personal care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Azucena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, spices, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Victoruana

texts.en:
Victoruana is 49 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Victoruana works very hard to provide for them.

Victoruana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Victoruana has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Victoruana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Eliana Paola

texts.es: Eliana es una microempresaria Barranquillera de 28 años con gran capacidad para administrar el dinero de manera correcta, emprendedora y naturalmente dada a las relaciones sociales. Hace a años aceptó la propuesta de asociarse con su señora madre quien se dedicaba a la venta de kits de aseo, actividad que le generaba un buen margen de ganancia; este fue su punto de partida porque al poco tiempo adquirió una vitrina y la surtió con artículos de papelería, accesorios, regalos, detalles etc organizando su miscelánea en su hogar, la cual está abierta de 8:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m. de lunes a sábados y su clientela está conformada en su mayoría por vecinos y conocidos. Ella planea aumentar el surtido de su miscelánea con ropa, calzado, accesorios, detalles y demás, para aprovechar el incremento de la demanda que genera la temporada de fin de año, proyecto que financiará con los recursos de su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Su sueño de prosperidad es organizar su negocio en un local más grande y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eliana is a small-time entrepreneur from Barranquilla. She is 28 years old and very skilled when it comes to managing money. She is also very enterprising, and good with people.

A few years ago Eliana accepted a proposal to work with her mother, who made a living selling cleaning kits. This work provided the pair with a good profit margin, and was Eliana's starting point in business as gradually she purchased a display case and stocked it up with stationery, accessories, gifts and more. Eliana thus opened a miscellany in her home, which is open from 8am until 8pm, Monday to Saturday. Eliana's customer base comprises neighbours and acquaintances.

Eliana wants to stock up her business with clothing, footwear, accessories, small gifts and more in order to take advantage of the increase in demand brought about by the end-of-year festivities. Eliana will finance this with her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Eliana's dream is to prosper and move her business to larger premises. She also wants to give her children a better up-bringing.

loans.use: to stock up her miscellany with clothes, footwear, accessories, small gifts and more.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 40-year-old married mother of three, who has been working in shoe tailoring since 2011. She runs her business from her house, and is working hard to develop it. When her business increases and expands in the future, she would like to move to a bigger place.

Fatima's husband works as a taxi driver and needs to buy a new car to provide his customers' with better service and comfortable car to cover their family's increasing living expenses. Therefore Fatima has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to help her husband. Fatima hopes this loan will help them improve their family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new car for her husband to provide his taxi customers' with better service.

loans.name: Sarifan

texts.en:
Sarifan is a 34-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

Her husband provides services of whitewashing to his customers; sometimes he has to go out of the city as well. Her husband has to sit in the front of a paint dealer’s shop so he can easily find new customers and sometimes he does not find any customers.

Her husband got a new contract for whitewashing but he has no paint brush or rollers for whitewashing.

Sarifan requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy a new paint brush, rollers, kerosene oil, etc.

Her husband’s income is very poor and that is why her family passes their lives in a miserable condition. She wants to change this condition of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new paint brush, rollers, kerosene oil, etc. for her husband's paint shop.

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sarah Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.

Sarah Jane is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional variety of fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Sarah Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional variety of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 33 years old and married and she has three children, all of whom are currently in school.

Hazel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now, and she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Hazel requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 43 years old and has six children. She is married and has six children who are in school.

Vicenta is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Vicenta has been in pig-fattening for ten years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Racquel

texts.en:
Racquel is 36 years old and has four children. Racquel is married and has four children are still in school.

Racquel is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Racquel requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Racquel has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Flora has been in this business for 30 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret Lives in Hoima Uganda. She is a very hardworking woman who works 12 hours a day. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of 4 children and all attend school.She sells used clothes supplemented by selling timber, which businesses have helped her raise more incomes for her family.

She hopes to educate her children up to a degree level. However,stiff competition and inadequate capital has hindered the achievement of her desires. Margret will use the loan facility to buy more clothes for sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una señora con 61 años de edad, tiene cinco hijos ya todos mayores de edad, trabajadora y muy humilde, su sueño siempre había sido ser una gran Psicóloga, pero debido a la ausencia de su esposo quien falleció, no lo pudo hacer realidad, ya que le toco dedicarse completamente a su hijos.

Quiere tomar el servicio de capacitación en cocina, y desea tener su propio negocio, el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos de consumo diario en los hogares.

La adversidad que la ha perseguido no ha sido obstáculo para esta mujer querer salir adelante y realizar sus proyectos. Se le debe apoyar.
texts.en:
Gloria, aged 61, has five grown-up children and is hard-working and very humble. Her dream was to become a great psychologist, but her husband died and she devoted herself completely to her children.

She wants to train to be a chef, and would like to have her own business. She will use the loan to buy everyday household foods.

Despite the misfortunes she has suffered, she still wants to succeed and make her projects a reality. She should be supported.

loans.use: to buy everyday household foods.

loans.name: M. Atif Shehzad

texts.en:
M. Atif Shehzad is 27, so a young and energetic person He has to look after his old parents also but hardly spends any time with his family due to his busy business.

M. Atif Shehzad owns a hardware store in the area of Lahore, Pakistan; he sells hardware goods such as iron nails, nuts, bolt, door lock, door handles, cutters, cutting blades and sanitary goods. His shop situated in the hardware market and it is challenging for him to sell his product among his competitors. Because in his area, there are many industries are available. To cope with the competitors he has to maintain the stock of each spare part so that he could not refuse any customer. He wants to increase the stock in the shop to cope with the demand and for earning maximum profit as well.

Nowadays, he is unable to buy inventory for his shop because he has been spending the income on household expenses now he does not have money to buy finished inventories.
So that he requested a loan to the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he can buy all the important including expensive and cheap hardware goods.

M. Atif Shehzad is tension free after receiving loan because the BRAC showed him a beam of hope in the darkness. He is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy hardware and sanitary goods for his hardware store.

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en:
Aneela is a 32-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three children and her husband has been doing his own business of birds for the past seven years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and to manage the household.

Aneela's husband wants to purchase birds for his business purposes but due to financial constraints her husband is unable to purchase these birds.

Therefore Aneela has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these birds to fulfill the needs of his business, and this will also be good for him to earn maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Aneela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help to increase her husband's birds business.

loans.name: Natacha

texts.fr: Natacha a 25 ans. Elle est célibataire et sans enfant à charge. Elle revend des légumes. Cette activité lui permet de gagner un peu de revenus pour répondre à ses besoins quotidiens. Le crédit l’aide à renouveler ses stocks à temps et être toujours en mesure de répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Natacha is 25 years old. She is single and has no children. She sells vegetables. This business allows her to earn a little income to cover her daily needs. The loan will help her to renew her stock in a timely manner and always be able to respond to the demand of her clientele.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ketelie

texts.fr: Ketelie a 31 ans, elle est mariée et elle a trois enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une petite épicerie qu’elle gère à domicile. Elle vend des produits alimentaires, des produits cosmétiques et d’autres articles divers. Cette activité lui permet de générer des revenus pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et épargner un peu. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Ketelie is 31 years old; she is married and has three children. She is the owner of a little grocery store that she runs in her home. She sells foodstuffs, cosmetics, and various other items. This business permits her to generate income to cover the needs of her family and put aside a little in savings. She is asking for a small loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy some sacks of rice.

loans.name: Abir 1 Group

texts.en:
Sobhiye is the featured borrower for Abir 1 Group. She got together with her other group members to take out this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and livelihoods at the same time.

Sobhiye is a 45-year-old married mother of two. Due to the low income of her husband that is not enough anymore to cover the increasing needs of their family, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a new business selling vegetables and fruit to support her family and provide them with better living conditions. Sobhiye is the lady on the left.

With respect to the other group members, Khouloud is the lady sitting in the middle, and Abir is the lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to start a new business selling vegetables and fruit to support her family.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa and her husband are engaged in fishing business to earn living. They have been doing this for almost 36 years. Aside from fishing, she also runs a sari-sari store business to have additional earnings. Nelfa and her husband work together to provide the needs of their family. They have seven children, five adults and two school aged children ages 20 and 15 years old.

Nelfa is asking a loan to buy fishing nets and fishing rods to improve their catch. She also buys grocery items for her sari-sari store business such as sugar, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink, spices, toiletries, laundry soap, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, chips and candies. In the future, Nelfa dreams to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and fishing rod; sugar, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink, spices, toiletries, laundry soap, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, chips and candies

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is 36 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, Honorata works very hard to provide for them.

Honorata runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Honorata has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, sanitary pads, coffee, sugar, etc. 

In the future, Honorata would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelia is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Nelia has a tailoring  business in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy garments, and other materials needed in her business.

Nelia has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy garments, and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juanita is 62 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Juanita has a general store business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 23000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Juanita has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a married woman, 53 years old with three children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur.

Eva has a food vending business in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish and other materials for her food production business.

Eva has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 47 years old and married and she has eight children, four of whom are in school.

Celsa is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years now, and she has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Celsa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Celsa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is 55 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Eda is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Eda has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from .

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Loa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Loa, born in 1986, is a Thai ethnic woman. She has been participating in the program of M7-MFI since October 2014. She currently lives with her husband, her parents - in -law, her daughter and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation. Her family has almost 1 hectare of land for cultivating coffee and each coffee harvest the income, after deducting cost, is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and and saved a small amount. She wants to buy learning tools and pay for her children’s education fees but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have better conditions for learning and she will work hard to get the money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy learning tools and pay for her children’s education fees.

loans.name: Noong Luong 32 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Inh, 41, is a Thai ethnic woman who is married and has two sons, one daughter and a son-in-law. She lives with her husband and her children in a Thai ethnic traditional house. They mainly rely on agricultural production for a living with plenty of activities such as cultivating rice, fruits, breeding cows, fish, ducks and chickens. Her husband and her son sometimes work for local employers to earn extra income.

Mrs. Inh has always wanted to expand production and this is the fifth time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program. She will use the loan to buy food to feed chickens, ducks and fish. She hopes that she will reap good profit from the investment and will provide better for the family.

Mrs. Inh dreams that her family will soon escape from poverty and have a more sufficient life. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food to feed chickens, ducks and fish.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 35-year-old married woman with four children living in Masindi, Uganda.

She sells motor vehicle spare parts and loves her business because she has managed to look after her family and get basic needs from the profits she gets.

With her high hopes of educating her children, Jacqueline complains of high rental and license fees, yet she needs enough capital to pay her children's school fees on time.

She requests a loan to pay school fees for her children ahead of the promotion term.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es una persona de grandes propósitos en la vida, él es un hombre muy amable, responsable y disciplinado tiene 28 años de edad con una linda familia de 28 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de dos hijas de las edades entre 5 y 8 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad del caserío pochol. Antonio con el deseo de obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia en mejores condiciones de vida, desde hace 12 años se dedica a la  compra y venta de banano por quintal, gracias a su carisma y gran respeto por sus clientes sus productos ya no se dan abasto, por esa razón a decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una cuerda de terreno con cultivo de banano y café esto con el fin de producir más producto y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
Su gran sueño es construir una casa de block he instalar otro negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Antonio has lots of big plans for his life. He is a kind, responsible and disciplined man with a beautiful family. He is 28 years old, single, and has two daughters aged 5 and 8. This lovely family lives in the rural community of Pochol.

In order to earn a living and ensure his family has a decent standard of living, Antonio has worked selling bananas by weight for 12 years. Thanks to his charisma and the great respect his customers have for his produce, he cannot keep up with demand. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy an acre of land for cultivating bananas and coffee, so that he can improve production and respond better to his customers' needs.

His biggest dream is to build a cement block house, where he can open a grocery store, in order to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an acre of land to cultivate bananas and coffee.

loans.name: Iketsetseng Group

texts.en:
Masetla is a 77 year old mother of 5 children and grandmother of 4 aged between 14-6 years. She not only takes care of her children but has to take care of her four young grandchildren and elderly husband of 85 years.

Masetla lives in a traditional hut that is not well ventilated, nor warms up well in winter. She works long hours although difficult with her leg injury to ensure there is enough food for her entire family, some of whom are going to school and only help her on Saturdays and Sundays. She has to wake up very early, between 3am and 4am, during the week to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water and warming the house for all the children before they go to school.

Collecting firewood, setting up the fire and doing the actual cooking demands a lot of her time. Temperatures in the Lesotho highlands are never really high; winters can get very cold and often Masetla has to start the fire inside her hut. Starting a fire releases smog and smoke which when inhaled in large quantities over a period of time can lead to lung diseases, eye problems and in the worst case to death. In these circumstances, life for women like Masetla has been very difficult.

Masetla has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, in order to be able to purchase clean cook stoves which provide her and 13 other people from her village, who are living in similar circumstances. The chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families and that does not require a lot of fuel, which is hard to find in Lesotho, nor expensive paraffin and gas. This stove can be started with the use of very little, readily available biomass like dry twigs and dry cow dung that do not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the homes.

This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones and a mini LED lamp. A life improving package for these people. This stove saves them time to be with their family, saves energy, eliminates the element of toxic inhalation, house burning and has given them the freedom to have a better lit home to see better in the evening while cooking and enables children to do their homework. For stove info please check www.africancleanenergy.com

loans.use: to be able to pay for the ACE cook stove which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel and the time she spends collecting firewood.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 39-year-old married mother of two children, who has been working as a receptionist in a medical center for seventeen years to support her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs.
Elham has a limited monthly salary, and she manages to combine it with her husband's to cover their children education expenses in additional to their daily needs. But, unfortunately their combined incomes aren't enough to cover the increasing living needs.
Thus, for this reason, Elham is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children school tuition fees to provide them with better future.
She hopes to stay in good health and work hard to support her children to provide them in the future with university degrees.

loans.use: to pay for her childrens' school tuition fees to provide them with a better future.

loans.name: María Victoria

texts.es: María es una microempresaria de 27 años que ante la necesidad de generar ingresos para aportar a su hogar  decidió instalar una miscelánea en su casa porque afirma que siempre le ha gustado el comercio; hace un año adquirió un a vitrina que surtió con cosméticos, artículos de papelería, detalles, accesorios, cosméticos y  demás, ha capitalizado parte de sus utilizados y poco a poco ha ido creciendo. Para su negocio no es solo un trabajo, sino que se ha convertido en un estilo de vida y actualmente está tramitando si primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que planea invertir en ropa, calzado, juguetes y demás artículos que generan un buen volumen de ventas en la temporada de fin de año. Su meta es generar las utilidades suficientes para que el futuro pueda comprar su casa propia y adecuar su local comercial.
texts.en:
María is a 27 year old micro-entrepreneur who, faced with the necessity to generate income to contribute to her home, decided to set up a store in her house because she states that she has always liked business. A year ago she bought a display case which she stocked with cosmetics, stationery, small gifts, accessories, and other items. She has capitalized part of her profits and little by little it has been growing. 

Her business is not just a job for her, but it has become a lifestyle and she is now processing her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans on investing this funding in clothing, footwear, toys and other articles that generate a good volume of sales in the end of the year season. Her goal is to generate enough profits so that she can buy her own home in the future and adjust her retail space.

loans.use: to invest in clothing, footwear, toys and more.

loans.name: Sarou's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, Sarou is 31-year-old. She is a mother of five dependent children, two of whom are still in school and the other three are too young to go to school. She can earn income to support on her living conditions via rice cropping and cassava growing. She has been involved in farming for about 13 years and she can save from her daily income about 3 USD per day for her family’s living. Her main challenge that she faced in this year, was that insects have destroyed her rice farm and it made her rice produce poor.

In a group of three, she is the group leader seeking a new loan. This is her second cycle with VisionFund and she fully repaid her past loan completely. Her family’s living has improved gradually via the previous loan. Sarou will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, organic pesticide to help her cassava farm grow well and she will use a part of her loan to pay for labor fees, to improve her farm to get good yield. She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her farm in the future and support her children’s education on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, organic pesticide to input her cassava farm to grow her crop fruitfully and enable her to earn more income to save for future need.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 33 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. With her 3 children. her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Yasmeen is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the house hold.

She is needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil and etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: she wanted to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay the rent of the land where she sows her crops.

loans.name: Pervaiz Ali

texts.en:
Pervaiz Ali is a 36-years-old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with his spouse and four children.
He has been running a small papers cutting press for many years and been cutting papers according to contract. His practice to purchase raw papers bundles from wholesalers and cut to order through his press machine for reselling purpose. In this he is generating income for many years and cherishing his entire family.

He wants to enlarge his business so he can easily generate more income than the past so he can cherish his children and can bear the medical expenses of his parents.
Therefore, Pervaiz Ali has requested a Kiva loan so he can buy more bundles of raw papers to cut into specific sizes for reselling. In this way; he can easily generate additional income for his family.
Pervaiz Ali deserves Kiva support; he hopes that the Kiva lenders will support him; he is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of raw papers for cutting into specific sizes then sell into the market.

loans.name: Nasawang Group

texts.en: Xengxom’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Xengxom and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Xengxom and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Xengxom’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Dastan

texts.en:
Dastan is 17-years-old freshman in Software Engineering Program at AUCA. His dream is to become an expert in computer science. His idols are Steve Jobs and Bill Gates. His dream is to create something like similar program for the benefit of all mankind that millions of people of the Globe could use.

Dastan’s hobby is to take part in intellectual contests. When he was a student of 11th form, his school-team took part in AUCA’s intellectual competition called “Brain Ring”. He was one of 5 in his team, who were announced as the winners of competition and won the Grand Prize for their school. His next plan is to be an active in various Debates at AUCA and represent his university abroad.

Family plays a great role in Dastan’s life. He thinks that it is in his genes to be a technician as his father is a civil engineer. From childhood he was told many interesting things and facts on technology by father what raised a great love for exact sciences and hi-tech in him. His mother keeps house and takes care of his younger sister. As his father is the only bread-winner in his family, they are facing some financial difficulties in their family.

Dastan is happy to take a Kiva loan for his tuition fee now and repay it back when he graduates. Statistics show that AUCA Alumni are so in demand in Kyrgyzstan and abroad, so Dastan hopes to achieve academic goals at the university and be one of them.

loans.use: to pay for his university Bachelor Degree in Software Engineering Department.

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Heang is 39 years old. She is a mother blessed with four children and two of whom are still in school. She does rice farming as her main source of income to support her living condition for 21 years. Moreover, she can get more income via working as a labor worker. She did not get good yield from her rice farm, because it has destroyed by insect and this is her main challenge in earning income recently.

She leads a group of three members to seek for a new loan with VisionFund and this is her first loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a decent motorbike in order to go to work on time. She wishes that she can save her time more than before from her work, so she can take more time to support on her rice field to get more yields. She hopes she can get more income to upgrade her living condition and support on her children’s education on time.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike in order to drive her to work on time and regularly. .

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: M. Aslam

texts.en:
M. Aslam is 40-year-old married man, and he has four children. He is living in a populated area and he knows about the requirements of people in this area.
He is a market vendor and sells seasonal vegetables from his birth place in a central bazaar and also from his home. M. Aslam has 15 years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers.

He chose this business because it is profitable and brings stable income to cherish his children. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy and many national dishes are made of vegetables. He wants to increase the stock on daily basis so that he can maximum sold the vegetable till evening and can generate maximum reward for his efforts.
M. Aslam applied for a loan to purchase more vegetables and thus increase his monthly turnover.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable for his greengrocery business.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lina is 44 years old and has six children who are in school.

Lina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lina requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, meat, spices, etc..

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lina has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Lina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Girlie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients and utensils for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Girlie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her food vending business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 31 years old and has one child. Irene is married and has one child still in school.

Irene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Irene has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 61 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Myrna aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Acleo

texts.en: Acleo who used the previous loan to buy materials to construct his house and is so far happy by the construction progress. He is requesting another loan to buy more building materials, like cement and timber to construct his house. He is a 63-year-old man married with six children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda and his main business is cocoa buying and selling. He also gets some income from his cocoa garden and construction. All this has helped him to look after his family. He has gardens of cocoa and he is very hard working to see increase in his harvest and therefore bigger sales.

loans.use: to buy more building materials like cement and timber to construct his house.

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola is aged 47 years and lives in Bundibugyo Uganda with 4 children, with four grand children. She is married, very hard working and engaged in buying and selling cocoa as her major economic activity. She gets additional income from selling bananas from her plantation as a farmer.

She started the cocoa business in 2010 and now believes that through trading and farming, her family is to have a better future. Her major challenge is that of high transport and storage costs, but she wants to continue with business to raise school fees for the children. She has requested for a loan to buy cocoa for resale to her customers.

loans.use: to add capital in her cocoa business by buying cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a well known businessman mainly dealing in coffee trade in Nyakabingo village, Bushenyi District. He started this project in 1999 and he has managed to sustain his family of six children. He also deals in coffee farming as another source of income to support his family. Mr. Wilson was born in 1970 and is married. His children are aged 18, 16, 14,12,10 and 8 years old respectively. All of them are in school.

He has applied for a loan of ugx5,000,000= (Five million shillings only) to trade in coffee and to buy fertilizers for maturing his coffee shamba to increase the yields and family sustainability. He is an honest man at work, on his business and he works for 10 hours a day. He sales to coffee factories around Bushenyi District. He is faced with the challenge of competition that affects the harvest. His vision is to build a good and big house and he is honest.

loans.use: to buy coffee for trade and also buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Shafiq's Group

texts.en:
Shafiq is a 54-year-old lady, and she is a responsible mother of six children. She is a very poor and needy woman. Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her entire family. He has been doing this business for many years and has been using wooden planks and bamboo, which have deteriorated over time.

Now her husband is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Shafiq requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboo to continue his business again. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and that her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.

Shafiq is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering material.

loans.use: to buy new sheltering material, such as wooden boards, bamboo, etc., for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 68 лет, но, не смотря на свой преклонный возраст, она занимается изготовлением тюбетеек, национального головного убора мужчин. Она более 20 лет занимается этим ремеслом, которому в свое время обучила ее мать. Всю свою продукцию она выставляет на местный рынок. Ее товар всегда пользуется большим спросом. В этом деле ей всегда помогает ее невестка. Гавхар и ее семья хотят сделать в доме ремонт и расширить комнату, где она изготовляет тюбетейки. Именно с этой целью Гавхар обратилась за кредитом и надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Gavhar is a resident of the city of Istaravshan. She is 68 years old but, despite her advanced age, she manufactures skull-caps, the national men's head wear. She has been working in this profession, which her mother taught her at the time, for over 20 years. She sells all she produces at the local market. Her goods are always in high demand. Her daughter-in-law always helps her with the business.

Gavhar and her family want to renovate their house and extend the room where she manufactures the skull-caps. It is with this aim that Gavhar has applied for a loan, and she hopes for your support.

loans.use: to renovate her house and extend the room where she manufactures skull-caps.

loans.name: Mkonga Road Group

texts.en:
Zawadi who is in her mid 30's is single with three children, two of them are in school and the other one is still small. She has been selling coconuts, onions and potato for seven years now. She works from 6am to 2pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Zawadi 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing coconuts and onions stocks and started selling potatoes. She is doing fine with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees,loan repayment, build a house and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increasing on business by buying sacks of coconuts, sacks of onions and sacks of potatoes to meet her customer's demand. She dreams of opening another business of selling vegetables.

Zawadi will share this loan with her loan group Mkonga Road which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase business by buying sacks of coconuts, sacks of onions and sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Gul'chehra

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Гульчехра. Она замужем и у нее двое детей. Ей 36 лет. Ее старшая дочка помогает Гульчехре в работе. Дочери 15 и 10 лет. Муж предоставляет услуги такси. Гульчехра трудолюбивая и очень хорошая женщина. Она всегда работает и старается во благо семьи и детей. Гульчехра уже 6 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Она берет заказы на шитье у себя дома. Для нее такая работа очень удобная, потому что она может одновременно заниматься домашними делами и зарабатывать деньги. Гульчехра научалась шить у своей соседки. И по сей день использует ее советы в процессе работы. 
  Причина, по которой Гульчехра обратилась за кредитом, является купля швейной машинки. Для нее сейчас швейная машинка очень необходимо и Гульчехра надеется на помощь с Вашей стороны, чтобы купить их.
texts.en:
This woman is called Gul'chehra. She is married and she has two children. She is 36 years old. Her eldest daughter helps Gul'chehra in her work. Her daughters are 15 and 10 years old. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Gul'chehra is a hard-working and very good woman. She always works and tries hard for the good of the family and the children. Gul'chehra has been sewing women's clothing to order for six years. She takes orders for sewing at home. This work is very convenient for her because she can simultaneously do housework and earn money. Gul'chehra learned how to sew from her neighbor, and to this day she uses her advice in the course of her work.

The reason why Gul'chehra has applied for a loan is to buy a sewing machine. A sewing machine is essential for her at present, and Gul'chehra hopes for help on your part in order to buy it.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is in his late 30s and is married with three children in school. He has been selling bed sheets since 2002. He works from 10am to 7.30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Clement's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on his bed sheets stock and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, bought a TV set, sofa set, a radio, beds, mattress and covered household expenses.

He will use this loan to buy the fast moving types of bed sheets especially cotton ones to meet his customers' requests. He dreams of buying and selling maize grains and beans from up country.

Clement will make sure he pays his loan within the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving types of bed sheets, especially cotton ones to meet his  customers' requests.

loans.name: Kimchhorn's Group

texts.en:
A father blessed with two schoolchildren living in Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Kimchhorn is 36 years old. He grows tobacco as his main source of income to support his family’s living. Moreover, he earns more income via owning a horse cart. His rubber did not grow well and he has to sell it at a lower price than last year, so this is his main challenge. He has involved his businesses for 18 years and he can save from his income about 10 USD per day.

For Kimchhorn, this is his second cycle with VisionFund and he fully paid back his past loan. The previous loan could help his family's living condition getting better than before. He leads a group of three to take a new loan.

As the group leader, he will manage his portion of the loan to purchase fertilizer to improve on tobacco farming. Kimchhorn hopes that he can get good yield from his farmland to get more income for his family’s living and he can support on his children’s education as well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to grow his tobacco well and increase the yield, so that he can increase his income to save for future need.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз интеллигентная женщина из Бохтарского района. Ей 32 года она замужем. Работает Дилафруз преподавателем в школе №3. Ученики любят ее, а сотрудники уважают. Муж Дилафруз в данный момент находится на заработках в России. Не смотря на то, что Дилафруз работает в школе, у нее есть свое дехканское хозяйство. В этом деле ей помогает ее старший сын. Несмотря на то, что у них есть дополнительный источник дохода, накопленных средств не хватило на ремонт жилья. Дилафруз просит у Вас помощи, чтобы до наступления холодов успеть отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Dilafruz is an intelligent woman from the Bohtar region. She is 32 years old and she is married. Dilafruz works as a teacher in school No. 3. Her pupils love her, and her colleagues respect her. Dilafruz's husband is currently away earning in Russia. Despite Dilafruz's work in a school, she has her own farm. Her eldest son helps her with this work. Despite having an additional source of income, they do not have enough savings to renovate their house. Dilafruz is asking you for help in order to finish renovating her house before the cold weather begins.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Leonora has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional ingredients, like meat, fish, and vegetables.

Leonora has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients, like meat, fish, and vegetables.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухайё 36 летняя женщина района Шахринав. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Мухайё на районе живет вместе семьей. Она серьезная женщина. Мухайё дома предоставляет услуги портнихи на заказ. Она 3 года занимается этой деятельности. Мухайё выбрала эту деятельностью, потому что ее сестра раньше занималась этой сфере деятельностью. В швейном деле ей нравиться ежедневный доход и общаться с новыми клиентами. Мухайё решила расширить деятельность и привлечь больше клиентов. За счет кредита она хочет купить желаемую швейную машинку. С такими планами она обратилась за кредитом. Ее мечта в будущем открыть свое ателье по шитью национальной женской одежды.
texts.en:
